original: nges pa yod pa ma yin te des na ma grub pa'i phyir de yang mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa yod pa ma yin te des na ma grub pa'i phyir de yang mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no certainty, therefore, because it is not established, it is not a characteristic.

original: @38b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @38b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang phyir thun mong ba la sogs pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang phyir thun mong ba la sogs pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Because direct perception and inference do not exist for the common and so on.

original: 'di la yang gtan tshigs su mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang gtan tshigs su mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, direct perception is the reason.

original: rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang 'di nyid yin no zhes gzhung phyi ma 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang 'di nyid yin no zhes gzhung phyi ma 'chad pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason why inference does not apply. This is the explanation of the later text.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis rig par bya ba mngon sum gyis ma bzung bar bstan nas rjes su dpag pas kyang ma bzung bar ston pa gsum pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis rig par bya ba mngon sum gyis ma bzung bar bstan nas rjes su dpag pas kyang ma bzung bar ston pa gsum pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having shown that what is to be known by oneself and others is not apprehended by direct perception, the third verse shows that it is not apprehended by inference.

original: gzhan gyi spu ldang la sogs pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi spu ldang la sogs pa //
translated: The inference of others, such as the arising of body hair,

original: 'bras mthong phyir na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras mthong phyir na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: is seen as a result.

original: sdu gu gang zhig bdag gis mthong ba de nyid 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes thun mong pa nyid ni 'bras bu spu ldang ba la rjes su dpag pas grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdu gu gang zhig bdag gis mthong ba de nyid 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes thun mong pa nyid ni 'bras bu spu ldang ba la rjes su dpag pas grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the commonality is established by inference from the effect, the bristling of the hairs.

original: lan ni rang nyid mthong la rjes su dpag pa med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rang nyid mthong la rjes su dpag pa med ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response is that there is no inference from one‚Äôs own seeing.

original: 'bras bu spu ldan pa las ni ji ltar 'dis mthong ba de bzhin du 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes grub tu chug / ngas mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes ni rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu spu ldan pa las ni ji ltar 'dis mthong ba de bzhin du 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes grub tu chug / ngas mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'dis kyang mthong ngo zhes ni rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: From the effect, the bristling of the hairs, it is established that this person sees just as that person sees. But it cannot be understood that what I see is also seen by this person.

original: de dang 'dra bar mthong ba las kyang spu ldang ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar mthong ba las kyang spu ldang ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bristling of the hairs arises from seeing something similar to that.

original: gal te yul de la gnas pa'i lus mdzes pa gzhan dag re re kho nas mthong bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te yul de la gnas pa'i lus mdzes pa gzhan dag re re kho nas mthong bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If the beautiful bodies of other people who are in that place are seen by each one, how is that?

original: 'o na rab rib la sogs pa ltar bag chags mtshungs bar sad pa'i skyes pa bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin mod de ji ltar thun mong pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'o na rab rib la sogs pa ltar bag chags mtshungs bar sad pa'i skyes pa bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa nyid yin mod de ji ltar thun mong pa nyid yin /
translated: Well then, just like the eye disease, etc., the aspect of the cognition that is individually determined is the self-existence of the arousing of the latent potentialities in common.

original: tshul 'di ni rab tu grags pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni rab tu grags pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This method is not present in the inference of the effect that is well known.

original: 'bras bu du ba mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu du ba mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe effect is seen as smoke‚Äù is the example.

original: dpe la mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid de nyid do //
analyzed: dpe la mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid de nyid do //
translated: The self-existence of the seen is the nature of its own characteristics.

original: khyad par rig pa min zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid rig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rig pa min zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid rig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not known as a distinction‚Äù means that the seen is not known as the nature of its own characteristics.

original: gal te dpe la yod pa dang phyogs la yod pa'i du ba gang yin pa de gnyis tha dad pa yin pa des na phyogs la yod pa'i me mi sgrub ste 'on kyang spyi yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dpe la yod pa dang phyogs la yod pa'i du ba gang yin pa de gnyis tha dad pa yin pa des na phyogs la yod pa'i me mi sgrub ste 'on kyang spyi yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: If the smoke that exists in the example and the smoke that exists in the subject are different, then the fire that exists in the subject is not established, but rather a generality.

original: der du ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der du ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere, smoke‚Äù is the doubt.

original: lan ni spu ldang ba 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni spu ldang ba 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThis bristling of the hairs.‚Äù

original: spu ldang ba yang tha snyad pa nyid pas ji ltar de las kyang rang gis mthong ba 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spu ldang ba yang tha snyad pa nyid pas ji ltar de las kyang rang gis mthong ba 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the arising of the hairs is conventional, how is the establishment of what is seen by oneself from that?

original: 'o na gcig tu mngon par zhen pa las thun mong pa nyid du 'grub po zhes gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yang gsungs so //üîΩgcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa yang shes @39a * //
analyzed: 'o na gcig tu mngon par zhen pa las thun mong pa nyid du 'grub po zhes gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yang gsungs so // gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa yang shes @39a * //
translated: But if it is said that the establishment of the commonality is from the adherence to oneness, then the adherence to oneness is also stated.

original: pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The adherence to oneness is not different from consciousness.

original: 'on kyang de gcig tu mngon par zhen pa de ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de gcig tu mngon par zhen pa de ni rig pa ste /
translated: However, that adherence to oneness is cognition,

original: shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa kho na'o //
translated: it is only consciousness.

original: de ni rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir de las kyang thun mong ba nyid kyang ji ltar 'grub snyam na dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir de las kyang thun mong ba nyid kyang ji ltar 'grub snyam na dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since that is also present in the hairs and so on that are observed by those with eye disease, how is the establishment of the commonality even from that? This is the thought.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsdu ba gal te ga la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsdu ba gal te ga la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain this very verse, the summary of the doubt is stated: ‚ÄúIf so, how?‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is the reply.

original: 'di nyid bsal bar byed pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsal bar byed pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúIn that case, . . .‚Äù

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang /
translated: Even in the case of the hairs and so on perceived by one with eye disease,

original: gal te de ltar na yang rab rib can gyis dmigs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi thun mong yin no snyam du dogs pa na gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang rab rib can gyis dmigs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi thun mong yin no snyam du dogs pa na gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that the pot and so on perceived by one with eye disease is common to all, then the response is ‚ÄúMoreover . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù means one with eye disease.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means the doubt of another.

original: 'di la tshad ma med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no valid cognition in this case‚Äù is the philosophical view.

original: skyes bu gnyis pas kyang de nyid 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyis pas kyang de nyid 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe second person also has no valid cognition in this case‚Äù has been explained.

original: thams cad kyis lta ci smos bum pa la sogs pa ni thun mong du grub pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis lta ci smos bum pa la sogs pa ni thun mong du grub pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe pot and so on are not established as common to all, let alone to everyone‚Äù is stated in ‚ÄúThe one with eye disease . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: tshabs cher nyams par gyur na thams cad la mdog dang dbyibs mi mngon par dung kha'i rnam pa nyid du mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: tshabs cher nyams par gyur na thams cad la mdog dang dbyibs mi mngon par dung kha'i rnam pa nyid du mthong ba yin te /
translated: If it is greatly impaired, then in all cases, color and shape are not perceived, and it is seen as just the form of a conch shell.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa /
translated: For example, a pot, etc.

original: thun mong snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thun mong snang ba ma yin no //
translated: is not a commonly appearing object.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: gal te dbang po zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThe so-called sense faculty is not a commonly appearing object,‚Äù

original: thun mong ba nyid ma yin pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid ma yin pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
translated: there is no fault of not being a commonly appearing object.

original: dbang po'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: dbang po'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúThe sense faculty,‚Äù

original: mi bden pa'i lan zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i lan zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: and the other‚Äôs reply is, ‚ÄúIt is not a real sense faculty.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sum 'byin pa'o snyam pa min na zhes bya ba ni de nyid bsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sum 'byin pa'o snyam pa min na zhes bya ba ni de nyid bsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The third reply is, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not a sense faculty.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta bur thun mong ba nyid ma grub pa des na'o //üîΩcung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bur thun mong ba nyid ma grub pa des na'o // cung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúBecause it is not established as a commonly appearing object in that way.‚ÄùüîΩThe other‚Äôs reply is, ‚ÄúIt is not a real sense faculty.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúIt is not a real sense faculty.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is stated in the line beginning ‚ÄúBy another . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The object of perception is the object of perception by another.

original: ci'i phyir gang zhig gis kyang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang zhig gis kyang zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is stated in the line beginning ‚ÄúBy another . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point here is this.

original: gang zhig gang gis rang bzhin du ma dmigs pa @39b de ni de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis rang bzhin du ma dmigs pa @39b de ni de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is not perceived as having a certain nature by a certain cognition is not established as having that nature by that cognition.

original: dper na sngon po la ser po'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la ser po'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
translated: For example, a patch of blue is not established as having the nature of yellow by that cognition.

original: snang ba yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The perception of an object is not perceived as the object of perception by another.üîΩThis is the perception.

original: ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that this is not established.

original: chos can snang ba la gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid ma dmigs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can snang ba la gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid ma dmigs par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subject, the perception, is established as not being perceived as the object of perception by another.

original: des na med par nges pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na med par nges pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, anticipating the qualm that one might think that this establishes the nonexistence of the object of perception, the text says ‚ÄúIf you think . . . ‚Äù

original: de'i ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the qualm.

original: yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the object.

original: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of the object of the cognition of another is not the object of the cognition of another,

original: 'o na gzhan nges gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur te mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan nges gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin dmigs par ji ltar 'gyur te mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: then how could the object of the cognition of another be perceived as the nature of the object of the cognition of another? It could not be perceived.

original: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the object of the cognition of another.

original: 'o na ci zhig mi dmigs she na /üîΩgzhan gyis dmigs bya nyid du ni //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig mi dmigs she na / gzhan gyis dmigs bya nyid du ni //
translated: What is not perceived?üîΩThe nature of the object of the cognition of another.

original: zhes gsungs so// 'di bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i ngo bo las ni dngos po'i ngo bo las so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so// 'di bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i ngo bo las ni dngos po'i ngo bo las so //
translated: The conception that is the opposite of that is ‚Äúfrom the nature of the thing.‚Äù

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The second position is stated: ‚ÄúIf it is the nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po dmigs pa na ji ltar ma dmigs /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po dmigs pa na ji ltar ma dmigs /
translated: If the nature of the object of the cognition of another is the nature of the thing, then how could the thing not be perceived when it is perceived?

original: des na gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid du ma dmigs so zhes bya bar mi 'thad do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid du ma dmigs so zhes bya bar mi 'thad do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to think that ‚Äúit is not observed as the observed object of another.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang dang po la brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyi ngo bo dmigs par bya ba nyid don gyi rang bzhin las gzhan du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: phyogs dang dang po la brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyi ngo bo dmigs par bya ba nyid don gyi rang bzhin las gzhan du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: The first position is stated: ‚ÄúIf it is the nature of another . . .‚Äù If the observed object is the nature of another, the nature of the object is different from the nature of the object.

original: don gyi ngo bo de gzhan gyis dmigs par ji ltar gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo de gzhan gyis dmigs par ji ltar gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: How could the nature of the object be observed by another? It could not!

original: gal te des dngos po'i dngos po nyid na 'o na ci zhig dmigs par bya ba nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: gal te des dngos po'i dngos po nyid na 'o na ci zhig dmigs par bya ba nyid ces smos so //
translated: If it is the reality of the thing, then what is the observed object?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis ni dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs kyi don de ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis ni dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs kyi don de ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the observed object is observed by another, but the object is not.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang gang zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang gang zhig yin snyam na /
translated: What is that nonobservation?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object.

original: de nyid mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: That itself is the nonobservation,

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: but not another.

original: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from that.

original: 'o na gzhan gyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is perceived by another,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven so . . . .‚Äù

original: dmigs pa nyid las tha dad par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid las tha dad par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it were different from the object of perception.

original: 'o na gang zhig dmigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig dmigs she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is perceived?‚Äù

original: rang rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs @40a * //
analyzed: rang rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs @40a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEach . . . .‚Äù

original: pa'o ; / gang gi phyir de ni thams cad kyis dmigs pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs par bya ba yang rang rang la nges pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: pa'o ; / gang gi phyir de ni thams cad kyis dmigs pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs par bya ba yang rang rang la nges pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it is not perceived by all, and because the object of perception is determined for each,

original: thun mong du dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: thun mong du dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: there is no common object of perception.

original: ma dmigs pa'i phyir na de nyid don yin gyi gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i phyir na de nyid don yin gyi gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because it is not perceived, it is said that ‚Äúthat itself is the object, and there is no other.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent from the object of perception‚Äù is what is meant.

original: bden te phyi rol gyi don ni don byed par nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te phyi rol gyi don ni don byed par nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is true that external objects are not able to perform a function,

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang rigs pa 'ga' zhig nyid ni 'dod chags pa rigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi don byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang rigs pa 'ga' zhig nyid ni 'dod chags pa rigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi don byed pa yin /
translated: but even so, the appearance as blue and so on is the object that performs a function, which is of the nature of reasoning, for some.

original: don byed la 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed la 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all of them are able to do so.

original: des na nus pa dang mi nus pa'i dbang gis yod pa dang med par rnam par 'jog pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na nus pa dang mi nus pa'i dbang gis yod pa dang med par rnam par 'jog pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is on the basis of their ability or inability that we posit their existence or nonexistence.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs la ni shes pa rang rig pa la lkog tu gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa med pas gnyis nyid nyams so zhes brjod pa ni rang rig tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs la ni shes pa rang rig pa la lkog tu gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa med pas gnyis nyid nyams so zhes brjod pa ni rang rig tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the system of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra, since consciousness is not hidden to itself, there is no inference that has it as its object, and so the two truths are undermined.

original: gal te rgyud gzhan gyis shes pa lkog tu gyur pa na de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas shes gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyud gzhan gyis shes pa lkog tu gyur pa na de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas shes gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the consciousness of another mind is hidden, then there would be an inference that has it as its object.

original: rang gi rgyud la ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la sogs par snang ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bzung bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la sogs par snang ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bzung bar byas pa yin te /
translated: In one‚Äôs own mindstream, the two, the appearance as physical action and so on and the consciousness characterized by desire and so forth, are taken to be the entity of cause and effect.

original: de na gzhan la 'bras bu mthong ba las shes pa de rjes su dpog pa yin na /
analyzed: de na gzhan la 'bras bu mthong ba las shes pa de rjes su dpog pa yin na /
translated: If consciousness is inferred from seeing the effect in another,

original: de yang ji ltar zhes bya bar tshad ma snyam du gang gis 'dzin te /üîΩci rigs pa gnyis po de nyid kyis yin nam /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhes bya bar tshad ma snyam du gang gis 'dzin te / ci rigs pa gnyis po de nyid kyis yin nam /
translated: how is that apprehended as valid knowledge?

original: 'on te de'i rjes las byung ba'i dran pas yin //
analyzed: 'on te de'i rjes las byung ba'i dran pas yin //
translated: Is it by the two types of correct evidence or is it by memory that arises from that?

original: re zhig rig pa gnyis po de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rig pa gnyis po de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by the two types of correct evidence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang tsam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang tsam zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said, ‚Äúonly itself.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gang gi tshe rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gang gi tshe rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúWhen the cause is not seen.‚Äù

original: sngar mngon sum gyi rig pa'i rgyu ni nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i dran pas phyi nas shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: sngar mngon sum gyi rig pa'i rgyu ni nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i dran pas phyi nas shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to the qualm that later cognition is knowledge is:

original: gal te rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gal te rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf the cause . . .‚Äù

original: / rjes dpag pa'i zhes bya ba ni dran pas so //
analyzed: / rjes dpag pa'i zhes bya ba ni dran pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúInference‚Äù is memory.

original: lan ni de tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan ni de tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúAt that time . . .‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba'i dus su ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du ma shes na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dus su ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du ma shes na /
translated: If at the time of experience the cause of the desire is not known,üîΩhow could it be known now through inference? It could not.

original: da ltar rjes su dpag pa las shes pa ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid dog la te dran pa de da ltar yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: da ltar rjes su dpag pa las shes pa ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid dog la te dran pa de da ltar yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt that memory present now?

original: des na de yang de kho na ltar yin @40b no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: des na de yang de kho na ltar yin @40b no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to the qualm that it is just as it is is:üîΩ‚ÄúPreviously . . .‚Äù

original: sngar ni zhes bya ba'o gsungs so de'i shes pa da ltar yod pa yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni zhes bya ba'o gsungs so de'i shes pa da ltar yod pa yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of that is present now, but it is not that.

original: shes pa yod pa tsam gyis shes bya yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lam brjod pa ni shes te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa tsam gyis shes bya yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lam brjod pa ni shes te zhes gsungs so //
translated: But the mere existence of consciousness does not entail the existence of the object of consciousness.

original: rgyu'i shes pa de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ji ltar rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i shes pa de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ji ltar rig par 'gyur te /
translated: How can the cognition of the cause be known to be the cause of that?

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It cannot!

original: 'on te gang gi tshe yod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa ni snga ma nyid du zhes bya'i'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe yod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa ni snga ma nyid du zhes bya'i'o //
translated: If you think that it is not inferred when it exists, the response is ‚Äúprior to that.‚Äù

original: gal te yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If this fault were to arise, namely, that existence is inferred,

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa la rjes su dpog pa don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni ma yin te mngon sum gyis rig phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa la rjes su dpog pa don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni ma yin te mngon sum gyis rig phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: then the response would be that inference is pointless when there is awareness through perception. But the response is not that, rather it is ‚Äúbecause of awareness through perception.‚Äù

original: 'on te sngon gyi rig pa la yang mngon sum gyis ma rig pa'i snga ma nyid yod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te sngon gyi rig pa la yang mngon sum gyis ma rig pa'i snga ma nyid yod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no snyam du dgongs pa ni /
translated: If you think that prior awareness is also the object of inference because of the existence of prior non-awareness through perception,

original: de'i snga ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i snga ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: then the response is ‚Äúprior to that.‚Äù

original: de'i snga ma nyid rjes su dpag gis rig pa yin no zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i snga ma nyid rjes su dpag gis rig pa yin no zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The former is known by inference.

original: ji ltar snga ma nyid mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar snga ma nyid mi srid ce na /
translated: How is the former impossible?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By direct perception.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because it is contradicted by direct perception.

original: der ni snga ma nyid la'o //
analyzed: der ni snga ma nyid la'o //
translated: There means in the former.

original: 'o na de nyid las de 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid las de 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Well then, it is established by that.

original: des zhes smos te /
analyzed: des zhes smos te /
translated: That is said.

original: dran pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Memory is valid knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rang rig phyir na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rang rig phyir na'o //
translated: Why? Because it is reflexive awareness.

original: de ltar dran pas rgyu nyid du nges pa gsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar dran pas rgyu nyid du nges pa gsal nas /
translated: Thus, having clarified the ascertainment of memory as the cause,

original: 'bras bu nyid du shes pa yang sel ba ni gang gi phyir ba tsam de rang rig pa tsam la mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du shes pa yang sel ba ni gang gi phyir ba tsam de rang rig pa tsam la mngon sum yin no //
translated: the understanding of it as the effect is also eliminated. Because of that mere reflexive awareness, it is direct perception.

original: rang rig la ni bdag nyid rig pa la'o //
analyzed: rang rig la ni bdag nyid rig pa la'o //
translated: Reflexive awareness is self-awareness.

original: de'i phyir dran pa des da ltar ba de rig pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa des da ltar ba de rig pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that memory does not exist for the present.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: gzhan gyi 'bras zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras zhes gsungs so //
translated: The result of another.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because the status of being the effect of another is not established.

original: da ni rtog ge ba dga' bar bya ba'i gzhal bya'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rtog ge ba dga' bar bya ba'i gzhal bya'i rnam par rtog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, the statement of the conceptual differentiation of the object of the syllogism for the delight of the logicians is:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the entity of cause and effect.

original: gnyi ga yod pa'am med pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yod pa'am med pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the entity of cause and effect does not exist in either the existent or the nonexistent.

original: re zhig 'bras bu med pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu med pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: First, in regard to the position that the effect does not exist,

original: rgyu gnyi ga 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu gnyi ga 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: the statement that neither cause nor effect exist at all is:üîΩThe non-existent is not the effect of the non-existent.üîΩThe non-existent is not the cause of the existent.üîΩThe non-existent is not the cause of the non-existent.üîΩThe existent is not the effect of the existent.üîΩThe existent is not the cause of the existent.

original: med pa rta yi rva nyid la //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa rta yi rva nyid la // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The existent is not the cause of the non-existent.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Here, the statement of the opponent‚Äôs objection is:üîΩIf it is utterly non-existent,

original: gal te de ni gtan med phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ni gtan med phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how can it be the effect of that?

original: rta'i rva de la'o //
analyzed: rta'i rva de la'o //
translated: The meaning is: how can that non-existent horn of the horse be the effect of that?

original: 'o na 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the effect?

original: bshad pa sngar med pa ni 'bras bu min pa min te /
analyzed: bshad pa sngar med pa ni 'bras bu min pa min te /
translated: The explanation is: that which did not exist previously is not non-effect;

original: 'bras bu kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is just effect. This is the meaning.

original: @41a * // lan 'di yang lan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: @41a * // lan 'di yang lan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the answer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yod na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it exists.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: That is, the effect.

original: ci'i phyir med pa la snga na med pa mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med pa la snga na med pa mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable that the nonexistent is prior to the existent?

original: med pa'i ri bong rva la ni //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa'i ri bong rva la ni // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The horn of an ox is nonexistent.

original: ri bong gi rva ni med pa nyid kyis sngar med pa dang bral ba yin no ;
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni med pa nyid kyis sngar med pa dang bral ba yin no ;
translated: The horn of a rabbit is nonexistent, and therefore it is not prior to the existent.

original: /'bras bu yang med pa nyid yin pa des na snga ma med pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'bras bu yang med pa nyid yin pa des na snga ma med pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect is nonexistent, and therefore it is not prior to the existent.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: Seeing is anticipating an objection.

original: 'bras bu yod pa nyid du shes pas na snga ma med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa nyid du shes pas na snga ma med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: If the effect is known to exist, then the prior nonexistence of the cause is understood.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: But not otherwise.

original: lan ni phan tshun bsten par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni phan tshun bsten par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúMutual dependence.‚Äù

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ji srid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ji srid ces bya'o //
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúIf the effect existed first.‚Äù

original: ji srid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is a conjunction.

original: gal te 'jim gong dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa rgyur 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jim gong dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa rgyur 'dod pa'o //
translated: If you assert that a lump of clay, a stick, etc. are the cause.

original: 'bras bu stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa khyab par med pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa khyab par med pa ni /
translated: The non-pervasion of the non-existence characterized by the emptiness of the effect is:

original: rgyu rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa yin te /
translated: the non-apprehension of the cause itself is the apprehension of the effect.

original: des phan tshun bsten pa nyid ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des phan tshun bsten pa nyid ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of an objection is ‚ÄúIf that is so, then the two are not mutually dependent.‚Äù

original: 'di yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: This also does not escape the error already explained.

original: de lta na yang de yal bar dor nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang de yal bar dor nas /
translated: Even so, setting that aside,

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: another objection is stated:

original: stong nyid de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong nyid de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat emptiness of yours‚Äù and so on.

original: de dang yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äù refers to the non-cause.

original: de'i ni rgyu ma yin pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i ni rgyu ma yin pa de'i 'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the non-cause of that.

original: gzhan pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to the non-causes.

original: de dang yang ni rgyu ma yin pa dang yang ngo //
analyzed: de dang yang ni rgyu ma yin pa dang yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äù refers to the non-cause.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts concomitance‚Äù is the anticipation of an objection.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med do zhes so //üîΩ'dis ni 'bras bu stong pa'i rang bzhin snga na med pa nyid yin pa la /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med do zhes so // 'dis ni 'bras bu stong pa'i rang bzhin snga na med pa nyid yin pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù refers to the fact that there is no invariable concomitance or the absence of invariable concomitance in regard to momentariness and the position of the other.

original: 'bras bu nyid ha cang thal ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ha cang thal ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the consequence of the nonexistence of the effect prior to its arising is the consequence of the effect being excessive.

original: da ni snga na med pa de ni tshad mas bsal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni snga na med pa de ni tshad mas bsal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni snga na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to state that this nonexistence prior to arising is refuted by a validating cognition, he says, ‚ÄúNonexistence prior to arising . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba snga na med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba snga na med par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúnonexistence prior to arising.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba 'dis 'bras bu yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba 'dis 'bras bu yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the effect.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa med na thams cad med par thal ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa med na thams cad med par thal ba'i phyir na /
translated: Since the consequence of the nonexistence of the effect prior to its arising is the consequence of the nonexistence of everything,

original: rtog pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not contradictory to the conceptualization.

original: rtog pa ni sngon po la sogs pa tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa ni sngon po la sogs pa tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is because the conceptualization has an object that is merely blue, etc.

original: de'i phyir tshad yongs su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad yongs su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe validating cognition . . . ‚Äù

original: rang bzhin sngon po nyid la sogs par ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin sngon po nyid la sogs par ro //
translated: in the form of blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de la'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de la'o //
translated: in that blue, etc.

original: mngon sum ni snga na med pa la @41b sogs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum ni snga na med pa la @41b sogs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Direct perception is not tenable as the destroyer of the prior non-existence, etc.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de ltar med pa 'bras bu nyid yin pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar med pa 'bras bu nyid yin pa bsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the non-existent as the effect,

original: yod pa yang kho na 'bras bu yin zhes gzhan gyis bsal ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa yang kho na 'bras bu yin zhes gzhan gyis bsal ba'o //
translated: the opponent refutes the existent as the effect.üîΩThe reply is:

original: rgyu'i nus pa 'ga' zhig la yod pa dang med pa kho na nye bar gnas pa yin te gzhan ni med do zhes lan gdab pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa 'ga' zhig la yod pa dang med pa kho na nye bar gnas pa yin te gzhan ni med do zhes lan gdab pa ni /
translated: The potency of the cause exists only in the existent and non-existent, not elsewhere.

original: bltas mnyan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bltas mnyan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said:üîΩLooking and listening refers to the eye sense faculty and the ear sense faculty.

original: bltas zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang pos so //
analyzed: bltas zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang pos so //
translated: Looking refers to the eye sense faculty.

original: mnyan pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos so //
analyzed: mnyan pa ni rna ba'i dbang pos so //
translated: Listening refers to the ear sense faculty.

original: shes byas nas zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'am /
analyzed: shes byas nas zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'am /
translated: Having cognized refers to the other sense faculties.

original: rjes su dpag pa mthong byed la ci ste med pa nyad da //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mthong byed la ci ste med pa nyad da //
translated: Why is the non-existent not seen in the object of inference?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na blun phyir ro ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na blun phyir ro ;
translated: Because of stupidity.

original: / de nas brtags nas mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: / de nas brtags nas mi byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is examined and not produced, the effect does not exist.

original: gal te de lta na yang med pa skye na med par khyad par med pa'i phyir med pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de ltar na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang med pa skye na med par khyad par med pa'i phyir med pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de ltar na yang ma yin te /
translated: But if the nonexistent arises, then since nonexistence is undifferentiated, everything would arise from everything. But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, the effect exists in the cause.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin de 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu la rag las pa yin par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin de 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu la rag las pa yin par byed do //
translated: The response to this is: The nature of the cause is such that it is dependent on the cause.

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'bras bu med pa 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'bras bu med pa 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The nature of the effect is such that it is the cause of something nonexistent.

original: thams cad kyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the cause of everything.

original: des na ha cang thal ba med pa'i phyir na 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na ha cang thal ba med pa'i phyir na 'bras bu snga na yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no overextension, the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: yang na 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu la rag las par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩde 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu la rag las par mthong ba gang yin pa'o // de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, the nature of the effect is seen to be dependent on the cause.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid la med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid la med pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the cause is such that it is nonexistent in the nature of the cause.

original: 'dod pa ni shes pa ste nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni shes pa ste nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Desire is knowledge, that is, ascertainment.

original: 'o ma la ni zho'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma la ni zho'i rang bzhin med pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: It is ascertained that milk does not have the nature of curd.

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yang de nyid gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags zin to //üîΩmed par khyab par med pa'i phyir na med pa thams cad skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yang de nyid gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags zin to // med par khyab par med pa'i phyir na med pa thams cad skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it has already been determined that the nature of a potentiality does not exist in that .

original: rgyu'i nus pa rang gi rgyu la rag las pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na med pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa rang gi rgyu la rag las pa can yin pa'i phyir ro // des na med pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni /
translated: And it is not the case that everything that does not exist arises, because the potentiality of a cause depends on its own cause.üîΩTherefore, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúarising exists because nonexistence arises‚Äù is not that whatever is nonexistent arises.

original: med do cog gang yin pa de skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skye ba gang yin pa de ni med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med do cog gang yin pa de skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skye ba gang yin pa de ni med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But rather, whatever arises is just nonexistent.

original: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod do zhe na ni 'bras bu med par smra ba nyid bla'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod do zhe na ni 'bras bu med par smra ba nyid bla'o //
translated: Therefore, if you accept that the relation of cause and effect exists, it is better to accept that the effect does not exist.

original: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu med na mthong nas byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa kho na yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu med na mthong nas byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa kho na yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that if the effect does not exist from the side of the cause, then the effect exists only because it is seen and then made,üîΩthen it is said, ‚ÄúEven if the effect exists from the side of the cause.

original: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if ƒ™≈õvara is the cause,üîΩ

original: @42a * // gal te med pa la shes pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i rgyu'i sbyor byed yin zhe na /
analyzed: @42a * // gal te med pa la shes pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i rgyu'i sbyor byed yin zhe na /
translated: If you think that since there is no cognition of a nonexistent, how can it be the cause of that?

original: med pa shes par mi 'dod min //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: med pa shes par mi 'dod min // zhes smos te /
translated: It is not that a nonexistent is not asserted to be known.

original: med pa yang shes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa yang shes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a nonexistent is known.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang phyir dbang po las 'das blo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir dbang po las 'das blo //
translated: Why?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because the mind is beyond the senses.

original: des na 'bras bu med pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i lta bas mthong nas nges pa'i rgyu nges par sbyar nas byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu med pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i lta bas mthong nas nges pa'i rgyu nges par sbyar nas byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the effect, even though nonexistent, is seen by the mind beyond the senses, and then the cause is definitely applied. The meaning is that it is made only.

original: de lta na yang med pa yang byed pa srid pas 'bras bu yod par smra bas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni 'dir 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang med pa yang byed pa srid pas 'bras bu yod par smra bas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni 'dir 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But since it is possible for a non-existent to be a cause, what can be done about the assertion of an existent effect?üîΩThis is the point.üîΩThe connection with this is:

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'brel pa ni ci thams cad ces bya ba ste /üîΩdbang phyug med pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'brel pa ni ci thams cad ces bya ba ste / dbang phyug med pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf everything existed beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩWhy is this not so?

original: ci'i phyir 'di ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ma yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the existence of a cause.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the existence of God is:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚Äù

original: dbang phyug dang bcas pa 'gog pa ni gcig yod pa nyid la brten nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang bcas pa 'gog pa ni gcig yod pa nyid la brten nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚Äù

original: dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang cig shos dag mtshungs par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang bcas pa dang cig shos dag mtshungs par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to this objection is the same for both sides:

original: thams cad snga na yod do zhe na ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: thams cad snga na yod do zhe na ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚Äù

original: / phyogs gnyi ga la lan yang mtshungs par brjod pa ni thams cad kyi tshe dmigs par zhes gsungs so //üîΩthams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni thams cad du zhes bya ba 'di nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
analyzed: / phyogs gnyi ga la lan yang mtshungs par brjod pa ni thams cad kyi tshe dmigs par zhes gsungs so //üîΩthams cad kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni thams cad du zhes bya ba 'di nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
translated: The response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚ÄùüîΩThe response to this objection is the same for both sides:üîΩ‚ÄúIf everything exists beforehand, why doesn‚Äôt everything come into existence all at once?‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu nges pa'i phyir na 'bras bu rnams yul la sogs par nges pa yin te des na 'gro ba 'chol ba gnas pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu nges pa'i phyir na 'bras bu rnams yul la sogs par nges pa yin te des na 'gro ba 'chol ba gnas pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: If you say that the effect is determined by the cause, then the effects are determined in terms of place, etc. Thus, the world would not be random.üîΩIn response to this qualm, he explains:

original: dmigs par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdmigs par byed pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dmigs par byed pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: The so-called causes that bring about the effectüîΩdo not bring about the effect that is existent or nonexistent.üîΩThe so-called causes bring about the effect that is the object of observation.

original: 'bras bu dmigs pa nyid du byed pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dmigs pa nyid du byed pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: The effect is that which is brought about as the object of observation.

original: de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du rnam par brtags nas rgyu rnam par rtog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa nyid du rnam par brtags nas rgyu rnam par rtog par byed pa ni /
translated: Thus, having analyzed the effect in terms of existence and nonexistence, he analyzes the cause:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni'o //
translated: Moreover,

original: med pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni zhig pa las so //
analyzed: med pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni zhig pa las so //
translated: an effect does not arise from a cause that is nonexistent,üîΩthat is, disintegrated.üîΩThe refutation of the first conception is:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po sun 'byin pa ni med pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po sun 'byin pa ni med pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An effect does not arise from a cause that is nonexistent.

original: med pa thams cad 'bras bu byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa thams cad 'bras bu byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that all nonexistent things would be producers of effects.

original: 'on te sngar byung ba las 'bras bu skye'o ;
analyzed: 'on te sngar byung ba las 'bras bu skye'o ;
translated: But if you say that an effect arises from a previously existent cause,

original: / gtan med las ni ma yin no zhe na zhig nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / gtan med las ni ma yin no zhe na zhig nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not from a non-existent cause.

original: zhig nas med pa ni 'bras bu'i sngon du rgyu zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa ni 'bras bu'i sngon du rgyu zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is not non-existent, because it has ceased, i.e., because the cause has ceased prior to the effect.

original: gtan nas med pa ni ri bong gi rva'o //
analyzed: gtan nas med pa ni ri bong gi rva'o //
translated: A non-existent cause is like the horn of a donkey.

original: khyad par yod pas dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par yod pas dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection is anticipated:

original: gal te sngon yod myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon yod myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that the cause is that which existed previously,üîΩthen the reply is:

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: When it is a cause,

original: gzhan @42b gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gzhan @42b gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tshe'o //
translated: then it is not non-existent.

original: gzhan gyi tshe rgyu yin na ni med pa la yang rgyu nyid du thal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe rgyu yin na ni med pa la yang rgyu nyid du thal ba'o //
translated: If it is a cause at another time, then it follows that a non-existent cause is a cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir legs par smras pa yin no zhe na gtan tshigs su byas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir legs par smras pa yin no zhe na gtan tshigs su byas so //
translated: Therefore, it is well said that the cause is that which has ceased.

original: ji ltar 'di legs par smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di legs par smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this well said?

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is like this:

original: yod pa ni rang gi dus bzhin du dus gzhan du yang rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa ni rang gi dus bzhin du dus gzhan du yang rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: An existent cause is not a cause at another time, like its own time.

original: med pa ni sngar zhig pa bzhin du rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa ni sngar zhig pa bzhin du rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a non-existent would be a cause, like something previously destroyed.

original: 'on te byed pa yod pa'i phyir yod pa rnams kho na rgyu nyid yin gyi med pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa yod pa'i phyir yod pa rnams kho na rgyu nyid yin gyi med pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that only existents are causes because they have activity, not non-existents,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are non-existent,

original: de dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the response is: ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: 'di dag rnams ni sngar byung ba'i rgyur 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni sngar byung ba'i rgyur 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ones who assert that existents are causes.

original: des na gnyi ga la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir byed pa yod pa las yod pa rgyu yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir byed pa yod pa las yod pa rgyu yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, because activity is impossible for both, how could activity exist and existents be causes?

original: byed pa yod pa de lta na yang yod pa dag ni rgyur mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni gal te byed pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa yod pa de lta na yang yod pa dag ni rgyur mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni gal te byed pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if activity exists, it is said that existents are not tenable as causes. If you say: ‚ÄúBecause of activity,‚Äù

original: gang las 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba'o //üîΩgang las byung ba de las skyed par dogs pa bsu ba ni byed pa na yang yin la /
analyzed: gang las 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dri ba'o // gang las byung ba de las skyed par dogs pa bsu ba ni byed pa na yang yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù is the question about the cause.üîΩThe response to the question ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù is ‚ÄúFrom that.‚Äù

original: don yang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya ba ni de las so //
analyzed: don yang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya ba ni de las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù is from that which is produced.

original: 'di sun dbyung ba'i phyir der ci zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di sun dbyung ba'i phyir der ci zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute this, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of that?‚Äù

original: byed pa bskyed par bya ba der byed pa ldan pa'i don las byed pa gzhan tha dad pa yin nam ci /
analyzed: byed pa bskyed par bya ba der byed pa ldan pa'i don las byed pa gzhan tha dad pa yin nam ci /
translated: Is the activity that generates the activity different from the activity that possesses the object?

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid nas mdun nas sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid nas mdun nas sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not different, then it will be refuted later.

original: gzhan kho na'o zhe na gal te de la 'ang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan kho na'o zhe na gal te de la 'ang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is different, then he says, ‚ÄúIf there is another activity there . . .‚Äù

original: gal te byed pa bskyed pa'i byed pa de la yang byed pa gzhan yod na de'i tshe don te /
analyzed: gal te byed pa bskyed pa'i byed pa de la yang byed pa gzhan yod na de'i tshe don te /
translated: If there is another activity that generates the activity, then the object

original: chod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: chod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: would be cut off.

original: 'bras bu byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be the agent of the effect.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: He anticipates an objection:

original: byed pa nyid las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa nyid las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not from the activity itself . . .‚Äù

original: don las ni ma yin pa'i lam ni shi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don las ni ma yin pa'i lam ni shi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not from the object. The path is ‚Äúeven if one dies.‚Äù

original: 'di khas len sun 'byin pa gzhan yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di khas len sun 'byin pa gzhan yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says that another refutation of the assertion is engaged: ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod pa yin na de nas ji ltar zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung zhe na byed 'phreng 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu yod pa yin na de nas ji ltar zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung zhe na byed 'phreng 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if the effect exists at the time of the cause, then how could the effect arise from the disintegration of the cause?

original: de ltar byed pa tha dad pa bsal nas 'di dag rnams kyi 'byung ba gang de nyid bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis byed pa tha dad pa yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa tha dad pa bsal nas 'di dag rnams kyi 'byung ba gang de nyid bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis byed pa tha dad pa yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Having thus refuted the difference of the agent, in order to refute the difference of the action, he says, ‚ÄúThis is a mere verbal trick.‚Äù

original: de ste rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ste rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it is the intrinsic nature‚Äù is the objection.

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi dus su'o //üîΩdes na / shi na 'bras bu 'byung bar mi thal lo //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi dus su'o // des na / shi na 'bras bu 'byung bar mi thal lo //
translated: ‚Äú At that time‚Äù is at the time of the intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam @43a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam @43a * //
translated: ‚Äú Then it follows that the effect would not arise from the disintegration of the cause‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs thought.

original: pa'o ; / rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa rjod par byed pa'i dus su bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas sun 'byin pa rjod par byed pa'i dus su bya ba'o //
translated: Having stated the objection, he says, ‚ÄúThe response to this is as follows,‚Äù which is the time for stating the response.

original: rgyu yod pa'i dus su 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i dus su 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú If the effect does not exist at the time the cause exists‚Äù is the connection.

original: grub pa'i mtha' gsung ba ni gna' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gsung ba ni gna' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú The response‚Äù is the statement of the philosophical position.üîΩ‚Äú

original: 'di'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩde'i de ma thag pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni / de'i de ma thag pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The following is a response to a possible objection.üîΩThe effect arises immediately after the cause.üîΩThe effect arises immediately after the cause.

original: de'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su rgyu yod pa de /
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su rgyu yod pa de /
translated: The effect arises from the cause that exists at the time of the effect.

original: des na zhig nas ring du lon pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar dogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhig nas ring du lon pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar dogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the effect does not arise from the cause that has long since passed away.

original: lan bshad pa ni skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan bshad pa ni skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is as follows.

original: dus mnyam pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Things that exist at the same time cannot be cause and effect,

original: 'bras bu'i dus na med pa ni rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na med pa ni rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that what does not exist at the time of the effect is a cause.

original: de'i dus na yod pa yin na yang ji ltar rgyu nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dus na yod pa yin na yang ji ltar rgyu nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists at that time, how could it be a cause?

original: rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dpyod par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dpyod par 'gyur ro // des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
translated: Because, like the cause, the effect would not depend on anything else.üîΩTherefore, the statement,üîΩThe effect does not exist or not exist

original: yod med nyid la rtogs pa med //
analyzed: yod med nyid la rtogs pa med //
translated: in the cause,

original: ces bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: is established.

original: gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Neither exists.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩci yang yin smra sun 'byin pas //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni / ci yang yin smra sun 'byin pas //
translated: The nature of both is to be explained as being the opposite of that.

original: zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas so //
translated: This is stated by ‚ÄúRefuting the one who advocates anything at all.‚Äù

original: gal te sngon por snang ba'i shes pa res 'ga' ba dbang po la sogs pa las skye ba rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu go bar byed do //üîΩyin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon por snang ba'i shes pa res 'ga' ba dbang po la sogs pa las skye ba rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu go bar byed do // yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the consciousness to which blue appears is sometimes produced from the sense faculty and so on, it is understood to be a cause that is concordant with itself.üîΩAnticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúBut if you say that the consciousness to which blue appears is sometimes produced from the sense faculty and so on, it is understood to be a cause that is concordant with itself.‚Äù

original: snga mar zhes bya ba ni sngon 'byung bar ro //
analyzed: snga mar zhes bya ba ni sngon 'byung bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the former‚Äù means in the previous.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po 'di ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po 'di ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis thing that is seen by direct perception is the cause of direct perception.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pas nges pas gzung bar mi nus so zhes lan 'debs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ldog pa'i stobs las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa las rig pa snga ma dang / mngon sum la ni snang gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas nges pas gzung bar mi nus so zhes lan 'debs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ldog pa'i stobs las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa las rig pa snga ma dang / mngon sum la ni snang gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt cannot be apprehended by inference because it is ascertained by direct perception‚Äù is the reply. ‚ÄúThe former‚Äù is known from the inference that arises from the power of the cessation of the effect that has the characteristic of consciousness. ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù is that which appears.

original: rang gi rnam par gnod pas mngon sum la snang ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa thun mong ma yin pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul phan tshun 'dre ba med pa na ste /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par gnod pas mngon sum la snang ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa thun mong ma yin pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul phan tshun 'dre ba med pa na ste /
translated: That which has the mode of appearance that is impaired by itself is the uncommon direct perception. When the objects of direct perception and inference are not mixed with each other,

original: 'chol pa med pa na'o //
analyzed: 'chol pa med pa na'o //
translated: that is, when they are not confused,

original: 'chol ba na ni rjes su dpag pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar gyur pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de las ni rjes su dpag par gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyi 'bras bu can du rtogs par 'gyur gyi mngon sum la snang ba /
analyzed: 'chol ba na ni rjes su dpag pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro // de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de las ni rjes su dpag par gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyi 'bras bu can du rtogs par 'gyur gyi mngon sum la snang ba /
translated: when they are confused, inference would become direct perception.üîΩWhen that occurs, then from that inference, the result of inference would be understood, but how could the result of that direct perception, which appears to direct perception,

original: mngon sum de nyid kyi 'bras bu ga la yod pa de'i 'bras @43b bu ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum de nyid kyi 'bras bu ga la yod pa de'i 'bras @43b bu ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: exist? How could its result be understood?

original: gal te zhes bya ba 'di 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba 'di 'chad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: 'on te 'di yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if it is understood by inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is inference.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pas de ltar mi rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas phan tshun 'de ba med pa ni zhes bya ba 'grel pa byed pas na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pas de ltar mi rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas phan tshun 'de ba med pa ni zhes bya ba 'grel pa byed pas na /
translated: The commentary explains the phrase ‚Äúwithout mutual dependence‚Äù as follows:

original: nyams su myong ba nyid la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to experience itself,

original: thun mong ma yin pa myong ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa myong ba nyid la'o //
translated: in regard to experience itself that is not shared with others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i yul ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i yul ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because its object is not a conceptual object.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBut when one engages in perception and inference, one can understand that inference is the cause of the other.‚Äù

original: 'o na mngon sum rjes su dpag pa la 'jug pa na rjes su dpag pa dang / cig shos kyi rgyu yin par rtogs par nus so zhes dogs pa bsu nas rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum rjes su dpag pa la 'jug pa na rjes su dpag pa dang / cig shos kyi rgyu yin par rtogs par nus so zhes dogs pa bsu nas rjes su dpag par bya ba la zhes gsungs so //
translated: The commentary responds to this objection with the phrase ‚Äúin regard to what is to be inferred.‚Äù

original: des na rjes su dpag par bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag par bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one cannot understand that what is to be inferred is the cause of perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang bzhin rtogs na ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang bzhin rtogs na ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the nature of an object is understood through inference,

original: lkog gyur nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: lkog gyur nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that it is hidden.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa ni rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains the phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be understood‚Äù as follows:

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not hidden‚Äù is the response.

original: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù is the reply.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas don rang gi ngo bo rtogs na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas don rang gi ngo bo rtogs na de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one understands the meaning through inference, then it is not hidden.

original: 'on te ngo bo la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa yin no //
translated: But if the nature of the object is both manifest and unmanifest,üîΩthen the response to the doubt is:

original: de la mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩrnam par mi gsal snang yin na //
analyzed: de la mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni / rnam par mi gsal snang yin na //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not manifest.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that the object that has the form of a nonmanifest appearance is hidden.üîΩHow can it be that it is not hidden?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not manifest‚Äù is the response.

original: mi gsal ba snang ba'i rnam pa gang la yod pa'i don de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
