analyzed: mi gsal ba snang ba'i rnam pa gang la yod pa'i don de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is that the object that has the form of a nonmanifest appearance is hidden.

original: des lkog tu gyur pa nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des lkog tu gyur pa nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: How can it be that it is not hidden?

original: 'dir yang mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid yin te des na mngon sum la rang bzhin gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni mngon sum de lta na cis mi 'dod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid yin te des na mngon sum la rang bzhin gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni mngon sum de lta na cis mi 'dod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Here, too, the reply is: ‚ÄúIf it is of the nature of perception, then perception would have two natures.‚Äù

original: mi gsal bar snang ba'i don gang yin pa de mngon sum du ci ste mi 'dod de 'on kyang 'di ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi gsal bar snang ba'i don gang yin pa de mngon sum du ci ste mi 'dod de 'on kyang 'di ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: Why not accept that perception is of an object that appears unclearly?

original: des na de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang rjes su dpag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang rjes su dpag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that the perception that apprehends its nature would also be inference.

original: gal te yang gnyis cig car mi snang ba de lta na yang tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha 'dzin pa bzhin du rim gyis rtogs pa yang mngon sum kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang gnyis cig car mi snang ba de lta na yang tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha 'dzin pa bzhin du rim gyis rtogs pa yang mngon sum kho na yin no //
translated: Even if two things do not appear simultaneously, like the apprehension of the parts of this and that, the gradual understanding is also just perception.

original: bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is:

original: rang bzhin gnyis ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ni zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo natures.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mi gsal ba'i dngos po @44a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mi gsal ba'i dngos po @44a * //
translated: Inference is also of an unclear thing.

original: rang bzhin reg pa'i phyir na mngon sum kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin reg pa'i phyir na mngon sum kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the nature of the object to be touched, it is only perception.

original: khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar ring ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gyi mthus so //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar ring ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gyi mthus so //
translated: By the power of another distinction means by the power of another distinction, such as near and far.

original: rang bzhin na yang ma rtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin na yang ma rtogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you reply that even though it is the nature of the object, the nature of the object that is not understood is not understood, then we say: If it is a distinction.

original: ci ste sngo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste sngo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say: But the distinction of blue, etc.

original: gzhan gyi'o rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi'o rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: is the nature of another, then we reply: It is the nature of itself.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even inference would be perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa la don mngon sum du byed pa dang / spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ni dbang po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la don mngon sum du byed pa dang / spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ni dbang po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to anticipate the objection that inference would make the object of perception manifest and would abandon it, he says: But inference is not perception.

original: yul dbang po dang ma phrad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon sum pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul dbang po dang ma phrad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon sum pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the object is not in contact with the sense faculty.

original: lan ni yul dbang po dang ldan pa yang mngon sum bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa las rjes su dpag pas ci mi dpog ste /
analyzed: lan ni yul dbang po dang ldan pa yang mngon sum bzhin du dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa las rjes su dpag pas ci mi dpog ste /
translated: The response is: even when the object is in contact with the sense faculty, just like direct perception, it is not the case that inference does not apprehend the nature of a thing.

original: 'on kyang dpog pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dpog pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does indeed apprehend it.

original: 'on te de las bzlog par 'grub pa na 'di ji ltar rjes su dpag snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de las bzlog par 'grub pa na 'di ji ltar rjes su dpag snyam na /
translated: But if it is established in the opposite way, how is this inferred?

original: dbang po dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: ‚Äúbecause of inference.‚Äù

original: de'i ni don gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni don gyi'o //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúbecause of the object of that.‚Äù

original: 'on te dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo //üîΩdbang po'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul lo // dbang po'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: But if it is because of the absence of a thing, the response is: ‚Äúthe sense faculty.‚Äù

original: gal te ji ltar shes pa dbang po la sogs pa rtag par rjes su dpag par bya ba dpog pa na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar shes pa dbang po la sogs pa rtag par rjes su dpag par bya ba dpog pa na /
translated: If it is asked how it is inferred that consciousness, etc. are permanent,

original: dbang po dang 'brel pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul 'di la yang rjes su dpog pa yin pa kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po dang 'brel pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul 'di la yang rjes su dpog pa yin pa kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Just as the connection with the sense faculty is inferred, in the same way, the object of engagement is also inferred.

original: ci ste dbang po dang 'brel par zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: ci ste dbang po dang 'brel par zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: To anticipate the objection, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is connected with the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: / rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya yul gzhan yang 'jug pa'i yul du mi 'gyur la des na 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs par ni 'dis ni
analyzed: / rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya yul gzhan yang 'jug pa'i yul du mi 'gyur la des na 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs par ni 'dis ni
translated: If it were always inferred like what is to be inferred, the other object of engagement would not be engaged, and therefore inference that does not engage would not be valid knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To answer this, he says, ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pas 'jug par mi byed pas na don med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pas 'jug par mi byed pas na don med do //
translated: Because it does not engage through inference, it is pointless.

original: ci'i phyir 'jug par mi byed snyam na lha min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug par mi byed snyam na lha min zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why does it not engage? He says, ‚ÄúThe asura.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Even so, it will engage.

original: don med nyid ces smos te /
analyzed: don med nyid ces smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúIt is pointless.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: It is fruitless.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jug snyam na /
translated: How then does it engage?

original: mkho ba don du gnyer bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mkho ba don du gnyer bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The statement for the sake of the desired object and so on.

original: tshad ma ma yin @44b pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin @44b pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: The statement it would not be a means of valid cognition is a hypothetical conclusion.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung bas so //
translated: The statement that refers to the subsequent statement.

original: lan ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is that is not correct.

original: dbang po dang 'brel par 'gyur bar 'dzin na /
analyzed: dbang po dang 'brel par 'gyur bar 'dzin na /
translated: If it is held that it is related to the sense faculty,

original: de'i khyad par can gyi don gyi rang bzhin nyid rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin gyi snga ma'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par can gyi don gyi rang bzhin nyid rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin gyi snga ma'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: then the nature of the object that possesses that is understood from inference, not the previous nature.

original: des rgyu nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not understood as the cause.

original: de rtogs pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa nye bar len pa yin na /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa nye bar len pa yin na /
translated: If inference is employed for the purpose of understanding that,

original: de mi byed na ji ltar don med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de mi byed na ji ltar don med par mi 'gyur /
translated: how could it not be purposeless if it does not do that?

original: des na 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is separated is not an inference.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs bzhin pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs bzhin pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable that what is being presently realized is precisely what is occurring.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù introduces a doubt.

original: rang gi ngo bos snang yang da ltar ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang yang da ltar ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even though it appears by way of its own entity, it is not present.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it appears as the nature of the past and so on.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba la rjes su dpag pa dran pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa na 'das pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba la rjes su dpag pa dran pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa na 'das pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: When memory, which has the nature of inference, engages in seeing by direct perception, the past does not become the object of inference because it is not its object.

original: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes lan 'debs pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes lan 'debs pa ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúInference does not engage in seeing by direct perception.‚Äù

original: ci ste mi rtogs snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste mi rtogs snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think it does not realize it, ‚Äúin that case‚Äù introduces the response.üîΩThe meaning is that inference does not realize the past because it is not a valid form of knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o ;
translated: The thought is that inference has the nature of memory.

original: /'on te de la de 'jug pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: /'on te de la de 'jug pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it does engage in it,

original: mngon sum yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù is also mentioned.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù is a question.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù is at the time of inference.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then‚Äù is the answer.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù is the nature of the past.

original: de lta na yin mod ci skyon zhe na ;
analyzed: de lta na yin mod ci skyon zhe na ;
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, what is the problem?‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is mentioned.

original: 'das pa'i rang bzhin skyes pa la ni nam yang mngon sum yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i rang bzhin skyes pa la ni nam yang mngon sum yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the past is never a direct perception.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog pa gang zhig la yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de ni dran pa med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog pa gang zhig la yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de ni dran pa med de /
translated: Because of that reason, how is it that in any inference, the object of direct perception does not exist? That is not remembered.

original: nyams myong las ni dran pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams myong las ni dran pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the system that memory arises from experience.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang dran pa yin pas ji ltar mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa la 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang dran pa yin pas ji ltar mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa la 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Since inference is also memory, how could it arise from what is not realized by direct perception?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from what is realized.

original: nam yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are never directly perceived.

original: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: This is the case for the future.

original: @45a * // mtshungs pa ni 'das pa nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: @45a * // mtshungs pa ni 'das pa nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The similarity is that they are both past and future.

original: gnyi ga yang nam gyi tshe yang yul mngon sum gyi yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te sangs rgyas pa la yang mngon sum gyi rang gi yul 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang nam gyi tshe yang yul mngon sum gyi yul nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te sangs rgyas pa la yang mngon sum gyi rang gi yul 'das pa'am /
translated: Neither is ever the object of direct perception.

original: ma 'ongs par rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par rig pa ma yin te /
translated: If you Buddhists claim that direct perception is not aware of its own object as past or future,

original: rang gi yul na yod pa nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul na yod pa nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a direct perception of the present,

original: de rjes su dpag pa de'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba 'di 'das pa nyid la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa de'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'di 'das pa nyid la sogs par ro //
translated: then inference would not have the aspect of the object, because it is a cognition that has an object.üîΩIf you claim that inference is not a cognition that has the aspect of the object,üîΩthen it is not inference, because it is not a cognition that has the aspect of the object.

original: de'i rnam pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: The aspect of the object is the form of the object.

original: snang ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'o //
translated: The appearance is the cognition that has the aspect of the object.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúNo, it is not.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas pa de ni'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de ni'o //
translated: This is the Buddhist position.

original: de lta ni 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta ni 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du'o //
translated: In this way, there is the past, etc.

original: gzhan yang las kyang ni chags pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang las kyang ni chags pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Moreover, karma is also due to attachment, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu des na don 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rgyu des na don 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Because of that reason, which will be explained, the cognition that is desired to apprehend the object is like that.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be the aspect of the past, etc.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'das pa snang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bag chags dang 'bral pa des na'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'das pa snang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bag chags dang 'bral pa des na'o //
translated: Even if it is so, how can the past appear? It is due to the absence of latent impressions.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi rang bzhin la ni mngon mthong ba las so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi rang bzhin la ni mngon mthong ba las so //
translated: The nature of the past is due to direct perception.

original: 'ongs pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the future is inference.

original: 'das par zhes pa ni don dam pa la 'dzin pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'das par zhes pa ni don dam pa la 'dzin pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The past is not due to the apprehension of the ultimate.

original: yang na bag chags dang 'brel pa de dga' ba 'das pa mad pa'i dus te /
analyzed: yang na bag chags dang 'brel pa de dga' ba 'das pa mad pa'i dus te /
translated: Or, that which is connected with latent impressions is the past, the time of the non-existence of pleasure.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which will arise is the future.

original: don gyi rang bzhin de las 'ongs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'das par zhen pa ste snang ba gsal ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin de las 'ongs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'das par zhen pa ste snang ba gsal ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because it arises from the nature of the object, it is called ‚Äúthe appearance of the past that is the object of inference.‚Äù

original: dper na zla ba gcig las 'ongs pa rab rib la sogs pa'i dbang gis zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba de bzhin du bag chags kyi dbang gis 'das pa ma yin pa las 'ongs pa yang 'das pa'i rnam par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: dper na zla ba gcig las 'ongs pa rab rib la sogs pa'i dbang gis zla ba gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba de bzhin du bag chags kyi dbang gis 'das pa ma yin pa las 'ongs pa yang 'das pa'i rnam par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: For example, just as a single moon appears as two moons due to the power of an eye disease, in the same way, due to the power of predispositions, what is not past appears as the aspect of the past.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: don to // gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'das pa'i rnam pa can yin pa yang don gyi rang bzhin de ji ltar 'das pa zhe na /
analyzed: don to // gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'das pa'i rnam pa can yin pa yang don gyi rang bzhin de ji ltar 'das pa zhe na /
translated: If it has the aspect of the past that is inferred, how is that nature of the object past?

original: de ni 'das pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is the past of that.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni don gyi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni don gyi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the uncommon nature of the object.

original: dper na sngon po nyid du 'dzin pas sngon po nyid du yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po nyid du 'dzin pas sngon po nyid du yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as something is apprehended as blue by the apprehension of blue.

original: de yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas bzung ba'i don gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas bzung ba'i don gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: And that also does not exist. This is the nature of the object apprehended by inference.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te don gyi rang bzhin de'i da ltar @45b ba nyid de thun mong ma yin pa nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te lhag par zhen pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te don gyi rang bzhin de'i da ltar @45b ba nyid de thun mong ma yin pa nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te lhag par zhen pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause‚Äù; that nature of the object, which is not shared, is not the valid cognition of inference, because it is merely a fixation on the particular.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin na 'o na don gyi rang bzhin de de ltar 'thob ste /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin na 'o na don gyi rang bzhin de de ltar 'thob ste /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition, then how is that nature of the object obtained?

original: mi 'thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa nyid do //
translated: It is not obtained.

original: lan ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause of existence.‚Äù

original: don dam par rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni don gyi rang bzhin ma yin gyi 'on kyang yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni don gyi rang bzhin ma yin gyi 'on kyang yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not the nature of the object because it is the object of inference in the ultimate sense, but rather because of existence.

original: gal te don gyi rnag bzhin rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te don gyi rnag bzhin rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin na /
translated: If the nature of the object is not the object of inference,

original: de yod pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be said to exist?

original: lan du mthong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du mthong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause of being seen.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i rtags ni dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i rtags can gyi khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i rtags ni dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i rtags can gyi khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: The present reason is not pervaded by the presence of a reason in another time.

original: des na shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the indirectly established probandum does not exist at that time.

original: de med na de'i rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na de'i rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not exist, its continuum is interrupted.

original: yang gang zhig de rnam par mi 'chad pa de ni de'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gang zhig de rnam par mi 'chad pa de ni de'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which does not interrupt it does not exist at that time,

original: dper na bum pa'i 'dus na rdza mkhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i 'dus na rdza mkhan bzhin no //
translated: just as the potter does not exist at the time of the pot.

original: des na khyad par can gyi 'bras bu la ltos na bsgrub par bya ba de'i dus na yod par brjod pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par can gyi 'bras bu la ltos na bsgrub par bya ba de'i dus na yod par brjod pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that the probandum is said to exist at that time in dependence on a particular effect.

original: de'i sgo nas ni rtags kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni rtags kyi sgo nas so //
translated: By that means, by the reason.

original: gal te shes pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: gal te shes pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: If by cognition, by inference.

original: lan ni mi 'khrul pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni mi 'khrul pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause of non-error.‚Äù

original: gal te du ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te du ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis brjod pa'o //
translated: If by smoke, this is stated by another.

original: du ba yang mi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba yang mi 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because smoke also exists without error.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no ;
translated: How? This is the answer.

original: / rang gi shes pa dang bcas pa mi'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / rang gi shes pa dang bcas pa mi'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It produces the cognition of a human being together with its own cognition.

original: de yi rang bzhin dang 'brel phyir //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin dang 'brel phyir //
translated: Because of the connection with its nature.

original: zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to be established. Because of the connection with the nature of the object to be established.

original: rang bzhin ma yin zhes bya ba ni du ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin zhes bya ba ni du ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Not the nature is the plurality, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: There means in the cognition of inference.

original: don du zhen pa ni don du snang ba'o //
analyzed: don du zhen pa ni don du snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance as the object is the appearance as the object.

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is therefore.

original: de ni mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: That is not seen means inference.

original: lhag par zhen pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of mere adherence.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni mi mthong bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mi mthong bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means because it is not seen.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid du ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas lkog nyid du ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: But how is it known by inference that it is hidden?

original: de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: That means that which is not seen.

original: rtogs pa med pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: The absence of knowledge is by its own nature.

original: de ltar rang gi phyogs la gzhan gyis brjod pa'i skyon spangs nas /üîΩyang rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi phyogs la gzhan gyis brjod pa'i skyon spangs nas / yang rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: Thus, having refuted the faults that others ascribe to our position,üîΩnow, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIf inference has a real object,

original: de mngon sum nyid do zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni /üîΩlkog gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum nyid do zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni / lkog gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is perception,‚ÄùüîΩhe says,üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is hidden,

original: lkog gyur pa la zhes bya @46a * //
analyzed: lkog gyur pa la zhes bya @46a * //
translated: then it is hidden.‚Äù

original: ba'i rnam pa 'di gal te rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang bzhin lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs pa yin na de'i tshe 'di ni lkog nyid do zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: ba'i rnam pa 'di gal te rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang bzhin lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs pa yin na de'i tshe 'di ni lkog nyid do zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid do //
translated: If the aspect called ‚Äúhidden‚Äù is the realization of the nature of a hidden object by inference, then at that time, that which is realized as ‚Äúhidden‚Äù is perception.

original: des na 'di ni lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes mthong ba la de la rjes su dpog pa ni mngon sum kho nar gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di ni lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes mthong ba la de la rjes su dpog pa ni mngon sum kho nar gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, when it is said that ‚Äúthis is hidden,‚Äù the inference of that which is seen is only perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends the nature of a real thing.

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na ni lo ma las byung ba la rtsva las byung ba yin zhes the tshom dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na ni lo ma las byung ba la rtsva las byung ba yin zhes the tshom dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If inference had a real object, then when something is made of leaves, it would not be related to doubt that it is made of grass.

original: bdag nyid thams cad rang gi ngo bo rjes su dpag pa las nges pa yin na the tshom mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad rang gi ngo bo rjes su dpag pa las nges pa yin na the tshom mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the entire nature of something were ascertained by inference, then doubt would be untenable, because it is not possible to doubt something that is ascertained.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa la ni the tshom 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa la ni the tshom 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Doubt does not arise with regard to the momentariness of something that is seen by direct perception.

original: ci ste yang don dang shes pa dag gcig pa'i phyir na de mthong ba yin pa des na /
analyzed: ci ste yang don dang shes pa dag gcig pa'i phyir na de mthong ba yin pa des na /
translated: But if the object and consciousness are the same, then since it sees that,

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma mthong ba kho na'o zhes ci ste brjod snyam na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma mthong ba kho na'o zhes ci ste brjod snyam na /
translated: why do you say that it does not see the hidden object at all?

original: shes don dag kyang shes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes don dag kyang shes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said that the object of consciousness is consciousness.

original: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different, in that the object is matter and consciousness is not matter.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because they are not the same.

original: don de ni don bya ba byed pa can no //
analyzed: don de ni don bya ba byed pa can no //
translated: The object is that which performs the function.

analyzed: re zhig mngon sum gyis ni dran pa'i 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin te zhes 'brel to //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dran pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'o na don gyi mngon sum gyi dran pa'i 'brel pa rtogs par nus so snyam na /

analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa ma yin pas na'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni reg pa yod nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Contact exists conventionally.‚Äù

original: zhes brjod pa ni 'di bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni 'di bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúI say . . .‚Äù

original: khyim nas byung ba slar khyim du 'ong ba mi dran pa'i rang bzhin lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: khyim nas byung ba slar khyim du 'ong ba mi dran pa'i rang bzhin lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: The nature of memory is not to remember what has gone out of the house coming back into the house. It is due to the power of imagination.

original: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa lhag par mos pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa lhag par mos pa kho na yin no //
translated: All presentations are established by the power of imagination, such as cause and effect, object and agent, and so on.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Direct perception is ultimate because it is limited to its own nature.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du ma brtags na nyams dga' ba mngon sum gyis rtog pa nyid kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du ma brtags na nyams dga' ba mngon sum gyis rtog pa nyid kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: is the meaning of the verse that begins,

original: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which conceals its own nature

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib byed pa //
translated: and reveals an apparent natureüîΩis called the ‚Äòrelative.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba yin zhes bshad pa ni bsam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba yin zhes bshad pa ni bsam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that the relative is the opposite of the definition of the relative is the meaning of the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe thought . . . ‚Äù

original: tshad mas gnas pa'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mas gnas pa'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe ultimate . . . ‚Äù is that the nature of the ultimate, which is established by valid cognition, does not exist.

original: lhag par mos pa tsam kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na @47a * //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa tsam kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na @47a * //
translated: If you are wondering where it says that mere belief is the relative,

original: kun rdzob kyi don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the meaning of the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the relative . . . ‚Äù

original: tshad ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is that it is the object that is understood by a conceptual consciousness that is not valid cognition.

original: gang gis kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba lhag par mos pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'gyur ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis kun rdzob tu 'gyur ba lhag par mos pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'gyur ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: If you are wondering how mere belief can be the relative, which is the worldly convention that is understood by valid cognition,üîΩthe meaning of the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe relative . . . ‚Äù

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, etc.

original: de lta na yin dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad par ldog pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yin dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad par ldog pa na'o //
translated: Thus, if, etc. means that when the investigation is reversed.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni mthong bar mngon par rlom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni mthong bar mngon par rlom pa'o //
translated: This, etc. means that one is conceited about seeing.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: All mundane conventions, etc. means that the mundane people have the conventions of effect, etc.

original: de lta bu nyid ni ma mthong ba la mthong bar mngon par rlom pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni ma mthong ba la mthong bar mngon par rlom pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Suchness is the characteristic of being conceited about seeing what is not seen.

original: ji ltar thams cad kun rdzob pa yin snyam na tshad ma med par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad kun rdzob pa yin snyam na tshad ma med par zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is it that everything is superficial? It is said: without a valid cognition.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po kun rdzob tsam yin pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po kun rdzob tsam yin pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If cause and effect are merely superficial things, how could it be?

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rab tu grub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rab tu bcug pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas rab tu grub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rab tu bcug pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs nas bshad pa /
translated: Because they are engaged by the positive and negative concomitances established by perception and non-apprehension.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa yin no //üîΩde'i tshe de la rjes su ste rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la mngon sum ste /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa yin no // de'i tshe de la rjes su ste rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la mngon sum ste /
translated: If cause and effect are understood from positive and negative concomitance,üîΩthen at that time, there is no valid cognition, either perception or inference,

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: of positive and negative concomitance.

original: dngos po tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it merely apprehends entities.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su dpog pa la de bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su dpog pa la de bzhin te /
translated: Inference based on that is also like that, inferring positive and negative concomitance.

original: des mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: That is not the defining characteristic,

original: thug pa med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of infinite regress would ensue.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum de dag gi tshad ma yin no snyam na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum de dag gi tshad ma yin no snyam na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that perception and inference together with non-apprehension are the valid cognition of those, then there is the phrase ‚Äúfrom perception and non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa khas len na de'i tshe phan tshun te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa khas len na de'i tshe phan tshun te /
translated: If you accept an inference that has the nature of non-apprehension, then at that time there would be mutual dependence,üîΩbecause the one inference would depend on the other. Therefore, the positive and negative concomitances would not be established without end.

original: rjes su dpag pa gcig la gcig ltos pa des na thug pa med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mi 'grub pa dang / yang na rjes su dpag pa yod na rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa yod pa la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gcig la gcig ltos pa des na thug pa med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mi 'grub pa dang / yang na rjes su dpag pa yod na rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa yod pa la /
translated: Moreover, if there is an inference, there is the apprehension of the positive and negative concomitances.

original: de yod na yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir na phan tshun brten pa ni phan tshun brten pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir na phan tshun brten pa ni phan tshun brten pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that exists, there is an inference. Therefore, mutual dependence is just mutual dependence.

original: de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'chad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the immediately preceding verse is explained.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gcig bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gcig bya ba'o //
translated: The positive and negative concomitances are one action.üîΩIf direct perception does not apprehend both by apprehending things, then it is undeniable that it apprehends the positive concomitance.

original: gal te mngon @47b sum ni dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyis gnyi ga mi 'dzin pa yang rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa ni bzlog tu med pa nyid do zhes dogs pas su nas de yang med pa kho na'o zhes gsungs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba mngon
analyzed: gal te mngon @47b sum ni dngos po 'dzin pa nyid kyis gnyi ga mi 'dzin pa yang rjes su 'gro ba 'dzin pa ni bzlog tu med pa nyid do zhes dogs pas su nas de yang med pa kho na'o zhes gsungs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba mngon
translated: If you think that, then it is said that it does not exist at all. The positive concomitance is not directly perceived.

original: sum gyis 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sum gyis 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of the three is the apprehension of the effect, the cause, and the inherence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di yod na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yod na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the existence of that.

original: ci'i phyir de bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not to be done?

original: gnyis 'dzin pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis 'dzin pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because of the mere apprehension of the two.

original: sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature of the application.

original: gal te me'i de ma thag tu du ba mthong ba'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te me'i de ma thag tu du ba mthong ba'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If smoke is seen immediately after fire, is not the existence of the concomitance of smoke with fire established?

original: de lta ma yin na de ma thag tu mthong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de ma thag tu mthong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be seen immediately.

original: de ma thag par 'dzin pa yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba ni srid pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni 'di'i de ma thag tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ma thag par 'dzin pa yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba ni srid pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni 'di'i de ma thag tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even though there is the apprehension of the immediate succession, the concomitance is not possible. This is what is said by the phrase ‚Äúimmediately after that.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba med kyang de ma thag tu mthong ba srid pa'i phyir ji ltar de la de rtogs snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med kyang de ma thag tu mthong ba srid pa'i phyir ji ltar de la de rtogs snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even without the concomitance, the immediate succession is possible. How is it understood in that case?

original: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is there no concomitance? It is said: ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du gzhan dang ldan pa dang shin tu mi ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa rnam par dpyod pa lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du gzhan dang ldan pa dang shin tu mi ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa rnam par dpyod pa lhur byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase arising from this and so on refers to the analysis of the other, the very non-other, and the non-possessor, respectively.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di tsam zhig rnam par brtag par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di tsam zhig rnam par brtag par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why should one analyze just this much?

original: don gzhan zhes gsungs so //üîΩdang po la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes gsungs so // dang po la brjod pa ni /
translated: The word other is stated.

original: gal te 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is stated in the phrase from this.

original: 'di las cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'di las cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: What would follow from this?

original: de la yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The word then is stated.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty, that is, because there is no pervasion.

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is stated in the phrase from this.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar nges par mi gzung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar nges par mi gzung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not ascertained in this way?

original: dus gzhan du res 'ga' zhes gsungs so //üîΩgsum pa sel ba 'di las kyang //
analyzed: dus gzhan du res 'ga' zhes gsungs so // gsum pa sel ba 'di las kyang //
translated: The phrase at another time, sometimes is stated.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third is stated in the phrase from this.

original: mi dmigs pa la srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa las bsams nas brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa las bsams nas brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the context of non-apprehension, the question why? is stated with reference to the conception of existence.

original: de ltar gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though this is the case, the statement ...even so...

original: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par khas blangs pa na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par khas blangs pa na'o //
translated: is made when non-apprehension is accepted as the realization.

original: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa nyed bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa nyed bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of mutual dependence, the statement ...in this way... is made.

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni de nyid de mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni de nyid de mngon sum mo //
translated: The non-different is that itself, i.e., perception.

original: gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs sel ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs sel ba ni /
translated: Because the apprehension of something else is non-apprehension.

original: mngon sum las ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩtha dad pa'i phyogs sel ba ni @48a * //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni zhes bya ba'o // tha dad pa'i phyogs sel ba ni @48a * //
translated: The exclusion of the non-different position is stated in the phrase ...not from perception....

original: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of the different position is stated in the phrase ...because there is no engagement....

original: mngon sum las gzhan nam zhes pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan nam zhes pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ...not from something else than perception... means if....

original: 'jug pa med 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni de ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa med 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni de ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the phrase ...there would be no engagement... is stated in the phrase ...that is to say....

original: med na yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'dzin pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: med na yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'dzin pa med na yang ngo //
translated: If not, then even if there is no apprehension of positive and negative concomitance,

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: if it is apprehended by another inference, there is an infinite regress.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: gal te mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag par khas blangs na phan tshun brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag par khas blangs na phan tshun brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If non-apprehension is accepted as inference, there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mar khas blangs na ni nyes pa 'di med do ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mar khas blangs na ni nyes pa 'di med do ;
translated: But if it is accepted as a valid cognition of non-existence, this fault does not arise.

original: / des na de ni med na med par 'dzin pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: / des na de ni med na med par 'dzin pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that it is the apprehension of non-existence when there is non-existence.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is the response.

original: dngos po gzung byas shing //
analyzed: dngos po gzung byas shing //
translated: Having apprehended the thing

original: 'gal zla dag kyang dran byas nas //üîΩdbang po la ni de med par //
analyzed: 'gal zla dag kyang dran byas nas // dbang po la ni de med par //
translated: and also recalled its opposite,üîΩthe mind definitely ascertains

original: med par nges pa'i yid skye'o //
analyzed: med par nges pa'i yid skye'o //
translated: the non-existence of the thing in the absence of the sense faculty.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dngos po med kyang nges pa'i yul nyid du dngos po med ba rtogs pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni dngos po med par chad ma de las kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dngos po med kyang nges pa'i yul nyid du dngos po med ba rtogs pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni dngos po med par chad ma de las kyang ngo //
translated: In this way, even though there is no entity, one understands the non-entity as the object of ascertainment.

original: gal te yod na yod pa ni rtags yin pa de las kyang rtags can de'i 'bras bu nyid rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod na yod pa ni rtags yin pa de las kyang rtags can de'i 'bras bu nyid rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, existence is the reason. From that, the understanding of the effect of that which has the reason is not inference,

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not depend on apprehending the relation.

original: gnod byed med pa'i phyir na rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mas ni yul la sogs pa ma nges par de'i 'bras bu nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes bya bar gzhan gyi rtsod pa blo ni gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod byed med pa'i phyir na rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mas ni yul la sogs pa ma nges par de'i 'bras bu nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes bya bar gzhan gyi rtsod pa blo ni gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others argue, Because there is no contradiction, the valid cognition called 'understanding' establishes the effect of that which is uncertain, such as the object, etc. This is the opponent's argument.

original: 'brel pa mthong pa med pa ni rtags so //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong pa med pa ni rtags so //
translated: The absence of seeing the relation is the reason.

original: 'di skabs la nye bar sbyor ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skabs la nye bar sbyor ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application to this context is like this.

original: nges pa'i tshad nyid ces bya ba ba'o ;
analyzed: nges pa'i tshad nyid ces bya ba ba'o ;
translated: The very ascertainment is the valid cognition.

original: / rtags de yod na yod pa las rtags can tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: / rtags de yod na yod pa las rtags can tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: When that sign exists, the existence of the thing possessing the sign is stated to be different from the sign.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa las mi ltos pa nyid dub rjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa las mi ltos pa nyid dub rjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the existence of the thing possessing the sign is not dependent on the apprehension of the relation.

original: yod pa na yod pa de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa na yod pa de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the thing possessing the sign exists, that existence is stated.

original: 'on te 'brel pa ma rtogs na rtags las de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa med pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa ma rtogs na rtags las de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa med pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But if the relation is not apprehended, then the effect of the sign is not apprehended at all.

original: 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is: It is apprehended by the world.

original: rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the apprehension is:

original: gang gi phyir de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that, it is said.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the apprehension in that way, therefore.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The anticipation of the objection that the effect is apprehended in another way is:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is said.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang de'i 'bras @48b bu nyid du rtogs pa dgag pa bshad pa ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang de'i 'bras @48b bu nyid du rtogs pa dgag pa bshad pa ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the refutation of the apprehension of the effect in both ways is: It is not tenable to say that.

original: ji ltar mi 'thad snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'thad snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: The anticipation of the doubt about how it is not tenable is:

original: de yod pa nyid na yod pa zhes nges pa kho na yod pa rtags yin gyi de tsam ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na yod pa zhes nges pa kho na yod pa rtags yin gyi de tsam ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, then the existence of the existence is ascertained, and that alone is the reason, not just that alone, because that would be erroneous.

original: gal te de grub po zhe na ni rtags can gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de grub po zhe na ni rtags can gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is established, then the existence of another reason is not so.

original: des na spyod pa'am don gyis go ba ni tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes lan gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyod pa'am don gyis go ba ni tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes lan gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not said that the other valid cognition is either the activity or the understanding of the meaning.

original: gal te rtags de yod na /
analyzed: gal te rtags de yod na /
translated: If that reason exists,

original: yod pa nyid rtogs pa las de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba las grub bo zhes 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid rtogs pa las de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gzhan yin par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba las grub bo zhes 'thad pa yin no //
translated: then it would be another understanding of the result of the understanding of existence. At that time, it would be reasonable to say that it is established from analysis or the understanding of the meaning.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: If it is said that it is not so,

original: /'o na 'di 'thad pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: /'o na 'di 'thad pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: then this is reasonable.

original: de las 'gyur ba ma gtogs par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de las 'gyur ba ma gtogs par zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it is said, Except for the transformation from that,

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid de kho na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde lta yin la rag mod can //üîΩde la skyon ni sngar brjod de //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid de kho na yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta yin la rag mod can // de la skyon ni sngar brjod de //
translated: the meaning is that the existence of that alone is the result.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, then it is said, The fault in that has been stated previously.

original: de kho na las so zhes khyab ba ni nges pa yin na ;
analyzed: de kho na las so zhes khyab ba ni nges pa yin na ;
translated: The pervasion is the certainty.

original: de la'ang mngon sum mam des bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te yul dang dus nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la'ang mngon sum mam des bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te yul dang dus nges pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not to be understood by direct perception or by a conception produced by that, because it is limited to a particular object and time.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: If, as has been explained,

original: rtogs pa'i yul du srid pa ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yul du srid pa ni //
translated: the object of understanding is possible,

original: zhes bya ba ni rtags de med na ni yod pa las tha dad par ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtags de med na ni yod pa las tha dad par ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: then it should be understood that if that reason does not exist, it is different from existence.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gnyis pa'i phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i gnyis pa'i phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The first half of the second verse is explained:

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is,

original: 'on te yang de yod pa las de'i 'bras bu nyid gzhan ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te yang de yod pa las de'i 'bras bu nyid gzhan ma yin mod /
translated: But if that is not different from existence, then it is just that.üîΩThe second half is explained in order to remove that doubt:

original: de nyid ni yin par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa sel bas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni nges par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni yin par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa sel bas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni nges par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is definitely

original: 'on te dus nyid du de yod na yod pa nyid de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no zhe na //
analyzed: 'on te dus nyid du de yod na yod pa nyid de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no zhe na //
translated: But if it exists at the time when that exists, then it is just the effect of that.

original: de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is,

original: de'i khyab pa nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te de yod na yod pa tsam ni rtags yin la /
analyzed: de'i khyab pa nyid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on te de yod na yod pa tsam ni rtags yin la /
translated: because it is pervaded by that.üîΩBut if you think that the mere existence of that is the reason,

original: de yod pa nyid na yod pa ni rtags can yin no snyam na ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na yod pa ni rtags can yin no snyam na ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the existence of that itself is the one who possesses the reason, then it is as follows.

original: de tsam la ni nges pa khyab par mngon sum gyis grub pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de tsam la ni nges pa khyab par mngon sum gyis grub pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: There is no direct perception that establishes the pervasion of that mere existence.

original: gal te de ltar de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúIf it were like that, then it would be like this.‚Äù

original: ma khyab pa'i de yod ni yod pa las kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs so snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma khyab pa'i de yod ni yod pa las kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs so snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the existence of that non-pervasion is understood to be the effect of that existence, then the response is: ‚ÄúBecause it is understood in just that way.‚Äù

original: ma khyab pa las rtogs pa gcig tu nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes @49a * //
analyzed: ma khyab pa las rtogs pa gcig tu nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes @49a * //
translated: It is not ascertained that it is understood from a non-pervasion.

original: lan 'debs pa ni /üîΩ'o na bum pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni / 'o na bum pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is:üîΩ‚ÄúBut also a pot.‚Äù

original: de la bum pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la bum pa la yang ngo //
translated: In that case, a pot.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means it would be understood to be its effect.

original: 'di nyid snam bu ni snam bu la 'khrul par mthong ba de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
analyzed: 'di nyid snam bu ni snam bu la 'khrul par mthong ba de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
translated: The following is a response to the doubt that the seeing of a cloth as a cloth is not understood to be the effect of that.

original: de la ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, it is called an error.

original: 'o na ni ji ltar de yod na ni yod pa tsam srid pa yin yang bum pa de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i du ba la sogs pa yang me la sogs pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes lan
analyzed: 'o na ni ji ltar de yod na ni yod pa tsam srid pa yin yang bum pa de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i du ba la sogs pa yang me la sogs pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes lan
translated: If it is like that, then even if the mere existence of a pot is possible when it exists, a pot is not the effect of that. In the same way, smoke and so on that are desired as effects would not be the effects of fire and so on.

original: 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response to that isüîΩthis itself,

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste bum pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste bum pa nyid kyis so //
translated: that is, the pot itself.

original: de la yang ni du ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang ni du ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: In that case, smoke and so on

original: 'on te du ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te du ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: are not seen as an error.

original: yid mi ches pa ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi ches pa ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Lack of confidence is the absence of understanding.

original: des na 'bras bu nyid ni de tsam las rtogs pa yin no snyam pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nyid ni de tsam las rtogs pa yin no snyam pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the effect is understood from that alone. The thought that is called the understanding of lack of confidenceüîΩis

original: ring po mthong ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ring po mthong ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúNot seeing what is far away.‚Äù

original: bsu ba de ni zhes bya ba yid mi ches pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsu ba de ni zhes bya ba yid mi ches pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat seeing is not reliable‚Äù means that it is not trustworthy.

original: ring po mthong ba rnams ni lhan cig ma yin par lhan cig tu mthong ba rnams la yang 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba yang yid ches pha'o //
analyzed: ring po mthong ba rnams ni lhan cig ma yin par lhan cig tu mthong ba rnams la yang 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba yang yid ches pha'o //
translated: Because those who see what is far away see what is not simultaneous as simultaneous, their seeing is mistaken. Therefore, their not seeing is also not trustworthy.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pas bskal pa dag ni /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pas bskal pa dag ni /
translated: Objects, time, etc., are different.

original: ma mthong bas med pa sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong bas med pa sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Not seeing them does not prove that they do not exist.

original: de na de tsam las ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gcig tu nges pa med do //üîΩ'on te 'jig rten pa dag gi de'i 'bras bu nyid yid ches pa'i rtogs pa ni mang du mthong ba nyid las yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni /
analyzed: de na de tsam las ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gcig tu nges pa med do // 'on te 'jig rten pa dag gi de'i 'bras bu nyid yid ches pa'i rtogs pa ni mang du mthong ba nyid las yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni /
translated: Because of that, it is not certain that one can understand that they are effects.

original: de lta bu nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the understanding that they are effects is based on the trust of worldly people who see many such cases, the reply is: ‚ÄúThe conventions of the world are just like that.‚Äù

original: ring po ma mthong ba rnams kyis yid brtan du med pa'i yul la shes pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yang kun rdzob kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ring po ma mthong ba rnams kyis yid brtan du med pa'i yul la shes pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yang kun rdzob kho na yin gyi /
translated: The reply that those who have not seen it for a long time make the convention of knowledge with regard to an object that is not reliable is only a superficial one,

original: don tshad ma can ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni nus pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don tshad ma can ni ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni nus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and not a valid one.

original: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that there is no valid cognition that establishes the relation of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste dus gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste dus gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that there is no valid cognition that establishes the relation of cause and effect, he raises the following objection: ‚ÄúBut if the effect is not perceived at the time when the cause exists, how can one know that it exists?‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngar 'bras bu nyid ma rtogs na'o //üîΩmthong ba ngo shes pa dag la yang snga ma bzhin du de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dzin @49b pa'i tshad ma med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngar 'bras bu nyid ma rtogs na'o // mthong ba ngo shes pa dag la yang snga ma bzhin du de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dzin @49b pa'i tshad ma med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so‚Äù means that if the effect were not previously perceived.

original: ngo shes sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply that even in the case of recognition, there is no valid cognition that apprehends it as the effect of that, as before, is ‚ÄúRecognition is not of what is prior.‚Äù

original: 'on te de ni don gyis go ba la sogs pas rtogs so snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni don gyis go ba la sogs pas rtogs so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is understood by implication, etc.,

original: dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúor by inference.‚Äù

original: ci ste dran pa las zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis mthong bas 'bras bu nyid 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste dran pa las zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis mthong bas 'bras bu nyid 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is from memory, he says, ‚Äúfrom memory,‚Äù because it is the apprehension of the result in the context.

original: ji ltar dran pa de 'jog par byed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa de 'jog par byed pa yin snyam na /
translated: How does memory establish it?

original: 'di ltar zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smras so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: dran pa'ang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: dran pa'ang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: ‚Äú Memory‚Äù is the answer.

original: ngo shes 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: ngo shes 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: It is not only recognition.

original: dran pa nyams su myong ba dang 'brel par ni de'am gzhan gyis shes pa nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dran pa nyams su myong ba dang 'brel par ni de'am gzhan gyis shes pa nus pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not possible for one to know that or something else in connection with the experience of memory.

original: 'brel pa rtogs pa las de rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa rtogs pa las de rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Nor is it that it is known from the understanding of the connection, he thinks.

original: 'on te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dran pa rtags ma yin mod //
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dran pa rtags ma yin mod //
translated: But if you think that memory is not a mark because there is no apprehension of the connection,

original: tshad ma ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
translated: that it is not a means of valid knowledge,

original: dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúmemory is not a means of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: des na de grub kyang tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin zhes ma gus pa brjod pa ni /üîΩde grub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de grub kyang tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin zhes ma gus pa brjod pa ni / de grub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, even if that is established, valid cognition is not established.üîΩThe expression of disrespect is ‚Äúeven if that is established. ‚Äù

original: de ltar dogs pa bsu nas zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa bsu nas zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Thus, having anticipated that,

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: up to ‚Äúif one wishes. ‚Äù

original: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ci ltar de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ci ltar de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù is by ‚Äúhow could it be like that? ‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ltar de ltar gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar yin na yang yin zhes ma gus pa brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ltar de ltar gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar yin na yang yin zhes ma gus pa brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could it be like that? ‚Äù is not an expression of disrespect, saying ‚Äúhow could it be like that? ‚Äù

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob ji ltar de ltar yin mod /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob ji ltar de ltar yin mod /
translated: However, ‚Äúhow could the conventional be like that? ‚Äù

original: tshad ma 'jug pa pas /
analyzed: tshad ma 'jug pa pas /
translated: is a statement of the distinction by the one who engages valid cognition,

original: kun rdzob bkug par ma byed cig / ces rnam par dbye ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob bkug par ma byed cig / ces rnam par dbye ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not destroy the conventional. ‚Äù

original: tshad ma bcug na ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma bcug na ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: If valid cognition is not engaged, then the result itself and so on

original: kun rdzob rnam par 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun rdzob rnam par 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: will be destroyed, because there would be no distinction.

original: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is said is ‚Äúworldly conventions. ‚Äù

original: 'di kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not a valid cognition, because it is said, only in this way.

original: don dam pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshad mas rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshad mas rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is said to be analyzed by valid cognition.

original: 'o na 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ji ltar 'grub snyam na mos pa'i rnam par dbye zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ji ltar 'grub snyam na mos pa'i rnam par dbye zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks, How are worldly results, etc. established? [the root text] says, the classification of interest.

original: 'di la dpe ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
