analyzed: 'di la dpe ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example here is said to be like a dream.

original: ci ltar rmi lam na btung ba dang / rkyal ba la sogs pa chu la nges pa'i tha snyad du mos pa tsam gyis yin pa de bzhin du yang 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar rmi lam na btung ba dang / rkyal ba la sogs pa chu la nges pa'i tha snyad du mos pa tsam gyis yin pa de bzhin du yang 'dir yang yin no //
translated: Just as in a dream, the mere interest in the conventions of water, such as drinking and washing, is established, so it is here as well.

original: gal te bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du du ba dang me dag kyang rgyu 'bras ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig las 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /üîΩkun rdzob kho nar @50a * //
analyzed: gal te bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du du ba dang me dag kyang rgyu 'bras ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig las 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /üîΩkun rdzob kho nar @50a * //
translated: If one thinks, Just as a pot and a cloth are not cause and effect, why is the convention of result, etc. made from one, but not from another? [the root text] says, only conventionally.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags nges pa las de nges pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags nges pa las de nges pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is ascertained from the beginningless predispositions‚Äù is from the point of view of worldly convention.

original: yang na gal te nyams su myong ba med na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu dang / cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: yang na gal te nyams su myong ba med na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu dang / cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Or, if there is no experience, then the distinction between valid knowledge and invalid knowledge would not occur in terms of conception, effect, the other, and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yod na 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yod na 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit occurs only if there are beginningless conceptual predispositions‚Äù is from the point of view of worldly convention.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar rnam par shes par smras pas khas blangs dgos so zhes brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar rnam par shes par smras pas khas blangs dgos so zhes brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthis must be accepted because it is undoubtedly consciousness‚Äù is the response to the question, ‚ÄúIf that is not so,

original: bag chags rgyur khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: bag chags rgyur khas mi len na'o //
translated: then the assertion that predispositions are the cause must be accepted.‚ÄùüîΩOr the statement ‚Äúif that is not so‚Äù means that if one does not accept that predispositions are the cause.

original: yang na gang dag ces bya ba ni 'brel pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang dag ces bya ba ni 'brel pa byed pa'o //
translated: Or the statement ‚Äúif that is not so‚Äù is a rhetorical device.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bri ba nyid byas nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bri ba nyid byas nas /
translated: Having made the objection, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called conventional?‚Äù

original: bden na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: bden na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: and so on, he refutes it with ‚ÄúIf it is true . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: autpala'i sngon po bzhin du bden pa'o //
analyzed: autpala'i sngon po bzhin du bden pa'o //
translated: It is true like the blueness of the lotus.

original: khyad par du ni kun rdzob 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni brdzun dang dam pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du ni kun rdzob 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni brdzun dang dam pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says that it is not tenable to distinguish it as conventional, with ‚ÄúFalse and ultimate . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa'i thun mong ba autpala nyid sngon pos khyad par du byed pa de bzhin du bden pa ni brdzun pa dang don dam pa dag gi thun mong ba nyid ma yin pa de ji ltar na de dag gis khyad
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa'i thun mong ba autpala nyid sngon pos khyad par du byed pa de bzhin du bden pa ni brdzun pa dang don dam pa dag gi thun mong ba nyid ma yin pa de ji ltar na de dag gis khyad
translated: Just as the lotus is common to both blue and non-blue, and is distinguished by the blue, in the same way, truth is not common to both false and ultimate, so how can it be distinguished by them?

original: par du phyed snga ma'i 'brel pa ni kun rdzob kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: par du phyed snga ma'i 'brel pa ni kun rdzob kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The connection with the first part of the verse is ‚ÄúThe conventional is also . . . ‚Äù

original: lhag ma ni ma bkral te gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ma bkral te gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest is not commented on because it is clear.

original: re zhig dbu ma'i lugs la brten nas 'gal ba med par bstan pa'i don du kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gsungs so //
analyzed: re zhig dbu ma'i lugs la brten nas 'gal ba med par bstan pa'i don du kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gsungs so //
translated: For the time being, in order to demonstrate the absence of contradiction in dependence on the Madhyamaka system, the nature of the conventional is stated.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ni zhes bya'o //
translated: This so-called conventional is

original: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de 'dra ba yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de 'dra ba yin pa des na'o //
translated: because the nature of the conventional is like that.

original: don ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning is the characteristic of the absence of contradiction, which is being explained.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni thog ma med pa zhes bya ba nas mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni thog ma med pa zhes bya ba nas mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: That itself is stated from ‚Äúbeginningless‚Äù up to ‚Äúthere is no contradiction.‚Äù

original: byin po la sogs pa ni snang ba tshad du zad de bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin po la sogs pa ni snang ba tshad du zad de bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The aggregates and so on are merely appearances, not true.

original: snang pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: snang pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: From where is this ‚Äúmerely appearance‚Äù stated?

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Blue and so on are

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because they are free from one and many.

original: 'o na shes pa ni yod pa yin no snyam na rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na shes pa ni yod pa yin no snyam na rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is thought that consciousness exists, it is said ‚Äúconsciousness also.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin @50b pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin @50b pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is not different from blue and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid bzhin du shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid bzhin du shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just like blue and so on, consciousness also does not exist.

original: 'o na sngon po la sogs pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sngon po la sogs pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
translated: Well then, how is it that blue and so on exist?

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'di ni sngon po'o 'di ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can de tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'di ni sngon po'o 'di ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can de tshad ma yin te /
translated: Because this worldly convention, which is of the nature of ‚Äúthis is blue,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is yellow,‚Äù and so on, is valid cognition.

original: med pa nyid ma yin pa des na tha snyad la nye bar mkho bas na bden pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid ma yin pa des na tha snyad la nye bar mkho bas na bden pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not nonexistent, it is true because it is necessary for conventions.

original: de las cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de ltar na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù he says.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir med pas na de dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa yang med pas kun rdzob pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir med pas na de dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa yang med pas kun rdzob pa yin no //
translated: Since blue and so on do not exist because they are free of being one or many, consciousness, which is not different from them, also does not exist and therefore is conventional.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mgu ba bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bden pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mgu ba bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na de'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bden pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it generates satisfaction in the world, it is not contradictory to say that it is true, due to the pride of the manifest.

original: 'o na don dam pa'i bden pa gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na don dam pa'i bden pa gang yin snyam na /
translated: Now, what is ultimate truth?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas de yang ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas de yang ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary statement teaches that:üîΩTherefore, ultimate truth is the emptiness of all things.

original: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa de ltar gnas pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa ni bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa de ltar gnas pa des na don dam pa'i bden pa ni bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no //
translated: Since conventional truth is established in that way, therefore, ultimate truth is the emptiness of all things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa nyid ni kun rdzob dang / cig shos kyi thun mong yin pas kun rdzob dang don dam pas khyad par du byed pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa nyid ni kun rdzob dang / cig shos kyi thun mong yin pas kun rdzob dang don dam pas khyad par du byed pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, since truth is common to both the conventional and the ultimate, it is distinguished by the conventional and the ultimate.

original: gal te snang ba'i phyi rol gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang rtog pa pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir na de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi yod pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad ji ltar dben snyam na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i phyi rol gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang rtog pa pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir na de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi yod pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad ji ltar dben snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince it follows external appearances and follows conceptualization, it is existent in the sense of performing a function, so how can it be devoid of all intrinsic reality?‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The response is,] ‚ÄúExternal . . .‚Äù

original: gal te de lta ma mthong mod //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma mthong mod //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIt is not seen in that way, indeed,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang de rgyud nyid yin pa ji ltar dag snyam na 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang de rgyud nyid yin pa ji ltar dag snyam na 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: then how is it that it is a continuum? [The response is,] ‚ÄúNevertheless . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar sad pa'i rtog pa la de dgag snyam na ;
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sad pa'i rtog pa la de dgag snyam na ;
translated: Well then, how is it refuted in the conceptualization of the waking state?

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩsad pa'i rtog pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste / sad pa'i rtog pa yang ngo //
translated: [The response is,] ‚ÄúMoreover . . .‚ÄùüîΩ[The response is,] ‚ÄúThe conceptualization of the waking state . . .‚Äù

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi rgyu yin par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi rgyu yin par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means that it is the cause of latent propensities.

original: phyi rol rgyu yin pa bkag pa'i bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol rgyu yin pa bkag pa'i bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is devoid of all intrinsic reality in the sense of refuting external causes.

original: de ltar dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis 'gal ba med par bstan nas rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa yang de'i bdag nyid du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis 'gal ba med par bstan nas rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa yang de'i bdag nyid du byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having shown that there is no contradiction in the Madhyamaka system, the existence of blue, etc., which is not different from the existence of consciousness, is made to be of the nature of self-awareness.

original: skye ba la sogs pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But arising, etc. are not like that.

original: de la med pa'i kun rdzob yin la snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par @51a * //
analyzed: de la med pa'i kun rdzob yin la snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pas rtogs par @51a * //
translated: They are conventional non-existents, and are to be understood by conceptual thought that arises from direct perception of the prior and subsequent moments.

original: bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, they do exist.

original: yod pa nyid yin no zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lta ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin no zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lta ba bshad pa ni /
translated: This is the YogƒÅcƒÅra view.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù is the word.üîΩThus, existence and non-existence are not contradictory in terms of reliance on valid cognition and worldly convention.

original: de ltar tshad ma dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas yod pa dang med pa dag mi 'gal yang 'grel pa byed pas 'gal ba brjod pa ni rtsod pa bslang ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas yod pa dang med pa dag mi 'gal yang 'grel pa byed pas 'gal ba brjod pa ni rtsod pa bslang ba ni /
translated: But the author of the commentary states a contradiction, and the debate is raised:

original: ci ste kun rdzob ces zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste kun rdzob ces zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the conventional is non-existent, then how can it be said to exist?‚Äù

original: 'gog par byed pa ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog par byed pa ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not so‚Äù means that it is not true that it is stopped.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par nus pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par nus pa ltar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means in the way that it is possible in the ultimate.

original: de ltar ni zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i nus pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i nus pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the way that it is possible in the presentation of mere understanding.

original: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.üîΩIf it were the case that something arose in the way that it is not possible, then there would be a contradiction.

original: gal te rang bzhin gang gis nus pa med pa de ltar skye pa yin na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig / gang gis chos ji ltar nus pa med pa de ltar ni mi skye la /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gang gis nus pa med pa de ltar skye pa yin na ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba zhig / gang gis chos ji ltar nus pa med pa de ltar ni mi skye la /
translated: But it is not the case that something arises in the way that it is not possible.

original: ji ltar skye ba de ltar yang nus pa tshad ma dang bral ba yin pa de'i tshe 'gag pa'i gtam ga la yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba de ltar yang nus pa tshad ma dang bral ba yin pa de'i tshe 'gag pa'i gtam ga la yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: And when it arises in the way that it is possible, then it is not the case that it is devoid of a valid cognition of possibility. So how can there be a discussion of cessation?

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa nyid kun rdzob yin pa de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa nyid kun rdzob yin pa de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If arising, etc. are themselves conventional, then when it is said that ‚Äúit arises conventionally,‚Äù

original: skye ba po zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: skye ba po zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: then the error of the agent of arising would follow.

original: skye pa po zhes bya bar yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye pa po zhes bya bar yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: To anticipate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe agent of arising, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba'i dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba'i dri ba'o //
translated: The question is, In what nature?

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The answer is, Conventionally,

original: tshad mas ma bcad pa nyid kyis so //üîΩgang yang 'grel ba byed pas kun rdzob sun phyung nas /
analyzed: tshad mas ma bcad pa nyid kyis so // gang yang 'grel ba byed pas kun rdzob sun phyung nas /
translated: because it is not determined by a valid cognition.

original: kun rdzob ces ming tsam byas pa yin na yang zhes brjod pa de ming ma gtogs pa'i cho 'phrul yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces ming tsam byas pa yin na yang zhes brjod pa de ming ma gtogs pa'i cho 'phrul yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Also, the commentator, having refuted the conventional, says, Even if it is just a name, the conventional, it is a magical display apart from the name.

original: de bzhin kun rdzob ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kun rdzob ces bya ba'o //
translated: So too is what is called conventional.

original: de smras pa gzhan dag kyang bkod nas sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de smras pa gzhan dag kyang bkod nas sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: Having set forth that statement, he refutes others.

original: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag / ces bya ba'o //
translated: The question is, If the effect is not in the assemblage of causes and conditions, how can it arise from that?

original: 'das pa nyid ni 'das ma thag pa'o //üîΩ'das nas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid ni 'das ma thag pa'o // 'das nas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The answer is, Because it is not in the assemblage, it arises.üîΩThe question is, If it is not in the assemblage, how can it arise from that?üîΩThe answer is, Because it is not in the assemblage, it arises.üîΩThe question is, If it is not in the assemblage, how can it arise from that?

original: bzlog pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i dus na yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par med par grub pa'i don du 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i dus na yod pa'i phyir ro // khyad par med par grub pa'i don du 'dri ba ni /
translated: The answer is, Because it is not in the assemblage, it arises.üîΩThe question is, If it is not in the assemblage, how can it arise from that?üîΩThe answer is, Because it is not in the assemblage, it arises.

original: skye ba'i dus de gang yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus de gang yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The question is, If it is not in the assemblage, how can it arise from that?üîΩThe answer is, Because it is not in the assemblage, it arises.

original: 'byung ba'i dus lha 'byin pa'i dus yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus lha 'byin pa'i dus yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the time of arising is the time of the arising of the deity.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dang po sel ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dang po sel ba'o //
translated: If is the first refutation.

original: 'byung ba po 'bras bu'i rgyu yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba po 'bras bu'i rgyu yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the agent would exist as the cause of the effect.

original: gnyis pa sel ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sel ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second refutation is ‚ÄúBut if. . .

original: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning is that the arising is the generation.

original: yod pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The existence is the immediately preceding cause.

original: de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: What is the problem if that is the case?

original: de'i phyir chod pa yang zhes bya @51b ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir chod pa yang zhes bya @51b ba'o ;
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven if it is interrupted. . .

original: / de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni gal te 'bras bu las sngar yod pa yin la 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ma thag pa'i rgyu ni gal te 'bras bu las sngar yod pa yin la 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni med pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The immediately preceding cause is if it exists prior to the effect, but not if a long time has passed since it ceased.

original: des na gang zhig de ma thag pa nyid kyis 'bras bu med pa'i dus na yod pa'i de nyid ni rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gang zhig de ma thag pa nyid kyis 'bras bu med pa'i dus na yod pa'i de nyid ni rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that which is the cause by virtue of being the immediately preceding condition when the effect does not exist is just that which exists.üîΩIt is not the former, because it is interrupted.

original: snga ma dag ni ma yin te chod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa na skad cig gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma dag ni ma yin te chod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa na skad cig gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is suspected, he says, ‚ÄúIn an instant. . .üîΩ‚Äù

original: dri la sogs pa'i skad cig kyang gzugs kyi skad cig bzhin du gzugs kyi 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa yin pa de dag kyang rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa'i skad cig kyang gzugs kyi skad cig bzhin du gzugs kyi 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa yin pa de dag kyang rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the moments of smell and so on are the immediately preceding conditions of the effect of form, just like the moments of form, and they are also causes.

original: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection that this entails absurd consequences is, ‚ÄúBecause they are different continua.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ma thag pa nyid kyi rgyu yin na dri la sogs pa rgyud tha dad pa nyid du mi 'grub ces lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa nyid kyi rgyu yin na dri la sogs pa rgyud tha dad pa nyid du mi 'grub ces lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIf they are the cause of the immediately preceding condition, it is not established that smell and so on are different continua.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response.

original: rgyud tha dad pa nyid ni rgyu nyid dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa nyid ni rgyu nyid dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Being different continua is not contradictory to being a cause,

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no harm in that.

original: ma brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: ma brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa med par shes pa yin pas /
translated: Unanalyzed means that it is known without analysis.

original: des grub pa yang ma brtags pas /
analyzed: des grub pa yang ma brtags pas /
translated: Therefore, what is established by that is also unanalyzed.

original: grub pa yin yang tshad mas grub pa kho na yin pas ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa de yang mi bden pa ste zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: grub pa yin yang tshad mas grub pa kho na yin pas ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa de yang mi bden pa ste zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: But the refutation that even if it is established, it is only established by a valid cognition, so how can it be conventional? is not true.

original: ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
translated: How is it not true?

original: brtags pa ni tshad ma la brjod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni tshad ma la brjod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The investigation is said to be by a valid cognition.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni brtag pa tshad ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni brtag pa tshad ma yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, means because the investigation is by a valid cognition.

original: 'o na rgyu mi 'dod na gang yin snyam na sgyu ma'i don yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu mi 'dod na gang yin snyam na sgyu ma'i don yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you do not accept that cause, what is it? The meaning of illusion, and so on.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pas rtogs pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pas rtogs pa'i don nyid do //
translated: This very, means the very object understood by a non-valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgras tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa 'dod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgras tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa 'dod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement The meaning understood by a non-valid cognition is accepted by the term 'known to the world'.

original: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ni kun rdzob dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ni kun rdzob dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning understood by a non-valid cognition is expressed by the terms 'conventional,' 'illusion,' and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgra'i don ma rtogs par grags pa'i don yin pa'i rgyu des na ma brtags na grags pa'i don ni tshad mas grags pa'i don du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgra'i don ma rtogs par grags pa'i don yin pa'i rgyu des na ma brtags na grags pa'i don ni tshad mas grags pa'i don du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don skyon med do //
translated: Since the meaning of the terms ‚Äúconcealer‚Äù and ‚Äúillusion‚Äù is not understood in that way, the meaning of the term ‚Äúconcealer‚Äù is the meaning that is renowned. Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúrenowned‚Äù is faultless when it is said that ‚Äúthe meaning that is renowned when not analyzed is the meaning that is renowned through valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa gang la tshad ma rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de ni kun rdzob ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang la tshad ma rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de ni kun rdzob ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni bstan bcos byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat which is understood by valid knowledge is not a concealer‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúby the author of the treatise.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i tshad ma cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i tshad ma cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: The division of the other valid knowledge that is external to reflexive awareness

original: kun rdzob nyid yin te /üîΩphyi rol ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid yin te / phyi rol ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: is a concealer.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is external and dependent‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúof valid knowledge and invalid knowledge.‚Äù
Why is that?

original: phyir zhe na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyir zhe na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is like this‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúbecause it is nondeceptive.‚Äù

original: mi slu ba'i rang bzhin brjod pa na ni mi slu ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i rang bzhin brjod pa na ni mi slu ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwhen the nature of nondeceptiveness is stated‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúnondeceptiveness is also . . . ‚Äù

original: gang la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de ni shes pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod pa ni thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde las cir 'gyur snyam na gal te don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de ni shes pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod pa ni thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o // de las cir 'gyur snyam na gal te don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat by which one establishes the valid knowledge that depends on it is another consciousness‚Äù is the response.

original: shes pa snga na don myong na shes pa phyi ma don med pa la ci ste ltos te /
analyzed: shes pa snga na don myong na shes pa phyi ma don med pa la ci ste ltos te /
translated: What would be the consequence of that? If the prior consciousness experiences the object, then what is the purpose of the subsequent consciousness in relation to that which is meaningless?

original: de tsam gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood by that alone.

original: des na thob pa don du gnyer ba la don ci zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thob pa don du gnyer ba la don ci zhig yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, what purpose would there be for one who seeks to obtain it?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thob pa don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thob pa don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because there is no purpose in seeking to obtain it.

original: shes pa phyi mas lhag par rtogs par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa phyi mas lhag par rtogs par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to the doubt that the subsequent consciousness understands more is

original: 'on te phyis pa de ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'on te phyis pa de ni gzhan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut that subsequent consciousness is different.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response.

original: 'di des bstan pa na me yin no zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di des bstan pa na me yin no zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is fire because of that‚Äù is the response.

original: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga mas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga mas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the prior consciousness.

original: de thob pas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa ste /
analyzed: de thob pas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the line ‚ÄúValidity is due to obtaining that.‚Äù

original: de ni shes pa snga ma'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa snga ma'o //
translated: This is the earlier cognition.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba 'di skabs kyi gzhan no ;
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba 'di skabs kyi gzhan no ;
translated: ‚ÄúObtaining‚Äù is the other factor in the present context.

original: / de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: / de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf that were so.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan thob pas gzhan tshad mas yin na shes pa thams cad la ci yang rung ba thob pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gzhan thob pas gzhan tshad mas yin na shes pa thams cad la ci yang rung ba thob pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If validity were due to obtaining something else, then it would follow, absurdly, that all cognitions are valid, because all cognitions obtain something.

original: tshad mar thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad mar thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bsal zin ba'i phyogs gnyis la ni mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni ci ste nye bar bstan pa la yang zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: bsal zin ba'i phyogs gnyis la ni mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni ci ste nye bar bstan pa la yang zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The response to the two positions that have already been refuted is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf that were so, then even the demonstration.‚Äù

original: / de lta yin na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩcung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de lta yin na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩcung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response to the position that it is neither is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore there would be no difference between valid cognitions and nonvalid cognitions.‚ÄùüîΩThe line ‚ÄúThere would be no difference whatsoever‚Äù means that there would be no difference between objects of knowledge and so on.

original: 'on te gzhan tsam gyi yul can ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'i mthar thug pa can 'jig rten mngon par 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan tsam gyi yul can ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa thob pa'i mthar thug pa can 'jig rten mngon par 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the subject is merely other, it is not a valid cognition, but rather the world‚Äôs mere desire, which has no ultimate attainment of what is desired?

original: de lta na ni de kun rdzob pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar yin du zad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni de kun rdzob pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar yin du zad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then it is only conventional.

original: ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa yin snyam na /
translated: What is the point of desiring it?

original: dngos po'i de nyid las 'das nas //
analyzed: dngos po'i de nyid las 'das nas //
translated: Having transcended the reality of things,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not a valid cognition.

original: gang zhig ji ltar yod pa de kho na ltar de nyid du yod pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig ji ltar yod pa de kho na ltar de nyid du yod pa la /
translated: What exists as it is, just that exists as it is.

original: tshad ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
translated: The classification of valid cognitions, etc. also exists conventionally.

original: de lta yin dang de ni de kho nar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de ni de kho nar yod pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it exists as it is.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam 'grel ba 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam 'grel ba 'jug pa'o //
translated: The commentary begins with ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: spyi la yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi la yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in universals‚Äù means in the performance of function.

original: spyi ni shes pa dang brjod pa tha dad pa @52b med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni shes pa dang brjod pa tha dad pa @52b med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa yin no //
translated: The general is the object that has the characteristic of being inseparable from cognition and expression.

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni spyi la sogs pa la yod /
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni spyi la sogs pa la yod /
translated: ‚Äú In all‚Äù means that it exists in universals, etc.

original: min te zhes bya ba ni spyi la don bya ba yod pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: min te zhes bya ba ni spyi la don bya ba yod pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú It is not‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúthe existence of the object in the universal.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid la blo dang 'brel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid la blo dang 'brel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal‚Äôs characteristic is not seen to be related to cognition, i.e., it is not seen to be concomitant with cognition or to be absent when cognition is absent.

original: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
translated: Like cognition of form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: This is an example of dissimilarity.

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyis yul la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa bdag po ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyis yul la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa bdag po ste /
translated: ‚Äú In the object through the objective and dominant conditions‚Äù means that the object is form, etc., and the dominant condition is the eye, etc.

original: de dag nyid rkyen yin te lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid rkyen yin te lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the conditions because they are the cooperating causes.

original: yul gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The object is the referent of the verb.

original: de bzhin du spyi'i blo dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bdag pa'i rkyen gyi yul la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi'i blo dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bdag pa'i rkyen gyi yul la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the general cognition is not so, i.e., it does not follow the object of the objective condition and the dominant condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon mthong ba'i 'bad rtsol zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i 'bad rtsol zhes gsungs so //
translated: because of the effort of seeing before.

original: gal te spyi'i blo bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa'i blo dag kyang nang gi byed pa tsam las 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i blo bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa'i blo dag kyang nang gi byed pa tsam las 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the cognitions of the object, etc., are not like the general cognition, i.e., if they do not arise from mere internal activity,

original: de ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: then, in that case, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po sngar yod pa'o zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po sngar yod pa'o zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: Why would it be so? It should be seen that the entity exists before.

original: gal te gang gis don sngar yod par rtog pa don la mi ltos na nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis don sngar yod par rtog pa don la mi ltos na nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
translated: If one imagines that the object exists before and does not depend on the object, what is the fault?

original: gal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: If, etc., is stated.

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: Then, etc., is drawn out.

original: gang la dang gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la dang gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with in regard to what, where, etc.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbzlog pa brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba'o // bzlog pa brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy one who has an eye-disease‚Äù is the example.üîΩThe reversal is stated in ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bzlog pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bzlog pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the reversal.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar nus pa rtog snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar nus pa rtog snyam na /
translated: But how can you conceive of the possibility of that?

original: des na zhes bya ba de ltar gyi don to //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba de ltar gyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: snam bu la sogs pa'i don de las blo skye ba na zhes bya ba 'brel to //
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa'i don de las blo skye ba na zhes bya ba 'brel to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe cognition of cloth, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar de las skye na /
analyzed: ji ltar de las skye na /
translated: How does it arise from that?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba gtan tshigs kyi tshig sbyar te /üîΩspyi'i blo ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba gtan tshigs kyi tshig sbyar te / spyi'i blo ni de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The words of the reason are ‚Äúbecause it is a universal.‚Äù

original: spyi'i blo ni de lta ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: spyi'i blo ni de lta ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of a universal is not like that‚Äù is connected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not like that?

original: gang gi byed pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi byed pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it arises from the mere activity of that.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid sbyor bas rgyas 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid sbyor bas rgyas 'debs pa ni /
translated: This is the application of the seal of the syllogism.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect of that‚Äù is the predicate of the probandum.

original: spyi'i blo yang 'bad rtsol tsam las skyes pa yin no zhes phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba ni ma brjod de /
analyzed: spyi'i blo yang 'bad rtsol tsam las skyes pa yin no zhes phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba ni ma brjod de /
translated: The universal is also born from the mere activity of that.

original: gsal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdgag par bya ba dngos po tha dad par nus pa @53a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir ro // dgag par bya ba dngos po tha dad par nus pa @53a * //
translated: because of the clarity.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i khyab byed ni de tsam las mi 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i khyab byed ni de tsam las mi 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The pervasion that is the means of understanding the capacity of a different thing to be refuted is that it does not arise from that alone.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni de tsam las byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni de tsam las byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: And that which is contradictory with that is the arising from that alone.

original: des na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'di ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // 'di ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the contradictory pervasion is observed.

original: ba lang nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The anticipation of the objection is ‚Äúbecause of the nature of a cow.‚Äù

original: 'on mi skye ba ji ltar yin zhe na /üîΩbag chags sad byed de min pas //
analyzed: 'on mi skye ba ji ltar yin zhe na / bag chags sad byed de min pas //
translated: But how is it that it does not arise?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is not the awakener of the latent potentialities.

original: rta de min pas so //
analyzed: rta de min pas so //
translated: Because it is not a horse.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rta de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rta de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the latter half is ‚Äúthat horse.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir rta de mi phyed pa snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rta de mi phyed pa snyam na /
translated: Why is that horse not divided?

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very thing‚Äù

original: nog la sogs pa dang ldan ba nyid las so //
analyzed: nog la sogs pa dang ldan ba nyid las so //
translated: because of possessing a hump and so on.

original: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni ba lang nyid med pa las ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni ba lang nyid med pa las ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of the former half is ‚Äúbecause of the absence of the nature of a cow.‚Äù

original: de la ba lang nyid kyi blo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de la ba lang nyid kyi blo zhes 'brel to //
translated: There, the phrase ‚Äúthe cognition of the nature of a cow‚Äù is connected.

original: 'o na de la ba lang gi blo med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de la ba lang gi blo med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But why is there no cognition of an ox in that?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But, on the other hand,

original: ba lang gi tshogs la yang gong bu bzhin du rta la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba la snang ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ba lang gi tshogs la yang gong bu bzhin du rta la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba la snang ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: in a herd of oxen, a nature that is not seen in a mass, like a horse, etc., is not seen in a cow.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ste rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ste rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By which, i.e., by the cognition itself.

original: de yod dam zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi tshogs la'o //
analyzed: de yod dam zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi tshogs la'o //
translated: Is it there? In a herd of oxen.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni rta la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni rta la sogs pa la ste /
translated: No, in a horse, etc.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: This is the arrangement of the activity.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa las snga phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa las snga phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not existent before and after in that way, i.e., in that way, by the cognition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni yang ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni yang ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If, i.e., again, suspecting nonestablishment, he anticipates.

original: don dam pa ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni dngos po'o //
translated: The ultimate is the entity.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Mutually, i.e., the reply.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo phan tshun ldog pa yin gyi gsal ba ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las phan tshun ldog par skye ba yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo phan tshun ldog pa yin gyi gsal ba ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las phan tshun ldog par skye ba yin no //
translated: By the power of beginningless habitual tendencies, the conceptual mind is mutually exclusive. But the manifestation arises by the power of its own cause, and is mutually exclusive.

original: des na grub pa nye bar 'jug pa'i phyir ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na grub pa nye bar 'jug pa'i phyir ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of positing a real entity?

original: gal te rtogs par bya ba yod pa la blo mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbden te 'on kyang rtogs par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rtogs par bya ba yod pa la blo mi ldog pa ma yin nam zhe na / bden te 'on kyang rtogs par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin gyi /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the mind is not non-different from the existent object of understanding?üîΩIt is true, but the mind is only different from what is not the object of understanding.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not different from the object of understanding.

original: bsal bar bya bas na bsal ba ste spyi'o //üîΩgal te de med kyang mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩ'on kyang de yod pa nyid na de yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: bsal bar bya bas na bsal ba ste spyi'o // gal te de med kyang mi 'gyur gyi / 'on kyang de yod pa nyid na de yod pa yin na ni /
translated: The object of exclusion is the universal.üîΩIf the universal does not exist, the mind is not non-different from the object of exclusion.

original: de'i tshe nus pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nus pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the universal exists, the mind is not non-different from the object of exclusion.üîΩIf the universal exists, the mind is not non-different from the object of exclusion.

original: gal te thams cad la blo yod na rtogs par bya ba yang thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thams cad la blo yod na rtogs par bya ba yang thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to this is: ‚ÄúThat is a universal.‚Äù

original: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy one with eye disease‚Äù is the reply.

original: de lta bu @53b kho nar ni khyab pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu @53b kho nar ni khyab pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn just that way‚Äù is the qualification.

original: spyi de la yang gzhan gyis mthong ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi de la yang gzhan gyis mthong ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a pervader‚Äù is the fault.

original: de yod pa ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa yod na'o //
analyzed: de yod pa ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa yod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts existence is due to effort, etc.‚Äù

original: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy one with eye disease‚Äù is the reply.

original: ji ltar rab rib nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na de kho na ma yin pa dmigs par byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phyin ci log gi 'du byed sad pa yang nang gi byed pa nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na de kho na ma
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na de kho na ma yin pa dmigs par byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phyin ci log gi 'du byed sad pa yang nang gi byed pa nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na de kho na ma
translated: Just as the eye disease is the cause of the appearance of the unreal object, in the same way, the activation of the unreal formative forces is the cause of the impairment of the inner agent.

original: yin pa dmigs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yin pa dmigs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the object of perception‚Äù is the meaning.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is a particle.

original: dogs pa lhag pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: dogs pa lhag pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection is anticipated:

original: don bya ba grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don bya ba grub pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe accomplishment of the object‚Äù is the meaning.

original: sgra la sogs pa la don bya ba grub pa med pas na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la don bya ba grub pa med pas na /
translated: Since sound and so on do not accomplish the object,

original: mi bden pa'i phyir dbang po nyams par grub pa des na phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i phyir dbang po nyams par grub pa des na phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: they are not real, and therefore the defect of mutual dependence is not established.

original: lan du 'di ni brjod ma thag pa'i spyi la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: lan du 'di ni brjod ma thag pa'i spyi la yang mtshungs te /
translated: The reply is: This is the same for the just-mentioned universals.

original: don bya ba med pas mi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: don bya ba med pas mi bden pa yin la /
translated: Since they do not accomplish the object, they are not real.

original: de las ni spyi'i 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ni spyi'i 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, the defect of the cognition of the universal is established.

original: des na zhes bya ba'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is stated:

original: shes pa tsam la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa tsam la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso for mere cognition.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo nang gi byed pa las byung bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo nang gi byed pa las byung bar bstan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù is from the teaching that the cognition of the universal arises from an internal activity.

original: rtsol ba ni dran pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni dran pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEffort‚Äù is the capacity of memory.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pas bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pas bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the future, etc.

original: de dag nyid nang gi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid nang gi yan lag ste /
translated: They are internal conditions,

original: nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: because they are the proximate causes.

original: de dag rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su byed pa ste /
translated: They are subsequent because they follow after.

original: de'i phyir na blo nang gi byed pa las byung bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na blo nang gi byed pa las byung bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition arises from the internal activity.

original: spyi ni 'dogs pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: spyi ni 'dogs pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The universal is the designation.

original: grangs sogs zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgras bshad pa 'di la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: grangs sogs zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgras bshad pa 'di la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i /
translated: The words ‚Äúnumber, etc.‚Äù refer to the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the verse.

original: gal te rnam par dbye ba med pa'i rdzas kho na snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dbye ba med pa'i rdzas kho na snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the substance that is not differentiated does not appear,

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni so sor dbang po las 'das pas na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni so sor dbang po las 'das pas na /
translated: then the atoms are individually beyond the senses,

original: tshogs pa rnams kyang dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams kyang dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the collection is also beyond the senses.

original: des na gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i rdzas kyi blo snang gi byed pa tsam la rag las pa ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: des na gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i rdzas kyi blo snang gi byed pa tsam la rag las pa ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Therefore, how can the cognition of substance, which is conceived as one, be dependent on the mere activity of the appearance?

original: nang byed pa tsam la rag las par bstan pa'i don du gzugs can ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can snang ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i rdzas la ni ma dmigs pas gnod do zhes brjod na ni /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

translated: For that reason, the collection itself is the cause, and the effect arises from that alone.

original: 'dogs pa'i spyi bzlog pa'i don du gzhan gyi 'dod pa slong bar byed pa ni gal te 'dogs pa'i bya ba de'i yul ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i spyi bzlog pa'i don du gzhan gyi 'dod pa slong bar byed pa ni gal te 'dogs pa'i bya ba de'i yul ma yin na /
translated: In order to refute the universal of designation, he raises the opponent‚Äôs belief: ‚ÄúIf the activity of designation is not the object of that,

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it that the universal of the effect is seen in the cause?‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog ba'o ;
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù he says, is a refutation.

original: / gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the manifest is manifested by the manifest,‚Äù means because the manifest is manifested by itself.

original: 'di nyid skabs la nye bar sbyor bar byed pa ni las kyi spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid skabs la nye bar sbyor bar byed pa ni las kyi spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He applies this very point to the present context: ‚ÄúThe universal of the effect is seen in the cause.‚Äù

original: de lta yin mod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas mi dmigs pa'i phyir na las kyi spyi med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin mod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas mi dmigs pa'i phyir na las kyi spyi med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Having anticipated this with Indeed, that is so, he says, But it is not the universal of action because it is not perceived.

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gis gsal ba de la ni brten pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gis gsal ba de la ni brten pa'am zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, It is based on the manifestation of the hand, etc., because it is based on the manifestation of the hand, etc.

original: de lta ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni brten pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni brten pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not based on that means not based on the manifestation.

original: bar gyi gsal ba med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bar gyi gsal ba med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because there is no manifestation in between,

original: de gzhan gyi gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it would be manifested by another manifestation.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, Even by another manifestation,

original: rigs 'ga' zhig ni gsal bas gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar 'gyur ro snyam na ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs 'ga' zhig ni gsal bas gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar 'gyur ro snyam na ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because some think that a certain class is manifested by another manifestation.

original: gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dogs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dogs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is not manifested, it is just imputed to be manifested.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na skad cig dang po nyid la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na skad cig dang po nyid la zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? he says, because it is not manifested in the first moment.

original: dus tha dad pa du mas gsal bar byed do snyam pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa du mas gsal bar byed do snyam pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is manifested by many different times, he says, But if it is manifested by many different times.

original: phyogs 'di yang brda sprod pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang brda sprod pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: This is also the opinion of the grammarians.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brda sprod pa pas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te ji skad brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brda sprod pa pas zhes bya ba'o // gal te ji skad brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir na /
translated: This is why the author of the Varttika says:

original: rigs re re gsal ba min na lan ni tshogs las gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs re re gsal ba min na lan ni tshogs las gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the manifestation of a single class is impossible because of the faults that you attribute to it,üîΩwe reply: the manifestation results from the totality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because there is no other way.

original: gang gis cig car ma yin ba rnams kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba 'das pa ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin te rang shes pas gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis cig car ma yin ba rnams kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba 'das pa ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin te rang shes pas gzhan gyi blo'i rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past does not manifest the manifestation of the simultaneous, because it is not possible that the cognition of one is the cause of the cognition of another.

original: de na rnam pa gnyis las rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na rnam pa gnyis las rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no other way than the two ways.

original: de la skad cig re res @57b gsal bar byed pa nyid ni gsal ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la skad cig re res @57b gsal bar byed pa nyid ni gsal ma thag pa yin no //
translated: Of these two ways, the manifestation by each moment is the immediately past.

original: cig car tshogs pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: cig car tshogs pa yang mi srid de /
translated: The simultaneous totality is not possible.

original: des na de gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the manifestation of the totality is not possible. This is the idea.

original: gal te goms pa las nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa gsal ba de bzhin du skad cig gcig gis gsal bar byed pa yin no snyam pa ni dogs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te goms pa las nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa gsal ba de bzhin du skad cig gcig gis gsal bar byed pa yin no snyam pa ni dogs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that just as a gem, silver, etc. are clarified by polishing, so they are clarified by a single moment, then the verse beginning with ‚Äúfrom that doubt‚Äù is stated.

original: nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba ni /
analyzed: nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of the entity of a gem, silver, etc.

original: goms pa las de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi /
analyzed: goms pa las de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi /
translated: is clarified in that way from polishing.

original: 'dogs pa la sogs par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dogs pa la sogs par ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it is imputed, etc.

original: btags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes btab pa ni 'og na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes btab pa ni 'og na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is imputed‚Äù is below.

original: shes pa de zhes bya ba ni 'dogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de zhes bya ba ni 'dogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat cognition‚Äù is the imputing cognition.

original: grangs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The understanding of number, etc. is also shown to be without an objective support.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way‚Äù is the same as that.

original: gal te gang gis de'i rtogs pa rnams dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'grub pa ldan pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar med pa yin snyam na de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gis de'i rtogs pa rnams dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'grub pa ldan pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar med pa yin snyam na de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that how can the understanding of that be established as without an objective support, since number, etc. do not exist, then the verse beginning with ‚Äúin that way‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i phyir spyi la sogs pa las don bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi la sogs pa las don bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, an object is not produced from a universal, etc.

original: des na mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of over-extension of the definition.

original: de'i phyir don byed nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the position: ‚ÄúThe definition of a real entity is that which is able to perform a function.‚Äù

original: da ni don zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i nus pa med pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni don zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i nus pa med pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa yin te /
translated: Now, if one says that the definition of a universal is over-extended, because it is devoid of the distinction ‚Äúobject,‚Äù and because it is non-existent,

original: don med pa la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response to this is ‚ÄúIf you say . . . .‚Äù

original: don nyid nus pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: don nyid nus pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The appearance of an object as having the nature of being able to perform a function is a real entity.üîΩThe appearance of an object as having the nature of being unable to perform a function is a universal.

original: nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni spyi yin no zhes khyad par du byed pas nyes pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni spyi yin no zhes khyad par du byed pas nyes pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Since it is distinguished in this way, there is no fault. This is the response.

original: skra shad la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is ‚Äúa hair, etc.‚Äù

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seen by one with an eye disease.

original: 'di don gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di don gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the definition of an object.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the meaning is that it is the characteristic of a different object.

original: gal te 'di ni don gyi tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni don gyi tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa la mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this is the characteristic of a different object, it would not be a non-thing,üîΩbecause it is not an object.

original: don ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas bshad pa ni shes byar gsungs so //
analyzed: don ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas bshad pa ni shes byar gsungs so //
translated: To respond to this qualm, it is said that it is an object of knowledge.

original: med pa yang shes bya nyid yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang shes bya nyid yin te /
translated: Non-existence is also an object of knowledge,

original: gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the characteristic of the existence of another.

original: yang na tshad mas yongs su bcad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshad mas yongs su bcad pa nyid yin la /
translated: Or, it is an object of knowledge because it is ascertained by valid cognition.

original: dogs pa med par 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir don kyang yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa med par 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir don kyang yin no //
translated: It is also an object because it is the object of going without qualm.

original: des na don med par mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir na don @58a * //
analyzed: des na don med par mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir na don @58a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not an object because it is conceived as non-existent.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in saying this.

original: gal te skra la sogs pa spyi ma yin na 'o na de dag spyi yin snyam na spyi'i rang bzhin bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te skra la sogs pa spyi ma yin na 'o na de dag spyi yin snyam na spyi'i rang bzhin bshad pa ni /
translated: If things like hair are not universals, then what are they? The nature of universals is explained:

original: don nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: don nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: They are just objects.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ji ltar spyi yin snyam na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ji ltar spyi yin snyam na /
translated: How can the nature of a particular be a universal?

original: spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúwhen it is cognized as the nature of a universal.‚Äù

original: gal te don yin na /
analyzed: gal te don yin na /
translated: If it is an object,

original: ji ltar med pa'i don gyi rang bzhin du smra zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa'i don gyi rang bzhin du smra zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: how can it be said to be the nature of a nonexistent object?

original: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIf it is this . . .‚Äù

original: nus pa med par snang ba nyid bshad pa ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa med par snang ba nyid bshad pa ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the appearance of an object without capacity is ‚Äúdirectly.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa dngos su mi nus pa de ni spyi dang nus med nyid ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa dngos su mi nus pa de ni spyi dang nus med nyid ces sbyar ro //
translated: The object that is incapable of directly performing the function of consciousness is connected with ‚Äúa universal and without capacity.‚Äù

original: don nyid brjod pa ni brgyud pa yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don nyid brjod pa ni brgyud pa yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the object itself is ‚Äúindirectly.‚Äù

original: brgyud pas nus pa gang yin pa de ni don dang nus pa zhes brjod pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: brgyud pas nus pa gang yin pa de ni don dang nus pa zhes brjod pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The capacity that is indirect is connected with ‚Äúthe object and capacity.‚Äù

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don de lta yin mod /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don de lta yin mod /
translated: If external objects are like that,

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'i ji ltar don du brjod snyam na spyi'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'i ji ltar don du brjod snyam na spyi'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: how can the universal that appears in a conceptual cognition be said to be an object? The answer is: ‚Äúthe universal . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i spyi'o //
translated: This is the general rule for the appearance of conceptualization.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni brgyud nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni brgyud nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for the designation is stated: indirectly.

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i don de 'bras bu ga la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i don de 'bras bu ga la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object that appears as the nature of potentiality is the effect, because it is the entity of that.

original: yang na don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is the effect of the object, because it is the effect of the object.

original: dgos pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa la thabs gzhan med par bstan pa'i ched du'o //üîΩgal te rnam par rtog pa rnam pa'i spyi'i don gyis byas pa'am /üîΩdon gyis 'bras bu can yin na 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa la thabs gzhan med par bstan pa'i ched du'o // gal te rnam par rtog pa rnam pa'i spyi'i don gyis byas pa'am / don gyis 'bras bu can yin na 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose is to show that there is no other means for understanding the hidden object.üîΩIf conceptualization is produced by the general object or is the effect of the object, then how is it that it is not the object?

original: 'on te 'di yang don kyang byas pa'am de'i 'bras bu yin na de ji ltar spyi ma yin pa snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di yang don kyang byas pa'am de'i 'bras bu yin na de ji ltar spyi ma yin pa snyam na /
translated: Or, if it is produced by the object or is the effect of the object, then how is it not the object?

original: chu klung gi zhes smras so //
analyzed: chu klung gi zhes smras so //
translated: The reply is: like the river.

original: gang gi phyir chu klung gi 'gram na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi yul rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni brgyud pas kyang don bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chu klung gi 'gram na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gi yul rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni brgyud pas kyang don bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúbecause the object of a statement such as ‚Äòon the bank of the river‚Äô is a conceptual image‚Äù is that the object of a statement is not a referent even indirectly.

original: des na 'di ni spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'di ni spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this is not a universal.

original: 'di ni nged kyi 'dod pa nyid yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de spyi med mod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nged kyi 'dod pa nyid yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de spyi med mod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response ‚ÄúThis is precisely what we accept‚Äù is ‚ÄúThere is no universal.‚Äù

original: gal te sgra spyi'i yul can yin yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ba ci ste snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgra spyi'i yul can yin yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ba ci ste snyam na /
translated: If a word has a universal for its object, why is it not a valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la sgra tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la sgra tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
