translated: The phrase ‚Äúat that time‚Äù is taken from the commentary and applied to the passage ‚Äúa word would be a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: sgra spyi'i yul can yin na ni tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra spyi'i yul can yin na ni tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if a word has a universal for its object, it would not be a nonvalid cognition.

original: gal te sgra'i yul spyi ma yin ni 'o na ji ltar zhes @58b bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra'i yul spyi ma yin ni 'o na ji ltar zhes @58b bya ba'o //
translated: If the object of a word is not a universal, how is it that . . .

original: brjod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù is taken from the commentary.

original: sgra yi yul dang yul yin phyir //
analyzed: sgra yi yul dang yul yin phyir //
translated: Because the object of a word is an object,üîΩ. . .

original: zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: This is what he says.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can sgra 'ga' zhig gi yul ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can sgra 'ga' zhig gi yul ni spyi yin te /
translated: The object of some words, which have the nature of inferences for the sake of others, is a universal,

original: don gyi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of the object exists.

original: thams cad kyi ni ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: But not of all, because that does not exist.

original: spyi kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúOnly a universal.‚Äù

original: gal te sgra'i yul yang 'ga' zhig spyi ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i yul yang 'ga' zhig spyi ma yin na /
translated: If the object of a word is not a universal in some cases,

original: 'o na ji ltar yul nyid du bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar yul nyid du bstan ce na /
translated: then how is it taught to be the object?

original: sgra'i yul nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa nyid mtshon pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra'i yul nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa nyid mtshon pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The object of a word is taught to be a universal in order to indicate the mere type.

original: gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur ba spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur ba spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dogs pa'o //
translated: The doubt is that a universal is not the object because it would be contradictory.

original: yul min zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid la yang /
analyzed: yul min zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid la yang /
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is also applied to a particular, which is a specific instance of a universal.

original: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i don du don khyad par yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i don du don khyad par yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to avoid the absurd consequence, it is explained that the object is a particular.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù is used.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i yul ma yin pa 'ga' zhig rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ltar snyam na 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i yul ma yin pa 'ga' zhig rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ltar snyam na 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks that something that is not an object of words is a specific property, then this is also so.

original: tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa yang sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa yang sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: It is not an object of words, nor is it not an object of valid cognition.

original: spyi'am rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'am rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is neither a universal nor a specific property.

original: tshad ma'i yul gyi dbye bas de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul gyi dbye bas de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it is the occasion for teaching its divisions by the divisions of the object of valid cognition, it is said:

original: sgra'i yul ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is not an object of words.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin yang de'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ci ste ma yin dogs na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin yang de'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ci ste ma yin dogs na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one doubts that even if it is not a valid cognition, its object is a specific property, then it is said: in this way.

original: de tha dad pa ni tshad ma tha dad pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir tshad ma de yul nyid tha dad par ro //
analyzed: de tha dad pa ni tshad ma tha dad pa'o // de'i phyir tshad ma de yul nyid tha dad par ro //
translated: Its difference is the difference of valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, the object of valid cognition is different.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i yul tha dad par bstan par bya ba yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i yul tha dad par bstan par bya ba yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is to be taught as the difference of the object of valid cognition.

original: skra shad la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa yul nyid du ste /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa yul nyid du ste /
translated: The object of a non-valid cognition, such as the hair-net, is an object,

original: spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: in the sense of a universal and a particular.

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The former position is set forth in the second half of the verse, beginning with ‚Äúif.

original: de'i tshe khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tshe khong nas phyung la /
translated: ‚Äù Then, the word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: dngos po med pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is to be supplied in the phrase ‚Äúnon-entity is not the object of a valid cognition.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'on te dngos po med pa ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: If you think that a non-entity is not the object of a valid cognition,

original: de ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni zhes smos so //
translated: then the word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is supplied.

original: dngos po med pa spyi nyid du yang bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa spyi nyid du yang bsgrub pa ni /
translated: The proof that a non-entity is a universal is

original: spyi'i ngo bo yang yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo yang yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúit is also a universal.

original: shes bya nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: shes bya nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù The clarification that it is an object of knowledge is

original: dngos po med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúa non-entity is also an object of knowledge.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig gi zhes @59a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi zhes @59a * //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù

original: bya ba ni sa phyogs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni sa phyogs la sogs pas so //
translated: refers to the place, etc.

original: 'di ni rang gi 'dod pa tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi 'dod pa tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is merely our own opinion,

original: bshad pa gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is supplied in the phrase ‚Äúthe object of another cognition.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar yang ji ltar don nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang ji ltar don nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If it is so, how is it an object?

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also, he says.

original: bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na zhes gsungs so //
translated: He states another explanation: Or, it is an object.

original: gal te gang gis tshad mar gcad par bya ba nyid 'gyur ba de ji ltar don nyid yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis tshad mar gcad par bya ba nyid 'gyur ba de ji ltar don nyid yin snyam na /
translated: If it is that by which a valid cognition is determined, how is it an object?

original: dgos pa yod pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dgos pa yod pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, because it has a purpose.

original: de nyid ston pa ni dngos po med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni dngos po med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He teaches just that: Although it does not exist as a thing.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pas na'o //
translated: He says, therefore, because it has a purpose.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la'o //
translated: He says, in that case, in the case of the non-existent.

original: gal te don yin na ji ltar dngos po'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur snyam na rang gi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te don yin na ji ltar dngos po'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur snyam na rang gi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is an object, how is it not a conventional thing? He says, by its own nature.

original: skra shad la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would follow that such things as a hair-net are also so.

original: skra la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, a hair-net, etc.

original: don ma yin pa ste zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: don ma yin pa ste zhes 'brel te /
translated: It is not an object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'khrul pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'khrul pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? He says, because of error.

original: gal te sgra la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gal te sgra la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: If sound, etc. are also objects because they have a purpose.

original: ji ltar de la dgos pa yod snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la dgos pa yod snyam na /
translated: How can they have a purpose?

original: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of that.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa med pa ste /
translated: Such as this is an indefinite object.

original: des ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa yin no //
translated: This expresses the nature of the proof.

original: mi bden no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Not true, etc. indicates the two things to be proven.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa 'ga' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: There, also does not only refer to some non-entity.

original: skra shad la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: It also refers to hair tufts, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of having a purpose.

original: rtsod pa smra ba nyid kyis mi bden pa nyid du yongs su dam bcas pa'i phyir de dag kyang spyi'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rtsod pa smra ba nyid kyis mi bden pa nyid du yongs su dam bcas pa'i phyir de dag kyang spyi'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Because of the assertion of untruth by the proponent of the dispute, those also are only of a general nature, anticipating this doubt,

original: de lta yin na gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so, it would not appear clearly.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi bden par yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi bden par yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the exclusion of falsity.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù refers to the exclusion of the nature of generality.

original: gal te skra shad la sogs pa dang spyir shes pa'i yul yin na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar snang ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te skra shad la sogs pa dang spyir shes pa'i yul yin na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar snang ba ji ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the object of the cognition of generality is the hairs and so on, then like blue and so on, it would appear clearly.

original: gsal ba yang spyi ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba yang spyi ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But the clear appearance is not a generality.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the very clear appearance‚Äù is stated.

original: des na skra la sogs pa'i shes pa yul med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na skra la sogs pa'i shes pa yul med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of hairs and so on would not be without an object.

original: de dag gi yang zhes gsungs te @59b skra shad la sogs pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi yang zhes gsungs te @59b skra shad la sogs pa'i yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir‚Äù refers to the hairs and so on.

original: da lta'i dngos ni mi bden par yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: da lta'i dngos ni mi bden par yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The present thing is excluded as false.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin ni bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin ni bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of generality is not excluded.

original: 'dis ni tshad ma'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan gyis thal bar bsgrubs pas 'dod pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshad ma'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan gyis thal bar bsgrubs pas 'dod pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the reply: ‚ÄúIt follows that it would be the object of valid cognition,‚Äù which proves the consequence. Therefore, it is just as we maintain.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa gsal ba ni shes pa'i ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa gsal ba ni shes pa'i ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
translated: The dispute, ‚ÄúIt would not appear clearly,‚Äù is resolved by saying, ‚ÄúThe clarity is the nature of consciousness.‚Äù

original: da ni mi bden pa'i yul can spyi'i rtogs pa gang zhig yin snyam du dogs na //
analyzed: da ni mi bden pa'i yul can spyi'i rtogs pa gang zhig yin snyam du dogs na //
translated: Now, fearing that one might think, ‚ÄúWhat is the cognition of a universal that has an unreal object?‚Äù

original: skra sogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: skra sogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: [The root text] says, ‚ÄúHair, etc.‚Äù

original: skra sogs zhes bya ba'i rtags thogs su ma yin no zhes bya ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: skra sogs zhes bya ba'i rtags thogs su ma yin no zhes bya ba 'thob ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúhair, etc.‚Äù is not a reason.

original: de gang gi yang de lta'i dngos zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang gi yang de lta'i dngos zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the context is ‚Äúthat is not the entity of anything.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid pas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i rtsod pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid pas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i rtsod pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: This resolves the dispute that concludes with ‚Äúbecause of being a specific characteristic.‚Äù

original: 'o na don med gang yin snyam na skrar snang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na don med gang yin snyam na skrar snang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one wonders, ‚ÄúWell, what is the pointlessness?‚Äù [The root text] says, ‚ÄúThe appearance of hair.‚Äù

original: phyi'i don gyi don med pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi don med pa yin no //
translated: The pointlessness is the external object.

original: shes pa gang zhig skra shad kyi rang bzhin du snang ba de ni ;
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig skra shad kyi rang bzhin du snang ba de ni ;
translated: The consciousness that appears as the nature of floating hairs

original: phyi rol gyi yul can nyid du khas blangs ba med pas na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul can nyid du khas blangs ba med pas na /
translated: is not accepted as having an external object.

original: gnod byed kyi tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is the object of a valid cognition that refutes it.

original: skrar snang ba rang gi ngo bos 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skrar snang ba rang gi ngo bos 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is not that the appearance of floating hairs is refuted by its own nature.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is explained by ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: skra shad la sogs pa ni yod pa dang / med pa dag gis spyi'i rang bzhin du snang ba de ni /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa ni yod pa dang / med pa dag gis spyi'i rang bzhin du snang ba de ni /
translated: The appearance of floating hairs, etc. as the nature of both existent and nonexistent things

original: phyi rol nyid kyi sgo nas brjod pa ni mi bden pas zhes bya ba'i don gcig yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid kyi sgo nas brjod pa ni mi bden pas zhes bya ba'i don gcig yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not true in terms of being external. This is the meaning of ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan nam /üîΩskyes bu gzhan des dmigs par rung ba nyid med par yongs su bcad pas skra la sogs pa dngos po med par ni dgag pa la ltos nas gzhal bya nyid yin te /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan nam / skyes bu gzhan des dmigs par rung ba nyid med par yongs su bcad pas skra la sogs pa dngos po med par ni dgag pa la ltos nas gzhal bya nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means that the nonexistence of floating hairs, etc. is not apprehended by another consciousness

original: sa phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs bzhin no //
translated: or by another person. It is an object of comprehension in dependence on a negation that eliminates the possibility of their existence, like a place devoid of pots.

original: gang zhig yul nges pa med pa de ni mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yul nges pa med pa de ni mi bden pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is not ascertained as to place is not real.

original: dper na sngon mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the hair, etc. that were seen before.

original: skra shad la sogs pa 'di yang yul ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa 'di yang yul ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: And this hair, etc. is not ascertained as to place. This is the non-apprehension of nature.

original: yul ma nges par dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma nges par dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehension of the non-ascertainment of place is the nature of the non-apprehension of existence.

original: skra shad la sogs pa med pa spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad nas yod pa'i sgo nas kyang brjod pa ni yang gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa med pa spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad nas yod pa'i sgo nas kyang brjod pa ni yang gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the non-existence of hair, etc. as the nature of the universal, he also speaks of it as existent.

original: gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe skra gzhan dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa de'i tshe skra gzhan dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: When it is like this, then the hair is like another.

original: dper na sngon mthong ba'i skra ni tshogs rnam @60a * //
analyzed: dper na sngon mthong ba'i skra ni tshogs rnam @60a * //
translated: For example, the hair that was seen before is like another of that kind.

original: pa de lta bu gzhan dang 'dra bzhin no //üîΩ'di yang 'di lta bur gzhan dang 'dra bzhin no //
analyzed: pa de lta bu gzhan dang 'dra bzhin no //üîΩ'di yang 'di lta bur gzhan dang 'dra bzhin no //
translated: And this is like another of that kind.

original: 'di yang 'di lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is also like this. This is a natural inference.

original: gal te spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin na 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin na 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is the nature of a universal, then how is it?

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las 'debs pa'o //üîΩ'dir gzhan gyi de lta na ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba las 'debs pa'o // 'dir gzhan gyi de lta na ni zhes smras so //
translated: The nature of consciousness is planted in the root.üîΩHere, the opponent says, If it is like this, then it is not a universal.

original: de lta na yang spyi ma yin no snyam du bsams pas so //
analyzed: de lta na yang spyi ma yin no snyam du bsams pas so //
translated: Thinking that it is not a universal,

original: lan ni 'gyur pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'gyur pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is It is just a transformation.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi yul nyid yin na ji ltar spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi yul nyid yin na ji ltar spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: If it is the object of direct perception, how can it be the nature of a universal? This is the question.

original: lan ni rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ste mngon sum rjes las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ste mngon sum rjes las byung ba'o //
translated: The answer is Conceptual cognition, which is direct perception arising from the subsequent.

original: sngar gyi rjes su dpag pa la ltos nas spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi rjes su dpag pa la ltos nas spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yin la /
translated: In relation to the previous inference, it is called the nature of a universal.

original: de lta ni ngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la ltos nas yin no //
analyzed: de lta ni ngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la ltos nas yin no //
translated: In that way, it is in relation to the conceptual cognition that arises from direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul de nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul de nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object of that conceptualization is stated: ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa med pas yongs su bcad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pas yongs su bcad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod snyam na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that it is determined by the absence of conceptualization?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is stated: ‚Äúfrom the nature of the prior and subsequent.‚Äù

original: des ni snga ma dang phyi mas so //
analyzed: des ni snga ma dang phyi mas so //
translated: By that, it is from the prior and subsequent.

original: gal te skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i blo spyi'i yul can yin na /
analyzed: gal te skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i blo spyi'i yul can yin na /
translated: If the cognition called ‚Äúhair, etc.‚Äù has a universal for its object,

original: de yul med pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yul med pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is the object that does not exist?

original: brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is stated: ‚ÄúWell then, etc.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty is so called because it conforms to the presence or absence of the sense faculty.

original: don med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is stated: ‚Äúwithout an object.‚Äù

original: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no external object.

original: gal te mngon sum yin na ji ltar don med pa yin snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum yin na ji ltar don med pa yin snyam du dogs na /
translated: If it is direct perception, how can it be without an object?

original: bsams pa ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩrjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsams pa ni zhes gsungs so // rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thought is stated: ‚ÄúIf it is direct perception, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon sum las phyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las phyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: Inference is so called because it is a subsequent determination from direct perception.

original: rang rig pa dbang po la brten nas skye ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: rang rig pa dbang po la brten nas skye ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because self-awareness arises in dependence on the sense faculties,

original: de'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i rang rig pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i rang rig pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: one might suspect that there is no self-awareness other than that consciousness.

original: de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat itself.‚Äù

original: don la de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: don la de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú In reality‚Äù is the response.

original: de med par yang ni dngos po med par yang ngo //
analyzed: de med par yang ni dngos po med par yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Even without that‚Äù means even without the object.

original: gang gi phyir gsal bar snang ba dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal bar snang ba dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: The distinction between the manifest and the other is

original: phyi rol la ltos pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol la ltos pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: only in dependence on the external.

original: rang rig pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir mi gsal ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir mi gsal ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is that there is no self-awareness. Therefore, ‚Äúall that is not manifest‚Äù is stated.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The manifest itself does not follow the sense faculties and conform to their presence and absence,

original: de med kyang yod @60b ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de med kyang yod @60b ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because it exists even when they do not.

original: rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated by ‚ÄúEven in dreams.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because the manifest itself is not the sense consciousness,

original: 'on kyang mi 'khrul pas na don gyi yul nyid kyis yin pa des na dbang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi 'khrul pas na don gyi yul nyid kyis yin pa des na dbang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But because it is not mistaken, it is due to the object itself. Therefore, it is called a sense faculty.

original: de med na ni don la 'jug pa med na'o //
analyzed: de med na ni don la 'jug pa med na'o //
translated: If it did not exist, there would be no engagement with objects.

original: gang gi phyir skra thob pa med pa de'i phyir don la ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skra thob pa med pa de'i phyir don la ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: Because there is no apprehension of hair, therefore it is in dependence on the object,

original: rang gi rnam pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in dependence on its own aspect.

original: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal bar snang ba nyid yongs su spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal bar snang ba nyid yongs su spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is contradictory‚Äù because the universal is completely abandoned and the appearance as a particular remains.

original: spyi ni don nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi ni don nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that the universal is the object itself,üîΩbecause it is accepted that it has the nature of consciousness.

original: de yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ltar 'dod phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don nyid dang gsal bar snang ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir der thal ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ltar 'dod phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don nyid dang gsal bar snang ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir der thal ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause we accept that,‚Äù meaning that because we accept that the object itself has the nature of consciousness and appears as a particular, the consequence is not a fault.

original: 'o na de ltar de spyi yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar de spyi yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, in that case, is it a universal?

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: It is due to the nature of the object itself.

original: nges par brtag par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nges par brtag par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: because it is definitely to be examined as a universal.

original: spyi ni rnam par rtog pa snang ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni rnam par rtog pa snang ba'o //
translated: A universal is the appearance of a conceptual cognition.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa phyi rol du nges par brtag par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i spyi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa phyi rol du nges par brtag par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir de'i spyi yin no //
translated: Because it is definitely to be examined as external, it is a universal.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i yul ni gsal ba yin pas de ltar ni spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i yul ni gsal ba yin pas de ltar ni spyi ma yin no //
translated: The object of reflexive awareness, which is the nature of cognition, is a clear manifestation. It is not a universal in that way.

original: spyi ni don rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo yin pas na don la brten pa nyid du rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: spyi ni don rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo yin pas na don la brten pa nyid du rtog pa yin la /
translated: A universal is the common nature of objects, so it is conceived to be based on objects.

original: de ltar ni gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that, a clear manifestation.

original: 'dis ni shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid phyi'i don gyi dngos por ci ste mi 'dod ces bya ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid phyi'i don gyi dngos por ci ste mi 'dod ces bya ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: This clarifies the question, ‚ÄúWhy not accept the nature of cognition as the entity of an external object?‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin la ni gsal ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin la ni gsal ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of cognition does not have a clear manifestation,

original: des na ci ste de ltar 'dod ces dogs na /
analyzed: des na ci ste de ltar 'dod ces dogs na /
translated: why do you assert it in that way?

original: shes pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: To respond to that, it is said, ‚ÄúCognition is by nature . . .‚Äù

original: 'on te de'i gsal bar snang ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te de'i gsal bar snang ba ni /
translated: If the clear manifestation of that is . . .

original: gzhan 'dra ba yin pas de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan 'dra ba yin pas de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is similar to the other, it does not exist.

original: de ltar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow could that be?‚Äù

original: de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe appearance of the object is the appearance of the aspect of consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin mi gsal ba nyid du mi 'thad na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin mi gsal ba nyid du mi 'thad na /
translated: If it is untenable that the nature of consciousness is unclear,

original: 'o na mi gsal bar snang ba ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi gsal bar snang ba ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the unclear appearance?

original: don ni zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe object.‚Äù

original: spyi'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa la'o //
translated: It is in the case of a general cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn dependence on another,‚Äù that is, in the case of a sense consciousness.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa la ni de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni shes pa'i rnam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa la ni de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni shes pa'i rnam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe aspect of consciousness does not do that,‚Äù that is, the aspect of consciousness does not do that.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because there is no other.

original: 'on te spyi'i shes pa la don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i shes pa la don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang snang ba yin te /
translated: But if the aspect of all objects appears in a general cognition,

original: des na ji ltar @61a * //
analyzed: des na ji ltar @61a * //
translated: then how is it that

original: dmigs pa snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: dmigs pa snyam du dogs na /
translated: it is said that the object is the object of observation?

original: don gyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba blo rang bzhin ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba blo rang bzhin ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the object is the nature of the cognition, as it appears in the sense perception.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Other‚Äù means

original: spyi'i shes pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: from the nature that appears in the cognition of the universal.

original: de mi snang bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de mi snang bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Not appearing‚Äù means

original: rang bzhin mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi snang ba'o //
translated: that the nature does not appear.

original: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the nature of the cognition is the particular,

original: 'o na ji ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin de'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin de'o //
translated: then how is it the nature of the cognition?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúby its very nature.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid rang gi tshig gis 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rang gi tshig gis 'chad pa ni /
translated: This is explained by its own words:

original: dpyad pas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyad pas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú because of analysis.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis ni gnyi ga yang 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni gnyi ga yang 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúby that very fact both are established,‚Äù

original: don du nges par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don du nges par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: meaning ‚Äúin reality.‚Äù

original: gal te de la don snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de la don snang ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that because the object appears there,

original: ji ltar gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be the nature of both?

original: de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúthat also.‚Äù

original: spyi'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa la'o //
translated: It is in the cognition of the universal.

original: gal te don du nges par brtags pa yin yang 'di ci'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te don du nges par brtags pa yin yang 'di ci'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even if one examines the meaning, one might still wonder, What is its form? Anticipating this doubt, [DignƒÅga] says, Thus.

original: rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa thams cad la me me zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la sgro btags pa de dag gis mtshungs pa nyid du /
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa thams cad la me me zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la sgro btags pa de dag gis mtshungs pa nyid du /
translated: In all cases, such as fire and grass and leaves, the form of the conceptual thought that superimposes is the same.

original: lhag par zhen pa de'i spyi'i rnam pa nyid yin no //üîΩsgrub pa'i rang bzhin spyi'i rnam pa brjod nas /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa de'i spyi'i rnam pa nyid yin no // sgrub pa'i rang bzhin spyi'i rnam pa brjod nas /
translated: That is the form of the universal.üîΩHaving described the universal that is the nature of affirmation,

original: ldog pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: to explain the universal that is the nature of exclusion, [DignƒÅga] says,

original: don de dag gi rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa gang yin pa de la brten pa'o //
analyzed: don de dag gi rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa gang yin pa de la brten pa'o //
translated: it is based on the exclusion of those objects from what is dissimilar.

original: shes pa'i brten pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pa'i brten pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The basis of cognition is twofold:

original: de las skyes pa dang de la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa dang de la 'jug pa'o //
translated: that from which it arises and that upon which it operates.

original: des na ldog pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis spyi'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis spyi'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is related to exclusion and because it has the nature of exclusion, it is the form of the universal.

original: rno ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rno ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSharp‚Äù means related.

original: tsandan la sogs pa seng ge'i la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la mig shes pa ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tsandan la sogs pa seng ge'i la sogs pa gang la yod pa de la mig shes pa ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: That which has sandalwood, etc., and lion, etc., is the same nature as the eye consciousness.

original: ji ltar ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag snyam na /
translated: How is it established as the same nature?

original: snang ba dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: snang ba dang zhes smos so //
translated: It is said ‚Äúappearance.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad la thun mong gi rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad la thun mong gi rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that all of that is the common nature of consciousness.

original: de ma bzung na ji ltar de thams cad kyi yul can du ji ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: de ma bzung na ji ltar de thams cad kyi yul can du ji ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: If that is not grasped, how can it be said to be the object of all?

original: gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said ‚Äúbecause of the adherence to oneness.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ji ltar snyam na snang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ji ltar snyam na snang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this? It is said ‚Äúappearance.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa'i rang la don du lhag par zhen kyang spyi ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rang la don du lhag par zhen kyang spyi ji ltar yin te /
translated: Even if there is adherence to the object as the nature of consciousness, how is it a universal?

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because it does not have the characteristics of a universal accepted by others.

original: des brjod @61b pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des brjod @61b pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The general characteristic that is expressed by that exists only in this, thus it is said ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: 'di las ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'di las ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one wonders what is accomplished by that,

original: de 'ang shes pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de 'ang shes pa'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said ‚Äúthat is also the aspect of consciousness.‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo spyi de'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo spyi de'o //
translated: That is the universal nature of the similar ones.

original: ji ltar de gsal ba rnams kyi yin snyam na /üîΩgsal ba'i ngo bor zhes smos te ;
analyzed: ji ltar de gsal ba rnams kyi yin snyam na / gsal ba'i ngo bor zhes smos te ;
translated: If one wonders how that is of the manifest ones,üîΩit is said ‚Äúin the nature of the manifest.‚Äù

original: spyi'i rnam pa can du gyur pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par can ni spyi'i ngo bo yin te zhes 'brel to //üîΩgal te rnam pa'i khyad par shes pa ni bdag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can du gyur pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par can ni spyi'i ngo bo yin te zhes 'brel to // gal te rnam pa'i khyad par shes pa ni bdag nyid yin pas na /
translated: The special aspect of consciousness that has become the universal aspect is the universal nature.

original: 'di spyi'i rnam pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di spyi'i rnam pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If one wonders how that is the universal aspect,

original: khra bo la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: it is said ‚Äúof the variegated and so on.‚Äù

original: de de la gnas pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de de la gnas pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If one wonders how that abides in that,

original: kun rdzob tu lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa des so //
translated: it is said ‚Äúby the adherence to the superficial.‚Äù

original: gal te der lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ci yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te der lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ci yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that the reason for the special attachment to that is what?

original: de la zhes smos te don la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes smos te don la'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúto that,‚Äù i.e., to the object.

original: de las ni don las so //
analyzed: de las ni don las so //
translated: From that, i.e., from the object.

original: dngos su skyes nas rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro snyam na bag chags kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos su skyes nas rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro snyam na bag chags kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that it arises directly and then becomes a conceptualization, it is said, ‚Äúdue to the latent impressions.‚Äù

original: de ltar snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas sgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid spyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas sgrub pa'i rang bzhin nyid spyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having made the appearance and the conceptualization the same, the nature of the establishment is stated in general.

original: ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the exclusion is taught by ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i rnam pa de ni'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa de ni'o //
translated: That is the aspect of consciousness.

original: gal te don gyi rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir na ji ltar de dang de dag gi ldog pa la brten nas skye snyam na /
analyzed: gal te don gyi rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir na ji ltar de dang de dag gi ldog pa la brten nas skye snyam na /
translated: If you think that since it does not touch the nature of the object, how does it arise in dependence on the exclusions of those?

original: de ni brgyud pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni brgyud pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthat is indirectly.‚Äù

original: de la skye ba'i mtshan nyid brten par bshad nas /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i mtshan nyid brten par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristic of arising in that,

original: de la 'jug pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa bshad pa ni /
translated: the engagement in that is explained.

original: ldog pa'i don rnams la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i don rnams la zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin regard to the objects of exclusion.‚Äù

original: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni lhag par zhen pa las spyi'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni lhag par zhen pa las spyi'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Because it causes engagement. This is connected to ‚Äúthat is the nature of the universal due to the adherence to the particular.‚Äù

original: gal te phyogs 'di la ji ltar ldog pa ci yin snyam na ldog pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gal te phyogs 'di la ji ltar ldog pa ci yin snyam na ldog pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so ;
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the reverse of this position?‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúThe reverse itself.‚Äù

original: / gal te de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyir ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyir ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúEven if that is so, how could the aspect of the conceptualization be the nature of the reverse?‚Äù

original: ldog pa dang 'brel pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ldog pa dang 'brel pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the connection with the reverse.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis kyis so //
translated: It is due to the two natures.

original: ldog pas bskyed pa'i rnam pa ni ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pas bskyed pa'i rnam pa ni ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: The aspect produced by the reverse is ascertained as the reverse itself.

original: des na ldog pa'i bdag nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na ldog pa'i bdag nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúhaving the nature of the reverse.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa nyid rang bzhin de gsal ba las skye ba dang / gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par zhen pa yin na khyad par mtshon pa med pa'i gsal ba nyid spyir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te shes pa nyid rang bzhin de gsal ba las skye ba dang / gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par zhen pa yin na khyad par mtshon pa med pa'i gsal ba nyid spyir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If consciousness itself were the nature of the particular, and if there were adherence to the particular as having the nature of the particular, then the particular itself would be the universal, because it would not be characterized by a difference.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The nature of consciousness is not other than that.

original: ji ltar rnam pa spyi yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa spyi yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How is the aspect a universal?

original: ji ltar khas blang bar bya @62a * //üîΩsnyam na / mtshon zin pa shes pa'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar khas blang bar bya @62a * // snyam na / mtshon zin pa shes pa'i rnam pa'am /
translated: How should it be accepted?üîΩThe aspect of consciousness is what is indicated by the illustration,

original: spyis mtshon pa nyid des so //
analyzed: spyis mtshon pa nyid des so //
translated: or it is indicated by the universal itself.

original: rnam pa tsam gyis mthar thug pas ni khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam pa tsam gyis mthar thug pas ni khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is not to be accepted as the ultimate by the mere aspect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin par zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin par zhes smras so //
translated: It is not the engaging cause.

original: 'o na ci tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin na ;
analyzed: 'o na ci tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin na ;
translated: How is it the ultimate?

original: nyes pa la brten pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: nyes pa la brten pa yin no snyam na /
translated: It is based on error.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig ces smras so //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig ces smras so //
translated: It is only a universal.

original: rnam pa bzhin du lce yang don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhin du lce yang don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because like the aspect, the tongue is also devoid of causal efficiency.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don spyi gang la yod pa der smra ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don spyi gang la yod pa der smra ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Since it is not the ultimate in that way, the object that has the nature of consciousness and the universal that exists in it are the objects of the logicians.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin du smra ba ni sangs rgyas pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin du smra ba ni sangs rgyas pa yin la /
translated: The Buddhists maintain that it is the nature of consciousness.

original: don gyi rang bzhin du smra ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin du smra ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and so on maintain that it is the nature of the object.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi shes pa'i rnam pa de las kyang ngo //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi shes pa'i rnam pa de las kyang ngo //
translated: Not only is it a universal, but it is also the aspect of consciousness.

original: 'on te phyis gsal ba rjes su dpog pa de na de yul ma yin na snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyis gsal ba rjes su dpog pa de na de yul ma yin na snyam na /
translated: But if it is inferred later, then it is not the object.

original: de la phyis kyang zhes smras te /
analyzed: de la phyis kyang zhes smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúEven later.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it the aspect of consciousness,

original: rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i spyis kyang ngo //üîΩde gang la snyam na de la yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i spyis kyang ngo // de gang la snyam na de la yang zhes smos te /
translated: but it is also the universal that is asserted by the NaiyƒÅyikas and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is that?,‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúEven in inference.‚Äù

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi /
translated: This is merely stated as an assertion.

original: 'di ni yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThis does not exist.‚Äù

original: spyi brgyud pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: spyi brgyud pa zhes smras so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe universal is transmitted.‚Äù

original: ci ste brgyud pa ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste brgyud pa ma yin snyam na /
translated: But if it is thought that it is not transmitted,

original: thug pa med pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni spyi las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni spyi las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the fault of infinite regress is stated. It is said, ‚ÄúFrom the universal.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir spyi dang shes pa'i rnam pa dag las gsal ba rjes su dpog pa ni 'thad pa de'i phyir mthar yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi dang shes pa'i rnam pa dag las gsal ba rjes su dpog pa ni 'thad pa de'i phyir mthar yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is tenable to infer the manifest from the universal and the aspect of consciousness, therefore, in the end, the manifest is not the object of inference.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i yul can nyid du sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blangs pa nyid ma yin nam des na ji ltar de yang ma yin no zhes spong snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i yul can nyid du sangs rgyas pas kyang khas blangs pa nyid ma yin nam des na ji ltar de yang ma yin no zhes spong snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince the opponent accepts that inference has the manifest as its object, why does he reject it by saying that it is not so?,‚Äù

original: bden te 'on kyang kun rdzob tu de'i yul can nyid brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis spong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang kun rdzob tu de'i yul can nyid brjod pa gang yin pa de ni 'dis spong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: it is true that he does not reject that it has the manifest as its object conventionally.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i 'jug pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pas te spong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i 'jug pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pas te spong ba yin te /
translated: However, he does reject it because he accepts that the engagement of entities is otherwise.

original: 'di gang las snyam na /
analyzed: 'di gang las snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhat is that?,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin dngos min de byed par bzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i rang bzhin dngos min de byed par bzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: it is as follows: The nature of consciousness is not an entity, and it is not the nature of that which is apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod bya nyid phyir te don dang dbang po la sogs pa med kyang /
analyzed: brjod bya nyid phyir te don dang dbang po la sogs pa med kyang /
translated: Because it is the object of expression. Even though the object, sense faculty, and so on do not exist,

original: sgra las byung ba la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the manifest appears from sound.

original: dbang po la sogs pa med kyang sgra las byung ba ni dngos po nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa med kyang sgra las byung ba ni dngos po nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that sound is a thing that arises from sound,

original: de'i tshe dbang po'i @62b tshogs 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po'i @62b tshogs 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the collection of sense faculties would not have a result.

original: de bzhin du sgra thos pa na ngo bo nyid kyi don go bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra thos pa na ngo bo nyid kyi don go bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: And in the same way, when sound is heard, the meaning of the essence would be understood,

original: brdar byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdar byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the conventional.

original: des na rtogs pa ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no understanding at all.

original: gal te nyes pa 'di bdag cag la ni med de dngos po'i rang bzhin mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te nyes pa 'di bdag cag la ni med de dngos po'i rang bzhin mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But we do not have this fault, because we do not state the essence of things.

original: sgra ni sgra'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i ming la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i ming la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Sound is applied to the name, which is called the reflection of sound.üîΩAnd the name causes the understanding of the meaning through the sign.

original: ming ni mtshan ma la des ni don go bar byed pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ming sogs zhes smos so //
analyzed: ming ni mtshan ma la des ni don go bar byed pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ming sogs zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúname, etc.‚Äù is stated to anticipate the doubt.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the expression of the sign that is the reflection of the meaning.

original: 'di ni zad par sgom pa la sogs par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par sgom pa la sogs par gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is clarified in the meditation on the totality, and so on.

original: gal te don brjod bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te don brjod bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If the object is not the expressed,

original: 'on kyang ming dang mtshan ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ming dang mtshan ma yin na /
translated: but rather the name and the sign,

original: de'i tshe don la mi 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe don la mi 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not the case that one does not engage the object.

original: bum pa brjod pa na snam bu la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa brjod pa na snam bu la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When a pot is expressed, a cloth is not engaged.

original: 'on te de dang 'brel pa can brjod na der mi 'jug pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dang 'brel pa can brjod na der mi 'jug pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if that which is related is expressed, how is it that one does not engage that?

original: 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa brjod na nyes pa so na 'dug go zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa brjod na nyes pa so na 'dug go zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that the fault remains whether one expresses that which is related or that which is not related,

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po //
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po //
translated: the speaker and the listener

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are not related.

original: 'brel pa med pa can zhes bya ba ni gsum ka dang ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa can zhes bya ba ni gsum ka dang ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: That which is unrelated is that which is not related to any of the three.

original: brjod bya yin par rtogs kyang don de ma rtogs na mi 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod bya yin par rtogs kyang don de ma rtogs na mi 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though one understands that it is the expressed, if one does not understand the object, one will not engage it. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not universals,

original: dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin no //
translated: because they are not things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi'i shes pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: Because the understanding of a universal is the understanding of a cognition.

original: brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the expressed.

original: brjod bya yin yang dngos po ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brjod bya yin yang dngos po ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be a topic but not a thing?

original: gzugs la sogs pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúby form, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is for eliminating a second conception.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i gsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúManifest‚Äù is the manifestation of form, etc.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba dang / bzlog pa brjod pa ni de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba dang / bzlog pa brjod pa ni de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the pleasure arising from the sense faculties. The opposite is stated: ‚ÄúIt is not like that.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'o //
translated: It is without result.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is because it has a result.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas so /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas so /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is because the nature of manifestation is not understood.

original: // 'dis ni phyogs dang po yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: // 'dis ni phyogs dang po yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the first position.

original: ming sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain ‚Äúname, etc.,‚Äù the former position is set forth: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: mi ldan pa ni ming dang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni ming dang mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-possession‚Äù has the characteristic of name and sign.

original: 'brel med ces bya ba ni gsum ka dang ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel med ces bya ba ni gsum ka dang ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout a connection‚Äù means that there is no connection among the three.

original: de la ming la sogs pa ma 'brel pa dang @63a * //
analyzed: de la ming la sogs pa ma 'brel pa dang @63a * //
translated: In the case of a name, etc., that is not connected with the object,

original: don dang 'brel pa la ni 'brel pa med na yang 'jug pa mi 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin par brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa la ni 'brel pa med na yang 'jug pa mi 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin par brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if there were no connection, one could not object that the engagement would not occur.

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po 'brel pa la brjod pa ni 'chad ba po la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po 'brel pa la brjod pa ni 'chad ba po la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúwith the speaker and the hearer‚Äù refers to the speaker, etc.

original: 'on te ma rtogs pa la yang 'jug pa skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs pa la yang 'jug pa skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that there is no fault in the engagement of one who does not understand,

original: ma rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang la 'jug pa de rtogs pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ni ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o // gang la 'jug pa de rtogs pa don med par thal ba'i phyir ni ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa 'di ni /
translated: the expression ‚Äúeven if one does not understand‚Äù is used.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that one who does not understand should engage in the object, because it would follow, absurdly, that the understanding of the object would be pointless.

original: tsi tra aang+ga dang / sna tshogs brtson 'grus gnyis las gcig brjod pas gzhan la 'jug pa der ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: tsi tra aang+ga dang / sna tshogs brtson 'grus gnyis las gcig brjod pas gzhan la 'jug pa der ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the two, CitrƒÅ·πÖga and Vi≈õƒÅkha, one is engaged in the other by the expression of one of them.

original: 'khrul pas 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pas 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the engagement is due to error.

original: mtshan ma dang don dag las de ltar rtogs pa 'dir ni ma 'khrul pa yin no /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang don dag las de ltar rtogs pa 'dir ni ma 'khrul pa yin no /
translated: But the realization of objects and signs in this way is non-erroneous.

original: gang la ma rtogs pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la ma rtogs pa'i don la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: What is the meaning of non-realization?

original: 'khrul na ci skyon snyam na 'khrul na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul na ci skyon snyam na 'khrul na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the problem if there is error?,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúIf there is error. . .

original: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na'o ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na'o ;
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúIf that is the case‚Äù means if there is no objective referent.

original: / dmigs pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon spangs pa'i don du ming dang mtshan ma gzhan dang gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni de la yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: / dmigs pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon spangs pa'i don du ming dang mtshan ma gzhan dang gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni de la yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to avoid the problem of no objective referent, he says, ‚ÄúIf one realizes other names and signs, there is an infinite regress.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa med pa'i nyes pa bkal ba gang yin pa la'o //üîΩthug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de la yang rang gi do bos bzung ba med pa'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma gzhan brtag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i nyes pa bkal ba gang yin pa la'o // thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de la yang rang gi do bos bzung ba med pa'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma gzhan brtag par bya ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in the case of the problem of no objective referent.üîΩ‚ÄúThere is an infinite regress‚Äù means that in that case, because there is no objective referent, one would have to realize other names and signs.

original: de bzhin du yang gzhan dang gzhan ni brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gzhan dang gzhan ni brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in that case, because there is no objective referent, one would have to realize other names and signs.

original: des na ming dang mtshan mar snang ba'i rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa ma yin pa des na ji ltar des don la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ming dang mtshan mar snang ba'i rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa ma yin pa des na ji ltar des don la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of the appearance of names and signs is not error. Thus, how could it engage objects?

original: dpe yang bsgrub bya'i phyogs su bslan pa na de'i stobs kyis kyang 'di 'grub pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub bya'i phyogs su bslan pa na de'i stobs kyis kyang 'di 'grub pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is also not established by the power of that, even when it is applied to the position of the probandum. This is what is said by ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: yul du 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dag la gcig brjod pa 'khrul pas gzhan rtogs pa la ni ming la sogs pa nyid snang ba yin gyi don snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul du 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma dag la gcig brjod pa 'khrul pas gzhan rtogs pa la ni ming la sogs pa nyid snang ba yin gyi don snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: In regard to signs that become objects, the expression of one thing through error in regard to another is the appearance of names, etc. themselves, but it is not the appearance of objects.

original: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the collection of sense faculties would be fruitless.

original: ma grub pa nyid brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dpe la'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste dpe la'o //
translated: The nonestablishment of that is stated by ‚Äúthat‚Äù in regard to the example.

original: de rtogs pa nyid kyis ni ming la sogs ba rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de rtogs pa nyid kyis ni ming la sogs ba rtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the mere understanding of that, by the mere understanding of names, etc.

original: de ltar na re zhig don la mi 'jug pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig don la mi 'jug pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that it does not engage objects.

original: khas blangs nas kyang sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that, the refutation is stated by ‚Äúif you think that.‚Äù

original: gal te don la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te don la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were in regard to the object,

original: skra @63b las mi rtogs pa ni don gyi gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir don du 'khrul par 'gyur zhing de las ni don la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: skra @63b las mi rtogs pa ni don gyi gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir don du 'khrul par 'gyur zhing de las ni don la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: one would not understand the hair, because the image of the object would be mistaken for the object, and from that one would engage with the object.

original: de bzhin zad par bsgoms pa la sogs par mtshan ma rtogs pa na sa'o zhes lhag par zhen pa las 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin zad par bsgoms pa la sogs par mtshan ma rtogs pa na sa'o zhes lhag par zhen pa las 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, when one understands the sign in the cultivation of the elimination of the sign, one engages through the superimposition of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: dus kun du 'khrug pa las 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus kun du 'khrug pa las 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not engage through disturbance at all times.

original: gang ming la 'jug par mthong bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ming la 'jug par mthong bas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not engage through seeing the engagement in the name.

original: mthong na ni long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur bas skra'i tha snyad nyams par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags las de lhag par zhen pa nyid de /
analyzed: mthong na ni long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur bas skra'i tha snyad nyams par 'gyur ro // 'on te thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags las de lhag par zhen pa nyid de /
translated: If one saw, the convention of hair would be lost, because one would be blind and mute.üîΩIf one accepts the other‚Äôs system, that superimposition is just the latent tendency of beginningless ignorance.

original: shes pa yin no zhes gzhan gyi lugs khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yin no zhes gzhan gyi lugs khas len no zhe na /
translated: It is consciousness.

original: yul la 'khrul 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul la 'khrul 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is error in regard to the object.‚Äù

original: yul smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir rang bzhin la 'khrul pa yang bzung ngo //
analyzed: yul smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir rang bzhin la 'khrul pa yang bzung ngo //
translated: The mention of the object is for the sake of illustration; error with respect to the intrinsic nature is also included.

original: 'khrul par mi 'dod kyang 'khrul par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul par mi 'dod kyang 'khrul par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though it is not asserted that there is error, it follows that there is error.

original: yul 'khrul pa yang yod pa yin la /
analyzed: yul 'khrul pa yang yod pa yin la /
translated: The object of error exists,

original: de yang khyed kyi ltar na ming la sogs pa yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir na mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang khyed kyi ltar na ming la sogs pa yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir na mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: and it is not, as you maintain, that the name, etc. do not exist in the object.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bshad do //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by way of exclusion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni min zhes bya ba dgag pa'i sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni min zhes bya ba dgag pa'i sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not explained by way of implication, because it is not connected with the negative particle.

original: bshad pa snga ma ltar yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma ltar yin no //
translated: It is as explained above.üîΩIf it is a mode of consciousness, then it is just an error that arises from the cause of a latent impression.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa yin na ni de bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni shes pa la zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa yin na ni de bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba'i 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni shes pa la zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: This is what is said in the phrase ‚Äúwith respect to consciousness.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Why is that?

original: rnam pa de 'dra'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dra'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a cognition with that mode arises.

original: rang gi rnam pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i blo nyid bag chags las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i blo nyid bag chags las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind itself, which is attached to its own aspect as an external object, arises from habitual tendencies.

original: ming gi blo nyid ni de ltar 'dzin pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: ming gi blo nyid ni de ltar 'dzin pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the mind that apprehends the name engages in that way.

original: khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to the statement ‚Äúbecause it is not accepted‚Äù is ‚Äúin relation to others.‚Äù

original: ming dang mtshan nyid lta ba la'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan nyid lta ba la'o //
translated: The view of names and characteristics.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba la brjod pa gang yin pa de med do //
