analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba la brjod pa gang yin pa de med do //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is that the statement by the proponents of consciousness with aspects is not correct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind that appears as an external object is not accepted.

original: shes pa phyi rol gyi rnam pa can du khas len na yang /
analyzed: shes pa phyi rol gyi rnam pa can du khas len na yang /
translated: Even if consciousness is accepted as having external aspects,

original: rnam par shes pa dang phyi rol gyi don las tha dad pa'i ming ni tshad can min te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang phyi rol gyi don las tha dad pa'i ming ni tshad can min te /
translated: the name that is different from consciousness and an external object is not limited.

original: tshang ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshang ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: de skyed pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir ldog pa'i rjes su dpag pa grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir ldog pa'i rjes su dpag pa grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the special cause of that is not established, because the inference of the reversal is not established.

original: 'di ni 'dra bar khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi /üîΩgang gis de rtogs pas @64a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dra bar khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi / gang gis de rtogs pas @64a * //
translated: This is stated by way of accepting the similarity.

original: de la 'jug par 'gyur ba ming ni don dang tshul 'dra ba yang med do //
analyzed: de la 'jug par 'gyur ba ming ni don dang tshul 'dra ba yang med do //
translated: But there is no name that is similar to the object by which one would understand that object andüîΩenter into it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said to be embodied and disembodied.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa ni dbyibs can dang dbyibs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa ni dbyibs can dang dbyibs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Embodied and disembodied are shaped and unshaped.

original: de yod na ni 'dra ba yod na'o //
analyzed: de yod na ni 'dra ba yod na'o //
translated: If that exists, then similarity exists.

original: yul 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rnam par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yul 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rnam par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This very place is a statement of error.

original: 'on te ming dang mtshan ma don gyi yul dang tshul 'dra ba'i phyir na 'khrul pa yin no snyam na de dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te ming dang mtshan ma don gyi yul dang tshul 'dra ba'i phyir na 'khrul pa yin no snyam na de dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that it is error because the name and the sign are similar to the object, then there is that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dang mtshungs pa dang 'jug pa'i yul gyi don gyi yul dag ni tshul 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dang mtshungs pa dang 'jug pa'i yul gyi don gyi yul dag ni tshul 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the name, the sign, and the object of engagement, which are not similar.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa dag 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa dag 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that embodied and disembodied things are not similar.

original: tshul 'dra ba med kyang 'khrul ba las de rtogs par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'dra ba med kyang 'khrul ba las de rtogs par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though they are not similar, there is the doubt that it is understood from error. To anticipate this, it says ‚Äúbut if.

original: don 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi yul de yang ngo //
analyzed: don 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi yul de yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äù Not only the object, but also the domain.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is the response.

original: gal te yul ma rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa las de dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul ma rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa las de dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If, even without understanding the object, one engages in form, etc. that are related to it, without understanding them?üîΩIt says, ‚Äúwithout an object.

original: yul med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is not an object.üîΩ

original: ji ltar yul med pa'i sems dang sems las 'byung ba rtogs pa las de dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa mi 'jug pa de bzhin du yul med pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pas kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yul med pa'i sems dang sems las 'byung ba rtogs pa las de dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa mi 'jug pa de bzhin du yul med pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pas kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as, when one realizes that mind and mental factors do not exist as objects, one does not engage in form, etc. which are connected with them, so it is with name and sign.

original: gzhan ming dang mtshan ma la gzhan zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i yul don gyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ming dang mtshan ma la gzhan zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i yul don gyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: Another says: In the object which is the nature of meaning, one engages in the other, i.e. in name and sign.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi rtogs snyam na bum pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi rtogs snyam na bum pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it not realized in that way? A pot is the example.

original: don de'i'o // don ni ming dang mtshan ma la'o //
analyzed: don de'i'o // don ni ming dang mtshan ma la'o //
translated: It is of that meaning, i.e. of the meaning of name and sign.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba lan no //
translated: Now, how? is the question.

original: gang lhag par zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan de ming dang mtshan ma gang ngo //
analyzed: gang lhag par zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan de ming dang mtshan ma gang ngo //
translated: That which is in excess is another refutation. It is that name and sign.

original: gal te gzhan la lhag par zhen pa las kyang 'jug pa mthong ba yin no snyam par dogs par bsu ba ni /üîΩnya phyis la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la lhag par zhen pa las kyang 'jug pa mthong ba yin no snyam par dogs par bsu ba ni / nya phyis la zhes bya'o //
translated: If one thinks that engagement is seen even from attachment to the other, the question is: How is it that one does not engage in the other, i.e. in the object which is the nature of meaning?üîΩThe answer is: In a mother-of-pearl.

original: nya phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: nya phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The question is: Even in mother-of-pearl.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gang du dngul du lhag par zhen pa na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gang du dngul du lhag par zhen pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means when there is excessive attachment to silver.

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i zhen pa las yang de ltar 'jug pa yin no snyam na ming dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i zhen pa las yang de ltar 'jug pa yin no snyam na ming dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks that it engages in that way from attachment to names and signs, he says ‚Äúnames and signs.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul yongs su 'dzin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul yongs su 'dzin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúwhen the object is apprehended.

original: yul ni mi gnas par yang khas blangs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni mi gnas par yang khas blangs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The idea is that it is accepted that the object does not abide.

original: yul na mi gnas pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the doubt that the object does not abide, he says, ‚ÄúThat is not so.

original: don gang la yang de ltar 'jug @64b pa yin no snyam na ming dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gang la yang de ltar 'jug @64b pa yin no snyam na ming dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äù If one thinks that it engages in that way with any object, he says ‚Äúnames and signs.

original: yul ni mi gnas par yang khas blangs pa yin /
analyzed: yul ni mi gnas par yang khas blangs pa yin /
translated: ‚Äù The idea is that it is accepted that the object does not abide,

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but not names and signs.

original: des na yul na mi gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na yul na mi gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the object does not abide.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable,

original: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no differentiation.

original: 'di ltar don ni ming dang mtshan ma nyid du dogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar don ni ming dang mtshan ma nyid du dogs kyi /
translated: Thus, one doubts that the object is just names and signs,

original: don las tha dad par rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: don las tha dad par rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: but one does not understand it as different from the object.

original: des na don gyi yul nyid ming dang mtshan ma'i yul yin pas yul la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don gyi yul nyid ming dang mtshan ma'i yul yin pas yul la mi gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the object itself is the object of name and sign, it is not the case that it does not abide in the object.

original: yul la mi gnas pa des gnas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni nya phyis kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la mi gnas pa des gnas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni nya phyis kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to anticipate the doubt that it does abide in the object, he says, ‚Äúlike a mother-of-pearl.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du ni dngul bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dngul bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like‚Äù means ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang ni ming dang mtshan ma la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ni ming dang mtshan ma la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means ‚Äúin regard to name and sign.‚ÄùüîΩAnticipating the doubt that it is not an object, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚ÄùüîΩHere, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.üîΩIn the same way, the object of name and sign is not an object.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚ÄùüîΩHere, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚ÄùüîΩHere, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.

original: yul med ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas sngar ni lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul skra shad bzhin yul der mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i phyir yul dang bcas par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: yul med ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas sngar ni lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul skra shad bzhin yul der mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i phyir yul dang bcas par brjod pa yin la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚Äù

original: da ni btang snyoms su gzhag nas de med pa'i phyir na //üîΩyul med kyang ming dang mtshan ma'i de lta ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni btang snyoms su gzhag nas de med pa'i phyir na // yul med kyang ming dang mtshan ma'i de lta ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚ÄùüîΩHere, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the object of name and sign.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, just as the strand of hair is not an object, so too is the object of name and sign.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äújust as a strand of hair is seen in the mind of one with an eye disease, so too is the

original: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul ni phyi rol na med pa'i phyir yul med pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul ni phyi rol na med pa'i phyir yul med pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The silver that is the object of the attachment does not exist externally, therefore it is said to be ‚Äúwithout an object.‚Äù

original: yul med pa'i phyir 'don pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir 'don pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the object is nonexistent.

original: don la yang dngul gyi yul med pa yin no zhes 'brel par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don la yang dngul gyi yul med pa yin no zhes 'brel par bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the object of silver is nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyod pa'i yul med pa'i phyir na'o zhes bya ba ni khyab pa brjod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: spyod pa'i yul med pa'i phyir na'o zhes bya ba ni khyab pa brjod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the object of activity is nonexistent‚Äù states the pervasion.

original: des na gang med pa de ni yul med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gang med pa de ni yul med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever is nonexistent is without an object,

original: dper na skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the hairs and so on that are seen by someone with an eye disease.

original: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma 'dod do //üîΩming dang mtshan ma don las lhag par zhen par byas pa ni yul med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngul yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma 'dod do // ming dang mtshan ma don las lhag par zhen par byas pa ni yul med pa ma yin te /
translated: The silver that is the object of the attachment is nonexistent.

original: yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name and the sign that is the object of the attachment are not without an object because they exist.üîΩThis is the statement of the reason.

original: 'di ni lhag par med pa de ni yul med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lhag par med pa de ni yul med pa yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the pervasion.

original: dper na skra shad la sogs pa 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni dngul ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na skra shad la sogs pa 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni dngul ni zhes pa'o //
translated: For example, it is not tenable that this hair and so on is silver.

original: gang gi phyir yul yongs su 'dzin na yul na mi gnas par mi 'gyur ba de bas na ming dang mtshan ma'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul yongs su 'dzin na yul na mi gnas par mi 'gyur ba de bas na ming dang mtshan ma'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Because when an object is apprehended, it is not that it does not exist as an object, therefore it does not apprehend the object of names and signs.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i yul mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang sgro 'dogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i yul mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang sgro 'dogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because it does not apprehend the object of names and signs and because superimposition is untenable.

original: 'on te yang ming la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa sgra'i rtogs pas ni nye bar btags nas don 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang ming la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa sgra'i rtogs pas ni nye bar btags nas don 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: But if the apprehension of names and so on is the apprehension of objects by the understanding that arises from sound,

original: des @65a * //
analyzed: des @65a * //
translated: then

original: na 'jug pa'i yul yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bram ze zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: na 'jug pa'i yul yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bram ze zhes gsungs so //
translated: in response to the qualm that it is the object of engagement, the text says, ‚ÄúBrahmin.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa'i ming rtogs par byed pa ming btags pas bzung ba de bzhin du don ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa 'khrul pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa'i ming rtogs par byed pa ming btags pas bzung ba de bzhin du don ni sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa 'khrul pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the apprehension of the name imputed to a Brahmin boy is apprehended by the name imputed, in the same way, the object is not apprehended by the mistaken understanding that arises from sound.

original: des na ming dang mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni nye bar btags nas don 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'on te ming dang mtshan ma 'dzin pa yin yang shin tu goms pa'i phyir na don la 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ming dang mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni nye bar btags nas don 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // 'on te ming dang mtshan ma 'dzin pa yin yang shin tu goms pa'i phyir na don la 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the apprehension of name and sign is the apprehension of the object by way of designation.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩshin tu goms pa las ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni lan no // shin tu goms pa las ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the apprehension of name and sign, then it is not an error with regard to the object because of thorough habituation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúbecause of the absence of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained: ‚Äúbecause of the absence of valid cognition with regard to that.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i yul nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i yul nyid du'o //
translated: In that way, it is the object of meditation.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs par ro //
translated: Otherwise, it is not.

original: ming dang mtshan ma yang tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir na goms pa'i yul ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma yang tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir na goms pa'i yul ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the name and sign are not the object of valid cognition, and therefore are not the object of habituation.

original: tha snyad du gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid las de sgrub pa'i tshad ma grub po zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gzhan du ni tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid las de sgrub pa'i tshad ma grub po zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gzhan du ni tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm because it is not tenable that it is different conventionally, the valid cognition that establishes that is established is it is not tenable that it is different conventionally.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is no.

original: de lta ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase even if it is not like that is a response to the qualm.

original: ming dang mtshan ma med kyang ngo //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma med kyang ngo //
translated: Even though there is no name and no sign, it is said it is explained.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩji srid rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //üîΩshes pa la mtshungs min zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / ji srid rang gi ngo bo la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so // shes pa la mtshungs min zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.

original: shes pa la zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba dgod pa'o //üîΩgal te ming dang mtshan ma bzhin du 'dir yang sun 'byin par mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa la zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba dgod pa'o // gal te ming dang mtshan ma bzhin du 'dir yang sun 'byin par mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: The phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.

original: bag chags kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ga las snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ga las snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.üîΩThe phrase it is explained is a response to the qualm.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan mas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan mas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy others‚Äù means by names and signs.

original: ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag ma yin la rtogs pa ni shes pa kho na yin no zhes bstan ba'i don du ming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag ma yin la rtogs pa ni shes pa kho na yin no zhes bstan ba'i don du ming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The realization of names and signs is not a part of conventional usage, but realization is just knowledge. In order to teach this, he says ‚Äúnames and signs.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po bsal ba'i don brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po bsal ba'i don brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to state the meaning of the first objection, he says ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: ma rtogs pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam gyis sun phyung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam gyis sun phyung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the mere non-realization of the object is not a part of conventional usage.

original: ji ltar don nyid du ma rtogs snyam na rang gi ngo bos zhes @65b gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar don nyid du ma rtogs snyam na rang gi ngo bos zhes @65b gsungs so //
translated: How is it that the object is not realized? He says ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù

original: de ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not so‚Äù means that it is not a name or a sign.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po la gzhan gyi rnam pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po la gzhan gyi rnam pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is not conceived as something other than what it is.

original: ming dang mtshan ma ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: Name and sign is the form of understanding that is unclear due to conceptualization.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is conceptualization.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de na gsungs te rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i ming la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de na gsungs te rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i ming la sogs pa la'o //
translated: It is stated: in regard to the name, etc. that are understood through conceptualization.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la yang zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la yang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Also in regard to name and sign is stated.

original: don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The form of the object is what is engaged.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi rnam par rtog pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir te rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: don gyi rnam par rtog pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir te rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the conceptualization of the object is not tenable, because it is the apprehender of mere intrinsic reality.

original: / don gyi rnam pa nyid khas len pa la yang sun 'byin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / don gyi rnam pa nyid khas len pa la yang sun 'byin pa brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one accepts the form of the object, the refutation will be stated.

original: shes pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni don gyi ma yin la ming la sogs pa'i yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni don gyi ma yin la ming la sogs pa'i yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: By consciousness itself is not by the object, nor by name, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore is because of that.

original: bar gyi sha lhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa dang / de dag gi bar na gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar gyi sha lhag pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa dang / de dag gi bar na gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúintervening flesh‚Äù is the absence of a form, and the meaning of ‚Äúlocated between them‚Äù is that it is located between those two.

original: gzhan la med ming te zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba bshad par 'gyur ro shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid zhes bya bar ni 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la med ming te zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba bshad par 'gyur ro shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid zhes bya bar ni 'thad pa yin te /
translated: The root text will explain the meaning of ‚Äúnot existing in another,‚Äù and it is reasonable to say that consciousness has the aspect of an object.

original: rang rig pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is realized by the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness.

original: sgra las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gang gis dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba de'i don gyi rnam pa nyid ni dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba de'i don gyi rnam pa nyid ni dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of an object that is not the cause of the collection of sense faculties becoming fruitless is not a real entity.

original: 'on kyang don la brgyud nas skyed pa'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa don gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin te tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don la brgyud nas skyed pa'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa don gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin te tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is reasonable to say that consciousness, which is indirectly produced by an object, is mistaken and has the aspect of an object, because it is established by valid knowledge.

original: ming dang mtshan ma yang don gyi rnam pa can du 'grub po snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma yang don gyi rnam pa can du 'grub po snyam na bshad pa /
translated: If you think that a name and a sign are established as having the aspect of an object, then it is said:

original: rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i ming dang mtshan ma 'khrul pas na don gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag las grub pa yin gyi ming dang mtshan ma las ni don gyi rnam pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i ming dang mtshan ma 'khrul pas na don gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag las grub pa yin gyi ming dang mtshan ma las ni don gyi rnam pa nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the aspect of the object is established from these, but the aspect of the object is not established from the name and sign.

original: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you wonder why,

original: blo ni khas len med phyir zhes lan rtsa bar gsal lo //
analyzed: blo ni khas len med phyir zhes lan rtsa bar gsal lo //
translated: the answer is clear in the root text: ‚Äúbecause the mind is without assertion.‚ÄùüîΩThe purpose is stated in the lines:

original: / gang gi rang bzhin myong min pa //
analyzed: / gang gi rang bzhin myong min pa //
translated: That which is not experienced by nature

original: de ni de yi rig byed min //üîΩzhes bya ba dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de yi rig byed min // zhes bya ba dgos pa'o //
translated: is not its indicator.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang 'dzin par byed pa de nyid khas blangs nas rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni de don gyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩming dang mtshan ma'i tshad ma ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yin na de ji ltar @66a * //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang 'dzin par byed pa de nyid khas blangs nas rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni de don gyi zhes bya ba'o // ming dang mtshan ma'i tshad ma ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yin na de ji ltar @66a * //
translated: In the context of the position that there are no aspects, the opponent‚Äôs position is accepted and then the response is given: ‚ÄúIf it is the object . . .‚Äù

original: gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the valid cognition of name and sign is a conceptual cognition, how can it apprehend the nature of the object as it is?

original: ji ltar don gyi rnam pa nyid du 'dzin na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi rnam pa nyid du 'dzin na /
translated: How can it apprehend the aspect of the object as it is?

original: gang gis shes pa'i don nyid kyis rnam pa bzhin du 'khrul par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis shes pa'i don nyid kyis rnam pa bzhin du 'khrul par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be understood that the object of consciousness is mistaken, like the form?

original: des na ming dang mtshan ma'i don gyi rnam pa can yin pa la ni tshang ma ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ming dang mtshan ma'i don gyi rnam pa can yin pa la ni tshang ma ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no such thing as a form that is the object of a name and a sign.

original: gal te don gyi rnam pa ming dang mtshan ma las tha dad pa yin na ni tshad ma med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te don gyi rnam pa ming dang mtshan ma las tha dad pa yin na ni tshad ma med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the form of the object were different from the name and the sign, there would be no valid cognition.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were not different, there would be no such problem.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩrnam par rtog pas rtogs pa de'i don dang ldan par dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no // rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa de'i don dang ldan par dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were different, then,

original: rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i rnam pa ming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i rnam pa ming dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pas na'o //
translated: since the form of the object would be different from the name and the sign, it would not be grasped by conceptual cognition.üîΩBut it is grasped by conceptual cognition.

original: bas na zhes bya ba ni de phyir ro //
analyzed: bas na zhes bya ba ni de phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the form of the object is not different from the name and the sign.üîΩIf the form of the object were not different from the name and the sign, then the form of the object would not be the basis of the name and the sign.

original: de yang mi rigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: But it is the basis.üîΩTherefore, the form of the object is not the same as the name and the sign.

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid du sgro btags pa las 'jug par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid du sgro btags pa las 'jug par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection to the fear of engagement due to the reification of the function of an object is:

original: lhag par sgro btags pa las zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa las zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äúdue to the reification of the special.‚Äù

original: / bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de ni zhes pa nyid kyis zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: / bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de ni zhes pa nyid kyis zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù refers to ‚Äúthat aspect‚Äù and ‚Äújust that.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin pa zhes pas ni shes pa'i rnam pa la sgro btags par khas len na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa zhes pas ni shes pa'i rnam pa la sgro btags par khas len na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if one accepts the reification of the aspect of consciousness.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la don bya ba byed pa sgro btags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la don bya ba byed pa sgro btags par 'gyur la /
translated: The function of an object would be reified as the name and the sign.

original: des ming dang mtshan ma de la yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan btags dgos so //
analyzed: des ming dang mtshan ma de la yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan btags dgos so //
translated: And by that, one would have to reify another name and sign in regard to that name and sign.

original: de bzhin du de la yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med do //
translated: And likewise, since there would be another in regard to that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la lhag par sgro 'dogs par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la lhag par sgro 'dogs par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that the special is reified in the aspect of consciousness.

original: khas len na yang tshad can min //
analyzed: khas len na yang tshad can min //
translated: Even if one accepts, it is not unlimited.

original: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is:

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ming dang mtshan mar snang ba la yang shes pa'i rnam pa la phyi rol du 'khrul pa bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du 'dod na ni ming dang mtshan ma cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ming dang mtshan mar snang ba la yang shes pa'i rnam pa la phyi rol du 'khrul pa bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du 'dod na ni ming dang mtshan ma cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it is accepted that the appearance of names and signs is like the error of external objects in the aspect of consciousness, then there would be no names and signs at all.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa nyid la de 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa nyid la de 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If it is said that they are established in the consciousness of error,

original: bshad pa 'khrul pa'i shes pas bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'khrul pa'i shes pas bya ba'o //
translated: it is explained that they are the activity of the consciousness of error.

original: lhag ma bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma bshad pa'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In order to explain the remainder, anticipating an objection,

original: rnam pa de nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid ces bya ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThat very aspect.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The aspect of blue, etc., is unclear.

original: don ni ming dang mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: don ni ming dang mtshan ma'o //
translated: The object is the name and sign.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and so on is the response.

original: gal te de lta na shes pa'i rnam pa bzhin du ming dang mtshan ma la sgro btags pa yang don la 'jug par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas shes pa'i don gyi rnam pa can du khas len @66b na ni zhes gsungs
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes pa'i rnam pa bzhin du ming dang mtshan ma la sgro btags pa yang don la 'jug par byed pa nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas shes pa'i don gyi rnam pa can du khas len @66b na ni zhes gsungs
translated: If it is like that, it is suspected that the superimposition of names and signs, like the aspect of consciousness, is what engages the object. Anticipating this, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is accepted that the object of consciousness has the aspect of the object.‚Äù

original: so // don gyi rnam pa nyid la sgro btags pa yin par rigs te shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so // don gyi rnam pa nyid la sgro btags pa yin par rigs te shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable that the aspect of the object is superimposed, because it is of the nature of consciousness and is seen.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the name or the sign,

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not of their nature and is not seen.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par shes pa kha skong ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par shes pa kha skong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all respects‚Äù means that consciousness is supplemented by the aspect.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad ni rnam pa med pa dang don dang ldan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad ni rnam pa med pa dang don dang ldan pa yang yin no //
translated: If all consciousnesses are without aspects and are endowed with objects,

original: de na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang don kho na ltar khas blang par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang don kho na ltar khas blang par bya ba yin no //
translated: then it must be accepted that conceptual consciousnesses also have objects.

original: des rnam pa de lta bur 'khrul pa'i blo skyes pa nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ces dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
analyzed: des rnam pa de lta bur 'khrul pa'i blo skyes pa nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no zhes ji ltar brjod ces dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
translated: How can it be said that the mind that is born in the form of an error engages in its object in that way?

original: shes pa thams cad ni rnam pa med pa kho na yin pa de phyi rol snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ni rnam pa med pa kho na yin pa de phyi rol snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las rtogs snyam na /
translated: If all consciousnesses are without aspects, how do you know that external objects appear in them?

original: rnam pa 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the mode.

original: shes pa thams cad yul ni tha dad pa can kho na yin pa'i phyir na ma 'khrul pa dang rnam pa med par sems blo shes pa thams cad ni don dang ldan par mi 'thad de rmi lam la sogs par phyi rol med par shes pa mthong ba'i
analyzed: shes pa thams cad yul ni tha dad pa can kho na yin pa'i phyir na ma 'khrul pa dang rnam pa med par sems blo shes pa thams cad ni don dang ldan par mi 'thad de rmi lam la sogs par phyi rol med par shes pa mthong ba'i
translated: Because all consciousnesses have different objects, it is not tenable that any consciousness, cognition, or awareness that is nonerroneous and without aspect has a meaning, because consciousness is seen to occur without external objects in dreams and so on.

original: phyir ro // rmi lam du yang ming la sogs pa mi ldan pa'i 'du byed la brten nas mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: phyir ro // rmi lam du yang ming la sogs pa mi ldan pa'i 'du byed la brten nas mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that in dreams one sees based on formations that do not possess names and so on,

original: 'du byed las kyang min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed las kyang min zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that it is not from formations.

original: ci'i phyir 'du byed las dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du byed las dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not observed from formations?

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sngon po la sogs par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sngon po la sogs par zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is because of observing the contradictory, that is, blue and so on.

original: rmi lam du rmis pa ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam du rmis pa ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: In dreams, what is dreamt is not blue and so on,

original: thogs med phyir na ste /
analyzed: thogs med phyir na ste /
translated: because it is unimpeded.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an obstruction to the arising of another in its own place.

original: bar ma do'i gzugs bzhin du thogs pa med pa nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bar ma do'i gzugs bzhin du thogs pa med pa nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: It is like the form of the intermediate existence, which is unobstructed.

original: de shes yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de shes yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is consciousness, he says.

original: gzhan gyi sems bzhin du lha'i mig gis blta bar bya ba yin yang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems bzhin du lha'i mig gis blta bar bya ba yin yang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is like the mind of another, which is seen by the divine eye, but it is not common to all,

original: bar ma dor yang shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor yang shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: so it is consciousness even in the intermediate existence.

original: de lta na yang gzung ba yin yang phyi rol du ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzung ba yin yang phyi rol du ma grub po //
translated: Even so, it is an object, but it is not established as external.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi la sogs pa yang shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi la sogs pa yang shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: The person, which has the nature of blue, etc., is also consciousness,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang gzung ba nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang gzung ba nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because it is not common to all and because it is not perceived as an object.

original: des ni ming sogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des ni ming sogs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that it is name, etc.

original: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is so, he says.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam par dbye bar myong ba tsam gyi don dang ldan pa yin na'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam par dbye bar myong ba tsam gyi don dang ldan pa yin na'o //
translated: It is the mere experience of the object that is distinguished as being in front.

original: 'khrul pa dang zhes bya ba @67a * //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang zhes bya ba @67a * //
translated: The error, he says, is that

original: ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: it is a refutation.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na yang zhes bya ba rnam par dbye ba yod par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na yang zhes bya ba rnam par dbye ba yod par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If it is with an object, then there is the possibility of a distinction.

original: thams cad dmigs pa med pa la yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad dmigs pa med pa la yang tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: The response to the question is: ‚ÄúEven without an object, there is a distinction between valid and invalid cognition.‚Äù

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case,‚Äù he says,

original: ci thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te dmigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la lan gang yin zhes dogs pa la lan du dmigs pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te dmigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la lan gang yin zhes dogs pa la lan du dmigs pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äúis everything with an object or without an object?‚Äù The response to this question is: ‚ÄúIt is without an object.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid de kho na yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid de kho na yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa /
translated: How can this be reality?

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par ni mi 'thad do zhes 'brel to ;
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa dang bcas par ni mi 'thad do zhes 'brel to ;
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that it is with an object.‚Äù

original: / ji ltar zhe na rmi lam la sogs ba dag na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na rmi lam la sogs ba dag na zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is it not tenable? He says, ‚ÄúIn dreams and so on.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mdun na gnas par 'dzin pa ni ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdun na gnas par 'dzin pa ni ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is uncertain that one apprehends it as present in front of oneself, it is not possible to establish that it has an objective support.

original: gal te sad ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang de ltar ci ste mi 'dod pa zhes dogs pa bsu nas bzlog par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sad ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang de ltar ci ste mi 'dod pa zhes dogs pa bsu nas bzlog par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one were to object, ‚ÄúSince the state of having an objective support is perceived in the waking state, why is it not accepted in the same way in other states?,‚Äù the response is ‚Äúno.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the state of having an objective support is not established.

original: gzung bar bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object that is grasped is not perceived.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe state of having an objective support.‚Äù

original: gar yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang ngo //
analyzed: gar yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnywhere‚Äù means even in the waking state.

original: des na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med pa nyid de kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pas dmigs pa med pa nyid de kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the state of having an objective support is not tenable, it is only the state of having no objective support that is tenable.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa grub pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa grub pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúIn the waking state‚Äù anticipates the objection that the state of having an objective support is established.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa brjod pa nas lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa brjod pa nas lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then‚Äù indicates the response to the objection that has been stated.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni shes pa dmigs pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni shes pa dmigs pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then‚Äù indicates that because consciousness is without an object, it is not consciousness.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba phyi rol med par yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba phyi rol med par yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it is seen that there is no external reality.

original: 'du byed las kyang mi na zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir na dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed las kyang mi na zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir na dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not from compositional activity‚Äù is stated to explain this, and the response to the objection is ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ming dang mtshan ma yin no zhe na ming dang mtshan ma la ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ming dang mtshan ma yin no zhe na ming dang mtshan ma la ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you say that the aspects of blue and so on are the names and the signs, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe names and signs . . .‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩthogs med phyir na sngo sogs mi na //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir / thogs med phyir na sngo sogs mi na //
translated: Because the aspects of blue and so on do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni der zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni der zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚ÄúIt is not blue and so on because it is unimpeded‚Äù is ‚ÄúThere . . .‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa la'o //üîΩsngon po la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa la'o // sngon po la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: That is, in the case of a consciousness in a dream.üîΩ‚ÄúThe aspects of blue and so on‚Äù

original: bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to real blue and so on.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'bad ce @67b na rnam pa de ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'bad ce @67b na rnam pa de ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why not strive for that?

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi mthun pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro // mi mthun pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The aspect of that is not like a real blue, etc.üîΩThe non-similarity is shown by ‚Äúbecause it is reversed.‚Äù

original: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because unobstructedness exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ltar la yang zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de ltar la yang zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: Why is that?üîΩ‚ÄúEven though it is like that,‚Äù

original: rnam pa des so //
analyzed: rnam pa des so //
translated: by that aspect.

original: reg par zhes bya ba ni bcad par ro //
analyzed: reg par zhes bya ba ni bcad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTouching‚Äù means cutting.

original: de nyid du bden pa'i glang po'i khyu yod pas na de mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid du bden pa'i glang po'i khyu yod pas na de mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that because a real herd of elephants exists there, one sees them,

original: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äúby whom‚Äù is stated.

original: 'o na phyi rol na 'dug pa mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na phyi rol na 'dug pa mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that one sees them as external,

original: bcad pa'i nang nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcad pa'i nang nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äúfrom within the enclosure‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi phyi rol na 'dug pa mthong bar 'gyur ba sgo bcad pa'i nang nas skyes bu phyir 'gro ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyi rol na 'dug pa mthong bar 'gyur ba sgo bcad pa'i nang nas skyes bu phyir 'gro ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for a person to go out from within the enclosure, the door of which is closed, and see what is outside.

original: des na rmi lam du mthong ba ni phyi rol dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam du mthong ba ni phyi rol dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is seen in a dream is not in accordance with external reality.

original: phyi'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir yang de dang mi 'dra ba nyid du brjod pa ni glang po'i khyu'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir yang de dang mi 'dra ba nyid du brjod pa ni glang po'i khyu'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And because the external effect is not seen, it is said to be unlike that, like the effect of an elephant herd.

original: 'on te ji ltar shing bcad pa la sogs pa med pa de ltar de'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar shing bcad pa la sogs pa med pa de ltar de'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is like the absence of a cut tree, etc., then it is like that in its nature.

original: me'i 'bras bu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu zhes gsungs so //
translated: The effect of fire is said.

original: glang po'i khyu'i rang bzhin de 'dra ba yin yang me'i rang bzhin ni de 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: glang po'i khyu'i rang bzhin de 'dra ba yin yang me'i rang bzhin ni de 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the nature of an elephant herd is like that, the nature of fire is not like that,

original: sred par mi nus pa ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred par mi nus pa ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is incapable of burning is not fire.

original: des na gal te rmi lam du rtogs pa'i me bden pa nyid yin na de'i 'bras bu tshig pa la sogs pas sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te rmi lam du rtogs pa'i me bden pa nyid yin na de'i 'bras bu tshig pa la sogs pas sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the fire that is realized in a dream were real, its effect, such as burning, would be seen even in the waking state.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te des na rmi lam du mthong ba ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te des na rmi lam du mthong ba ni bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: But it is not so. Therefore, what is seen in a dream is erroneous with respect to a real blue, etc.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba mi mthun pa yin yang phyi rol nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba mi mthun pa yin yang phyi rol nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni / gal te zhes bya ba'o // de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: Even though what is seen in a dream is not in accord with reality, the following is stated to anticipate the doubt that it is external:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is external, why is it not seen by others?‚Äù

original: phyi rol nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid yin na'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf it were so,‚Äù i.e., if it were external.

original: shes pa las tha mi dad pa ni thams cad kyis mi mthong bar 'thad kyi tha dad na go ji ltar des na sad pa thams cad dang gzhan gyis kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa las tha mi dad pa ni thams cad kyis mi mthong bar 'thad kyi tha dad na go ji ltar des na sad pa thams cad dang gzhan gyis kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were external, it would be seen by all, since it is not different from consciousness. But if it were different, how could it be seen by all who are awake and by others?

original: gzhan gyis de la zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de la zhes smras te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúOthers do not see it.‚Äù

original: sad pa de la de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: sad pa de la de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: The point is that it is not seen because the assemblage of conditions for that is not present for those who are awake.

original: gang zhig ma tshang ba mthong ba'i tshogs pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ma tshang ba mthong ba'i tshogs pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the assemblage that is seen as incomplete?

original: gnyid tshogs pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid tshogs pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The assemblage of sleep.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIf that were so, it would not be so.‚Äù

original: thal ba las bzlog pa ni de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa ni de ltar ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of the consequence is ‚Äúit is not so.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir @68a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @68a * //
translated: Why?

original: snyam na yul de nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snyam na yul de nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúin that very place.‚Äù

original: gang du gnyid log pa gcig gis glang po mthong ba'i yul de nyid du gzhan gyis ni ri kho na mthong ste des na de ni mthong bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du gnyid log pa gcig gis glang po mthong ba'i yul de nyid du gzhan gyis ni ri kho na mthong ste des na de ni mthong bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In that very place where one person who is asleep sees an elephant, another person sees only a mound. Therefore it is not a seer.

original: 'o na bag chags yongs su smin pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'o na bag chags yongs su smin pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Well, the ripening of habitual tendencies is the cause of grasping,

original: de yang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: and that is not the same.

original: des na thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba ma yin no zhes gzhan dag gis smras pa ni /
analyzed: des na thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba ma yin no zhes gzhan dag gis smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore others say, ‚ÄúNot everything is seen by everyone.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing in another way‚Äù is the other way.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is the establishment of the text.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan med pas na'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan med pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFormations‚Äù are the tenets. ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is because there is no other.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'du byed pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'du byed pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the formative forces.

original: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
translated: Why?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes pa 'du byed las skyes kyang rang la brten pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes pa 'du byed las skyes kyang rang la brten pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because, although consciousness is born from the formative forces, like visual consciousness, it does not have a special basis in itself, therefore, it would grasp everything.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù means external things.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i khyad par yod na ni thams cad 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i khyad par yod na ni thams cad 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If there is a special form, then it does not grasp everything.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: gang gi phyir thogs pa med pa'i gzugs skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thogs pa med pa'i gzugs skyes pa yin na /
translated: Since form that is not impeded is born,

original: nye ba mtha' dag gis 'dzin par 'gyur ba las rnam par phye nas kyang 'dzin pa yin te /üîΩde'i phyir rmi lam du ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: nye ba mtha' dag gis 'dzin par 'gyur ba las rnam par phye nas kyang 'dzin pa yin te / de'i phyir rmi lam du ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: it is grasped by all that is near, and it is also grasped by that which is separated.

original: thogs pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang skyes pa med do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang skyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in a dream, there is no birth of any external blue, etc. that is impeded or not impeded.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don bshad pa ni rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don bshad pa ni rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is explained: because it is apprehended as different.

original: de nyid 'o na ji ltar tha dad pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid 'o na ji ltar tha dad pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is it different?

original: sngon mthong na 'du byed pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dbye ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon mthong na 'du byed pa'i stobs kyis rnam par dbye ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni sngon gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it would be different if it were distinguished by the power of the formative forces when it was previously seen. This is the ‚Äúprevious nature.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: sngon mthong ba gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúby the previous seeing.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to blue, etc.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sngon ma mthong bas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sngon ma mthong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù refers to what was not previously seen.

original: gal te sngon gyi rang bzhin mthong ba na rnam par phye nas mthong ba 'thad pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi rang bzhin mthong ba na rnam par phye nas mthong ba 'thad pa yin na'o //
translated: If the previous nature is seen, it is tenable that it is seen as distinguished.

original: na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù refers to another.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sngon gyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sngon gyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified: ‚Äúthe previous.‚Äù

original: de'i dus su ni da ltar gyi dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su ni da ltar gyi dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù refers to the present time.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the answer.

original: dngos po de'i 'dus pa'i zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de'i 'dus pa'i zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe composite of that thing‚Äù is the context.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? Because it does not exist.

original: rmi @68b lam du ni shi ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi @68b lam du ni shi ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees death in a dream.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù is anticipating an objection.

original: de'i dus na med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist at that time.

original: gcig snang ba la log par 'dod dam yang na snang ba la log par 'dod /
analyzed: gcig snang ba la log par 'dod dam yang na snang ba la log par 'dod /
translated: Do you assert that it is mistaken in the appearance of one thing, or do you assert that it is mistaken in the appearance?

original: re zhig rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: First, to eliminate the second conception, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is mistaken in the appearance of one thing. . . . ‚Äù

original: de'i tshe phyin ci ma log tu mngon par 'dod pa de la phyin ci log nyid ces bya ba'i chos su gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyin ci ma log tu mngon par 'dod pa de la phyin ci log nyid ces bya ba'i chos su gyur pa /
translated: At that time, the one who is asserted to be nonerroneous has a property called ‚Äúmistakenness.

original: phyin ci log yod min /
analyzed: phyin ci log yod min /
translated: ‚Äù Mistakenness does not exist.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say‚Äù is a connection.

original: snang ba 'ang yin la log pa'ang yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba 'ang yin la log pa'ang yin no zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is both an appearance and mistaken‚Äù is not a connection. This is the meaning.

original: 'on te snang ba yin yang rmi lam du mthong ba phyin ci log nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba yin yang rmi lam du mthong ba phyin ci log nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that although it appears, seeing it in a dream is mistaken,üîΩthen the reply is ‚ÄúAll that is seen in the waking state is like that.‚Äù

original: thams cad ces gsungs te thams cad ces bya ba ni sad pas mthong ba'i bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces gsungs te thams cad ces bya ba ni sad pas mthong ba'i bden pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú All that‚Äù refers to the true blue and so on that is seen in the waking state.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log nyid du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Like that‚Äù refers to being mistaken.

original: de ltar 'dzin par khas len pa min pa na ni phyin ci log nyid med pa'i phyin ci ma log pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩde dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin par khas len pa min pa na ni phyin ci log nyid med pa'i phyin ci ma log pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / de dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you do not accept that it is apprehended in that way, then in order to demonstrate that there is no nonmistaken consciousness that is not mistaken, the text says:

original: sad pas mthong ba dag kyang phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sad pas mthong ba dag kyang phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who see in the waking state are also like that.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that all that is seen in the waking state is like that, that is, it appears but is mistaken,

original: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa mthong ba thams cad snang ba ste shes pa yin pa'i phyir log pa yin na 'o na ni log pa nyid du 'dod pa'i log pa nyid gang gang la ltos nas ni log pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ma yin
analyzed: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa mthong ba thams cad snang ba ste shes pa yin pa'i phyir log pa yin na 'o na ni log pa nyid du 'dod pa'i log pa nyid gang gang la ltos nas ni log pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ma yin
translated: then if all that is seen in the waking state and in dreams is mistaken because it is consciousness that is appearance, then the mistaken that is asserted as mistaken is not posited as mistaken in dependence on what?

original: no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of the error itself‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is to be supplied here.

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i phyin ci log pa yang phyin ci log gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i phyin ci log pa yang phyin ci log gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: And in the same way, the error of a thing is not dependent on another error.

original: des na thams cad rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na thams cad rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, everything would be just one nature,

original: rnam par dbye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be no differentiation.

original: gzhan la ni rmi lam du mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni rmi lam du mthong ba la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù refers to what is seen in a dream.

original: de ni dang po gsal ba'i phyir ci ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni dang po gsal ba'i phyir ci ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that? He says, ‚Äúbecause it is clear at the outset.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag snang ba kho na phyin ci log pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag snang ba kho na phyin ci log pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: Others say that the appearance itself is erroneous, but not the object,

original: mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes ston pas phyin ci log tu snang ba nyid du gzhung 'dzugs pa ni snang ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes ston pas phyin ci log tu snang ba nyid du gzhung 'dzugs pa ni snang ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is not seen. He says, ‚ÄúThe appearance is the establishment of the object as having an erroneous appearance,‚Äù in order to show that the appearance is the establishment of the object as having an erroneous appearance.

original: de gang yin snyam na phyin ci log ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de gang yin snyam na phyin ci log ces bya ba ste /
translated: What is that? He says, ‚Äúerror.‚Äù

original: don rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa gzhan du 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa gzhan du 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of an object that has become something else as being something else.üîΩBut if the object is also erroneous,

original: 'o na don kyang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes na /
analyzed: 'o na don kyang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes na /
translated: then what is the error?

original: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù is stated.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin gang gis don gzhan yang de ltar phyin ci log nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyin ci log gzhan gang yin pa de ni gzhan don gyi yin @69a * //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin gang gis don gzhan yang de ltar phyin ci log nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyin ci log gzhan gang yin pa de ni gzhan don gyi yin @69a * //
translated: By which appearance, another object is understood in that way as erroneous, whatever other appearance is the nature of error, that is for the sake of others.

original: no ; / ci'i phyir zhe na tha dad pa'i don las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: no ; / ci'i phyir zhe na tha dad pa'i don las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why? Because it is different from the different object.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni don gyi rang bzhin med par mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni don gyi rang bzhin med par mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa dmigs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The conclusion is that because the nature of the object is seen to be nonexistent, the realization is indeed objectless.

original: phyin ci log gzhan snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gzhan snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that it is not another error that appears is ‚ÄúIf that is so, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù refers to the aspect of blue, etc.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of the doctrine of objectlessness is ‚ÄúIn that case‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: der zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dus su'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to the time of the dream.

original: ji ltar de don du mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de don du mthong zhe na /
translated: How is it seen as having that meaning?

original: 'du byed las ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed las ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúfrom formations.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means in the aspect of the seen blue, etc.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa ni mthong ba de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa ni mthong ba de'i phyir na /
translated: Since what does not exist is seen,

original: de'i tshe na de ltar skyes pa'i shes rab kho na rang rig pa yin gyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de ltar skyes pa'i shes rab kho na rang rig pa yin gyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: at that time, only the wisdom that arises in that way is reflexive awareness, not the object.

original: yul gzhan na yul gzhan du mthong zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs pa tsam du zad de dngos po la ni ji ltar dus gzhan na yod pa dus gzhan du mthong ba med pa de bzhin du yul gzhan yod pa yang yul gzhan du mi mthong ngo
analyzed: yul gzhan na yul gzhan du mthong zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs pa tsam du zad de dngos po la ni ji ltar dus gzhan na yod pa dus gzhan du mthong ba med pa de bzhin du yul gzhan yod pa yang yul gzhan du mi mthong ngo
translated: The statement ‚ÄúAn object in one place is seen in another place‚Äù is merely an assertion, but in reality, just as something that exists at one time is not seen at another time, so too, an object that exists in one place is not seen in another place.

original: // de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: des na shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyab pa gang la yod pa bsal zin pa'i phyogs kyang rjes su brjod nas lhag pa brjod pa'i don du bshad zin pa'i skyon nyid zlos pa ni gal te dus gzhan yang zhes
analyzed: des na shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i khyab pa gang la yod pa bsal zin pa'i phyogs kyang rjes su brjod nas lhag pa brjod pa'i don du bshad zin pa'i skyon nyid zlos pa ni gal te dus gzhan yang zhes
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the object of the other consciousnesses is not like that of the first,üîΩthen the object of the first consciousness is not like that of the other consciousnesses.‚Äù
