original: bya ba'o // ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba'o // ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa smra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the response of the opponent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de la zhes smos te ka ba la sogs pa mthong ba de'o /
analyzed: de la zhes smos te ka ba la sogs pa mthong ba de'o /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is seen.‚Äù

original: re zhig gnod byed ma skyes pa tsam ni gnod med ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gnod byed ma skyes pa tsam ni gnod med ma yin te /
translated: The mere nonarising of the object of refutation is not a nondefective object of knowledge,

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: 'on kyang gnod byed pa las gzhan shes pa kho na yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni gnod byed med pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod byed pa las gzhan shes pa kho na yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni gnod byed med pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, the response that the object of knowledge is only consciousness, which is different from the object of refutation, is ‚Äúbecause the object of refutation does not exist.‚Äù

original: gang gis phyin ci log tu snang bar 'gyur ba gang yang rung ba ni gnod byed med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis phyin ci log tu snang bar 'gyur ba gang yang rung ba ni gnod byed med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That which appears in a distorted way is not a nondefective object of knowledge.

original: 'on kyang thob pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni don thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thob pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni don thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that the nature of the cognition is the attainment, then the response is: ‚ÄúBecause the object is attained.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang nyes pa nyid yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang nyes pa nyid yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the fault is stated:

original: don thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe attainment of the object is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: ha cang thal ba spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni don yod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni don yod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm that this is absurd is: ‚ÄúBecause the object exists.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that when one sees a pillar, for example, it is not a case of seeing something that does not exist, the response is: ‚ÄúBecause the object is seen.‚ÄùüîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not the case that the object is not seen?‚Äù the response is: ‚ÄúBecause the object is seen.‚Äù

analyzed: shes pa ma yin te /

original: gal te ngo shes pa gzhan dang 'dra ba'i phyir skye ba gzhan du mthong ba las yang sngar mthong ba nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ngo shes par 'gyur ba gzhan dang zhes bya ba'o //

translated: If you think that recognition is like another cognition, and that the prior seeing is inferred from the seeing in another life, then the response to this is: ‚ÄúRecognition is like another cognition . . .‚Äù

original: gal te 'dir yang ngo shes pa nyid las sngon mthong ba nyid 'grub pa na rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas dri za'i grong khyer zhes smras so //

original: ji ltar med snyam na de la ni zhes smras te /

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dag la'o //

original: de lta yin na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //

original: bden pa'i bum pa la sogs pa sngar mthong ba nyid de gang gi phyir ngo shes par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas na ngos shes par bya ba @70a * //
analyzed: bden pa'i bum pa la sogs pa sngar mthong ba nyid de gang gi phyir ngo shes par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bas na ngos shes par bya ba @70a * //

original: yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de lta yin na thams cad kyang log par snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na thams cad kyang log par snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then everything would be only a false appearance.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad log par snang bar thal bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad log par snang bar thal bas so //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the consequence that all cognitions would be false appearances.

original: dan pa nyams pa yang zhes bya ba ni log par snang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: dan pa nyams pa yang zhes bya ba ni log par snang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //

original: dran pa nyams pas ni nya phyis la 'di dngul lo zhes shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar shes pa des ni tshong khang na gnas pa'i dngul nyid la yul gzhan na gnas dran pa yin te des ni shes pa des na dran pa nyams pa yin la /

translated: Because of the failure of memory, one would think that a mother-of-pearl shell is silver.üîΩIn this way, the memory of silver existing in another place is due to the cognition of silver existing in the shop. Therefore, memory would fail in that cognition.

original: de yang gal te yul gzhan na yod pa'i dngul la sogs pa nyid shes pa gzhan la snang ba yin pa ni bden pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du snang ba yin par 'gyur ro zhes gsal ba yin no //

translated: And if the silver existing in another place and so on appears in another cognition, then a real pot and so on would also appear in the same way.

original: 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin te zhes bya ba la thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang bzung ba nyid ma dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin te zhes bya ba la thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang bzung ba nyid ma dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: This is what is being said: by the fact that it is not shared and by the fact that the object is not perceived.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid kyis gsal snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid kyis gsal snyam na /

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

original: gang yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgzhan dag la 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dris so snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan dag la 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dris so snyam du bsams nas /
translated: What? Whatever.üîΩThinking that the question is about the nature of the non-worldly,

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin smra ba nyid ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is given by another.

original: lan ni 'dir brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'dir brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is stated here.üîΩThe opponent's position is refuted by the statement The object is not perceived.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten ma yin pa'i blo de ni don nyid yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes phyogs snga ma 'gog pa ni bzung ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten ma yin pa'i blo de ni don nyid yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes phyogs snga ma 'gog pa ni bzung ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is given in the statement In that case.

original: de la zhes bya ba lan te 'jig rten pa ma yin par 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba lan te 'jig rten pa ma yin par 'dod pa la'o //

original: 'di ga las zhes dogs pa la rang gi ngo bor zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes dogs pa la rang gi ngo bor zhes smos so //
translated: From where? is a doubt. From its own nature is stated.

original: 'thad pa brjod pa ni don de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa brjod pa ni don de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The justification is ‚Äúbecause that object is apprehended only in its own nature.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ma dmigs pas ni don de ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin pa yin gyi gzung ba nyid du ni ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ma dmigs pas ni don de ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin pa yin gyi gzung ba nyid du ni ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo kho nar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since it is not perceived, that object is apprehended only in its own nature, but not as an object of apprehension. Therefore, it is apprehended only in its own nature.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis don yin par dogs pa bsu nas zlog par byed pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis don yin par dogs pa bsu nas zlog par byed pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the doubt that the object is an object of apprehension, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not an object of apprehension because of the appearance of the object.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni snang ba'o //
translated: That is, it is the appearance.

original: gzung ba po rnams pa nyid kyis don nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa bkod nas sel ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam bas so //
analyzed: gzung ba po rnams pa nyid kyis don nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa bkod nas sel ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o // gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam bas so //
translated: Having formulated the objection that the object is indicated by the form of the apprehender, he responds, ‚ÄúHow can it be indicated by the form of the apprehender?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by the form of the object of apprehension.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means different from the form of the object of apprehension.

original: mthong bas ma rtogs pa'i don yang rnam par rtog pas rjes su rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu @70b ba ni don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas ma rtogs pa'i don yang rnam par rtog pas rjes su rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu @70b ba ni don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object that is not realized through seeing‚Äù is a response to the qualm that the object is realized through conceptual thought.

original: shes pa 'di ni rmi lam du mthong ba las med do zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni rmi lam du mthong ba las med do zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not being said that this cognition does not exist, like something seen in a dream‚Äù is a response to the qualm that the object is not realized through conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir de ni shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is cognition itself.

original: 'o na de ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can ming dang mtshan ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can ming dang mtshan ma yin no snyam na /

original: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / gzung ba ma dmigs pa nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / gzung ba ma dmigs pa nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: This is because it is taught to be unique and because the nonapprehension of the object is taught.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi phyed dang po'i yang gzhan gyi ltar na shes pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di nyid de 'dod pa'i don gang yin pa de dang ldan par rgyu mtshan gang gis 'dod /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi phyed dang po'i yang gzhan gyi ltar na shes pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di nyid de 'dod pa'i don gang yin pa de dang ldan par rgyu mtshan gang gis 'dod /
translated: Moreover, the root text states, ‚ÄúWhat is the reason for asserting that cognition has the object that it is said to possess?‚Äù

original: gzung ba nyid du snang bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du snang bas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not because of the appearance of the object itself,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is common to dreams, etc.

original: gnod byed med pa yang slu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod byed med pa yang slu ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of a counter-active agent is the non-deceptiveness of the cognition.

original: mi slu ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: mi slu ba kho na yin la /
translated: It is non-deceptive,

original: de yang thob pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te don nus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang thob pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te don nus zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan la ni rmi lam dang spyi la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: In other cases, the cognition of dreams, universals, etc.

original: don med pa can thos pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa de nyid /
analyzed: don med pa can thos pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa de nyid /
translated: The cognition of the non-existent is without a cause.üîΩThe explanation of that is stated by ‚Äúanother‚Äù etc.

original: de nyid rnam 'grel 'chad par byed pa na brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam 'grel 'chad par byed pa na brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba 'di don gyis bskyed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
